name: KinderTrack TX

<style>
#zt-modal-content {
width: 70% !important;
}



div.sticky {
  position: -webkit-sticky;
  position: sticky;
background-color: white;
  top: 0;
z-index: 1;
}
article {
  --img-scale: 1.001;
  --title-color: #268aca;
  --link-icon-translate: -20px;
  --link-icon-opacity: 0;
  position: relative;
  border-radius: 16px;
  box-shadow: none;
  background: #fff;
  transform-origin: center;
  transition: all 0.4s ease-in-out;
  overflow: hidden;
  border-style: outset;
  border-color: ##268aca;
}

article a::after {
  position: absolute;
  inset-block: 0;
  inset-inline: 0;
  cursor: pointer;
  content: "";
}

/* basic article elements styling */
article h2 {
  margin: 0 0 18px 0;

  font-size: 1.9rem;
  letter-spacing: 0.06em;
  color: var(--title-color);
  transition: color 0.3s ease-out;
}

figure {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  aspect-ratio: 16 / 9;
  overflow: hidden;
}

article img {
  max-width: 100%;
  transform-origin: center;
  transform: scale(var(--img-scale));
  transition: transform 0.4s ease-in-out;
}

.article-body {
  padding: 24px;
}

article a {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  text-decoration: none;
  color: #28666e;
}


article a:focus {
  outline: 1px dotted #28666e;
}

article a .icon {
  min-width: 24px;
  width: 24px;
  height: 24px;
  margin-left: 5px;
  transform: translateX(var(--link-icon-translate));
  opacity: var(--link-icon-opacity);
  transition: all 0.3s;
}

/* using the has() relational pseudo selector to update our custom properties */
article:has(:hover, :focus) {
  --img-scale: 1.1;
  --title-color: #28666e;
  --link-icon-translate: 0;
  --link-icon-opacity: 1;
  box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.16) 0px 10px 36px 0px, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06) 0px 0px 0px 1px;
}


/************************ 
Generic layout (demo looks)
**************************/

*,
*::before,
*::after {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

bbody {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 48px 0;
  font-family: "Figtree", sans-serif;
  font-size: 1.2rem;
  line-height: 1.6rem;
  background-image: linear-gradient(45deg, #7c9885, #b5b682);
  min-height: 100vh;
}

.articles {
  display: grid;
  max-width: 1000px;
  margin-inline: auto;
  padding-inline: 24px;
 max-height: 400px;
  gap: 10px;
   overflow: scroll;

}



@container card (min-width: 380px) {
  .article-wrapper {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: 150px 1fr;
    gap: 16px;
  }
  .article-body {
    padding-left: 0;
  }
  figure {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    overflow: hidden;
  }
  figure img {
   width: 100%;
    aspect-ratio: 1;
    object-fit: cover;
  }
}




#searchresults {
	font-size: 30px;
-webkit-column-count: 3;
     -moz-column-count: 3 ;
          column-count: 3;
  -webkit-column-width: 200px;
     -moz-column-width: 200px;
          column-width: 200px;
  column-gap: 40px;
  column-rule: 1px solid #33ccff;
  opacity: 0.5;
  text-decoration: none;

}

.content-only a { 
color: #44bb8b; 
cursor: pointer;
word-break: break-all;
font-size: 18px;

}

.TTBBL{
 color: #268aca;
 opacity: 1;

} 

.tooltip-inner{
    background: #44BB8B;
}


video {
  display: inline;
  margin: auto;
  width: 90%;
}

img {
 display: inline;
 margin: auto;
 max-width: 90%;
 height: auto;
}

.aflex-container {
   display: flex;
 
justify-content: space-evenly;
}
Body {
	font-size: 18px;
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	
}
hr {
border-top: 1px solid #33ccff;
}

p {
	font-size: 18px;
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	
}

H1 {
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	Color: #268aca;
}

H2 {
   
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	Color: #268aca;
}

H3 {
	font-size: 28px;
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	Color: #268aca;

}

H4 {
	font-size: 20px;
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	Color: #268aca;

}

Table, th, td {
Text-align: center;	
Vertical-align: middle;
	font-size: 18px;
	padding: 10px;
        border: .5px solid black;
word-wrap: break-word;

}
Table {
 	margin-left: auto; 
 	margin-right: auto;
table-layout: fixed; 
border-collapse: collapse;
width: 100%;
}
tr:nth-child(even) {
	background-color:  #eaeaea;
	
}
td.states {
	background-color:  #eaeaea;
	transition-duration: 1.0s;
}


tr:hover {
	background-color:  #eaeaea;
	transition-duration: 1.0s;
}



ol, ul {
	font-family: Calibri, Candara, Segoe;
	color:  #53555a;
	Text-align: left;
	Vertical-align: middle;
	padding-left: 40px;
}
ul {
	list-style-type: square;
}


.btn {
  background-color:  #eaeaea;
  Border-radius: 10px;
  border: none;
  color: black;
  padding: 15px 22px;
  text-align: center;
  text-decoration: none;
  display: inline-block;
  font-size: 20px;
  margin: 4px 2px;
  cursor: pointer;
  transition-duration: 0.4s;
}

.btn-search{
  background-color: #44bb8b;
  color: #eaeaea;
 padding: 10px 15px;
}

.btn:hover {
  background-color: #44bb8b;
  color: #eaeaea;
}


.btn-Links  {
  background-color: white; 
  color: black; 
  border: 5px solid #008CBA;
font-size: 10px;
}


.btn-Links :hover {
  background-color: #008CBA;
  color: white;
font-size: 10px;

}
.TagList a {
    color: #53555a;
font-size: 18px;
}


.TagList  {
font-family: Museo Slab;
font-size:13px;
display: inline-block;
  color: #44bb8b;
 -webkit-column-count: 3;
     -moz-column-count: 3 ;
          column-count: 3;
  -webkit-column-width: 200px;
     -moz-column-width: 200px;
          column-width: 200px;
  column-gap: 40px;
  column-rule: 1px solid #33ccff;
  opacity: 0.5;
  text-decoration: none;

}


.aTopics {
cursor: pointer;
 background-image: linear-gradient(
    to right,
    #268aca,
    #268aca 50%,
    #44bb8b 50%
  );
  background-size: 200% 100%;
  background-position: 100%;
  display: inline-block;
  padding: 5px 0;
  position: relative;
  -webkit-background-clip: text;
  -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
  transition: all 0.4s ease-in-out;
}

.aTopics:before{
	content: '';
	background: #268aca;
	display: block;
	position: absolute;
	bottom: -3px;
	left: 0;
	width: 20px;
	height: 3px;
	transition: all 0.4s ease-in-out;
}

.aTopics:hover {
	background-position: 0;
}

.aTopics:hover::before{
	width: 100%;
}


.acontainer{
    width: 185px;
    Height: 160px;
    position: relative;
    display: flex;
    justify-acontent: center;
    margin: 10px 10px;   
}

.acontainer .acard{
    position: relative;
    cursor: pointer;
}

.acontainer .acard .aface{
    width: 185px;
    height: 180px;
    transition: 0.5s;
}

.acontainer .acard .aface.aface1{
    position: relative;
    background: none;
    display: flex;
 
    align-items: center;
    z-index: 1;
    width: 165px;
    height: 150px;
   
}

.acontainer .acard:hover .aface.aface1{
    background: none;
    transform: translateY(-25px);
}
.aface1{
margin-left:auto;
margin-right:auto;}

.acontainer .acard .aface.aface1 .acontent{
    opacity: 0.6;
    transition: 0.8s;
}
.acontainer .acard:hover .aface.aface1 .acontent{
    opacity: 1;
}


.acontainer .acard .aface.aface1 .acontent img{
    max-width: 100%;

      position: absolute;

  bottom: 10px;
}



.acontainer .acard .aface.aface2  {
    position: relative;
    border-radius: 25px;
    background: #fff;
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    padding: 12px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
    box-shadow: 0 20px 50px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
    transform: translateY(-130px);
    width: 185px;
    height: 140px;
}
.acontent2 {
position:absolute; bottom:0px;
}
/* Style tab links */
.tablink {
  background-color: #44bb8b;
  color: white;
  float: left;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  cursor: pointer;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  font-size: 17px;
  width: 100%;
}


.tablink:hover {
  background-color: #53555a;
}
/* Create an active/current tablink class */



/* Style the tab content (and add height:100% for full page content) */
.tabcontent {

  display: none;
  padding: 100px 20px;
  height: 100%;
}
.TextBubble {
  position: relative;
  display: inline-block;
  border-bottom: 1px dotted black;
}

.TextBubble .tooltiptext {
  visibility: hidden;
  width: 220px;
  background-color: #268aca;
font-size: 15px;
  color: #fff;
  text-align: center;
  border-radius: 6px;
  padding: 5px 0;
  position: absolute;
  z-index: 1;
  bottom: 150%;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -60px;
}

.TextBubble.tooltiptext::after {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 100%;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -5px;
  border-width: 5px;
  border-style: solid;
  border-color: black transparent transparent transparent;
}

.TextBubble:hover .tooltiptext {
  visibility: visible;
}

 .popUp {
      text-align: center;
      display: none;
      position: fixed;
      z-index: 1;
      padding-top: 100px;
      left: 0;
      top: 0;
      width: 100%;
      height: 100%;
      background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
   }
   .popupContent {
      font-size: 20px;
      font-weight: bold;
      background-color: #fefefe;
      margin: auto;
      padding: 20px;
      border: 1px solid #888;
      width: 80%;
   }
   .close {
      color: rgb(255, 65, 65);
      float: right;
      font-size: 40px;
      font-weight: bold;
   }
   .close:hover, .close:focus {
      color: #ff1010;
      cursor: pointer;
   }

</style>


<script src="https://zingtree.com/deploy/popup-modal.js"></script>



<script>
function openPage(pageName,elmnt,color) {
  var i, tabcontent, tablinks;
  tabcontent = document.getElementsByClassName("tabcontent");
  for (i = 0; i < tabcontent.length; i++) {
    tabcontent[i].style.display = "none";
  }
  tablinks = document.getElementsByClassName("tablink");
  for (i = 0; i < tablinks.length; i++) {
    tablinks[i].style.backgroundColor = "";
  }
  document.getElementById(pageName).style.display = "block";
  elmnt.style.backgroundColor = color;
}

// Get the element with id="defaultOpen" and click on it
document.getElementById("defaultOpen").click();



</script>

3.content:
KinderTrack users should be familiar with navigating the system and utilizing its tools, buttons, and search functions.

↘️ Navigation Bar

When you log into KinderTrack, you will automatically be taken to the Home page. The navigation bar will be towards the left of the Page. You can navigate to a specific page by clicking the page links. The main menu items are Activities, and the sub-menu items are Pages. The navigation bar will always be present.

  1. Back and forward buttons: These are used for navigating back and forth between the selected pages. We recommend using these buttons instead of your browser’s back and forward arrows.
  2. ‘+’ and ‘-’: These buttons expand and condense the menu tree. You can view every Page available under the main section when expanded.
  3. Activities and pages: You navigate to a page by clicking on the main Activity menu. When you click on the desired Page, the Page will become highlighted to indicate that you are on that Page.


Note:If you are in edit mode for any reason, KinderTrack will prevent you from switching to a different page until you exit edit mode.

Close

↘️ Page Browsing Bar

The page browsing bar, located above the navigation bar, always displays the name of the page the operator is currently using. In addition, it provides scroll arrows to easily allow the user to move among pages recently viewed by clicking on the back or forward arrows. 


Close

↘️ Command Bar

The command bar is the horizontal bar that runs across the top of each page. It displays all command buttons available based on the permissions granted to the Operator by the System Administrator.

Command Bar
Descriptions
New
Use to add a new record to the function on the page. For example, if in the Family > Parent page, use to add a new Parent to the currently selected Family.
Edit
Use to modify the currently selected record.
Delete
Use to permanently eliminate the currently selected record.
History
Use to display all past changes to the currently selected record, in reverse chronological order, based on the effective date of the change. Based on permissions previously granted by the System Administrator, the Operator might be able to modify History data. Note that once the user is in the History page, the button turns into Exit History.
Audit
Use to display all past changes to the currently selected record, in reverse chronological order, based on the effective date of the change. The Audit data is computer generated and cannot be modified.
Send Alert
Use to send an Alert to another User, Family Worker or Provider Worker about a pending task.
Help
Use to access the context-sensitive online help for the current page.
Logout
Use to leave the system and return to the Login page.
Edit Controls
Use to change the names and levels of verification of the fields that appear on the selected page. This button is only available for permissions for advanced level activities.
Close

↘️ Session Timer

Upon a successful login to KinderTrack, a timer appears near the upper-right corner of the window informing the Operator of the period of time he/she can remain in the system before being automatically logged out. This timer is beneficial during times of inactivity in KinderTrack, ensuring that a computer left unattended will automatically secure any private information before an authorized person may access it.

 

The timer automatically resets whenever the Operator performs an action on any activity page. If you need to extend a session you can click on the timer to manually reset it. When approaching timing out the Session Timer begins flashing as a warning . However, should the timer run out, you will be automatically logged out of KinderTrack4 and any data you were in the process of editing or adding will be lost if not saved prior to the timeout.

If you are automatically logged out, KinderTrack4 remembers where you left off to avoid you having to search again to locate the Family, Child, Provider or Parent record you were last working with. You only need to login again and resume your work.

Close

↘️ Required Fields

The use of red font and a red asterisk (*) indicates that the field is required.

Close

↘️ Print Page

You might need a print-out of the page you are working with in KinderTrack. It is very easy to obtain, just click on the printer icon located on the lower right corner of every page.

The system generates a preview of the page you are on. Click on the Print button on the upper left corner of the preview window.

 

Close

↘️ Data Fields

All data is entered and stored in single fields. For example, a parent's Last Name in the Last Name field, the first name in the First Name field. Certain fields are red to indicate that they are required fields and that it is necessary to enter data before you can proceed. Information is entered manually into most fields. Some require you to use one of the following methods to select or populate information.

Drop-Down Menu

A drop-down menu is identified by the arrow to the right of the field  and contains pre-defined entries you can select to populate a field instead of entering the information manually.

Clicking on the drop-down arrow displays a list with the available selections. Clicking on the desired selection populates the field.

Selector

A selector is identified by a Select >> link to the right of the field name. It contains a list of pre- defined entries for you to choose from.

Depending on the page, you might be able to select one or more by clicking on the corresponding checkbox(es). When multiple selections are permitted, you can manually click on the desired one (s), Check All to select all or Clear All to deselect all.

Date Field / Calendar Control

KinderTrack will often require that you enter a date, using the mm/dd/yyyy format. You can enter it manually or using the Calendar button. Attempts to enter a date using the incorrect format generates an error message.

To select a date, click on the Calendar and use the scroll arrows (><) to find the desired year and month. Note that when selecting the year, the current year initially displays in the center. You can move ten years back or into the future by clicking on the outermost box on the header (red arrows in the image below) or move one year back or into the future by clicking on the innermost box on the header (green arrows in the image below).

To select the month, use the scroll arrows on either side of the current month and click on the desired calendar day. The selected month, day and year will automatically populate the date field.

Address Selector

Some pages of KinderTrack, such as the Provider and Family, have fields for physical address. It is possible to enter it manually or using the Address Selector button assistance.

Click on the Address Selector to open.

1. Enter the appropriate search criteria in any of the fields. You can enter one or more search parameters. This feature is beneficial when you know part of an address, such as the zip code, and do not know the name of the city. This selector also helps prevent typographical errors. For example,

  • If searching by City, enter the name of the city and press Search to generate a list of all cities with that name in all states and their zip codes.
  • If searching by State, enter the name of the state and press Search to generate a list of all cities in in that state and their zip codes.
    • If searching by City and State, the results generate a list of all zip codes in that city.

2. Click on the radio buttons corresponding to your selection.

3. Press OK to select and return to the previous page. Note that the selected data automatically populates the address fields.

 

Close

↘️ Change Reason

Any modifications made to data require that you enter the reason for the change in the Change Reason field. You may type the reason directly into this field or you might choose an existing reason by clicking Select >> making your selection, and pressing OK.

Close

↘️ WPIs

WPI stands for Warn, Prevent, Ignore. Any time that you enter information on any page of KinderTrack and press Save, the system performs a series of internal checks for conditions that may exist that the information you have entered does not meet. If any found, the system prompts you with a pop-up box informing you that the information is not correct and that you need to make changes in order to continue.

Close

↘️ Grids

Several pages in KinderTrack contain Search results generated in grids, formatted in columns and rows.

Each grid contains its own column headers, customized to the information they provide. Clicking on any of the headers causes the list to be sorted by that column, and clicking again on the same header will reverse the sort order.

It is possible to change the view of the grid by clicking Options, then on Select >> to choose the columns that you would like to be visible.

It is here where you select the numbers of entries you would like to see displayed in the page, defined by the number you enter for Page Size.

When the number of resulting entries surpasses the Page Size, the results are then viewable in several pages. To move among the pages, just click on the desired page number listed below the grid.


Close

↘️ Alerts

KinderTrack uses Alerts to notify the user of important information that might need attention, such as requiring that some action be taken on a specific record, or it can be for informational purposes only. They can be system-generated or user-generated and appear in the Home page alert queue, the Family > Alerts or the Provider > Alerts pages.

  • System-generated Alerts pertain to information saved in the data fields (e.g. child's date of birth, a license is expiring, etc.). Your System Administrator pre-determines the conditions that can trigger Alerts as well as the number of days in advance it shows in the queue. System-generated Alerts show in the Family > Alerts or Provider > Alerts pages.
  • User-generated Alerts are created by an Operator and sent to another User, a Family Worker or a Provider Worker. They appear in the specified Operator Home page alerts queue. In addition, any alerts for a Family Worker is viewable in the Family > Alerts page and for a Provider Worker in the Provider > Alerts page.

To see an example of an Alert click here.

Working with Alerts

Upon a successful login to KinderTrack, the Welcome page will display a grid containing all Alerts assigned to the logged in individual, if any. It is possible to select Alerts to review as well as to assign to a different Operator.

1. Click on Options to set up the Visible Columns, the Page Size , and other parameters available to narrow the results display.

2. To review an Alert, click on the View link corresponding to the desired Alert.

3. The details of the Alert display.

 4. To respond to an Alert, press Reply after you review the contents. Enter your response in the space provided. Press Send when done.

  

5. To delete an Alert, click on the corresponding Delete. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Responding to an Alert

It is possible to reply to Alerts received. Once you select an Alert to review in the Welcome page, you can choose to Reply.

Sending an Alert

Use the Send Alert button on the right side of the command bar to send alerts to other operators, family or provider workers.

1. Press Send Alert.

2. Press the Alert Type drop-down to select who you would like to send it to, if another user, a family worker or a provider worker.

3. Click on Select >> to enter or search for the name of the recipient(s). Press OK after making your selection.

4. Enter the Alert Subject.

5. Enter the Alert Message.

6. Press Send.

Close

↘️ Search

Most pages of KinderTrack provide an easy-to-use search tool used to locate records. The Search pages use a variety of fields to define criteria to be used, the more criteria you select, the more accurate your search results will be. For most of the criteria fields, you can just enter one or a few characters and the system will locate every potential match that starts with those characters.

Once you select a record using the Search results, the record is considered open and will remain so until you close it. All pages within the activity you are working with are now linked to the open record.

To see an example of the Search tool being used click here.

Close

↘️ Scroll Arrows

Scroll arrows appear on the top of several pages as a result of the selection of more than one Search result. They allow the user to move among records by clicking on the back or forward arrows.

Use the single arrows to move through record by record, to the previous or to the next record. Use the double arrows to move to the first or to the last of the records you selected. Click Remove if there is a record that you do not need to see and would like to remove from the Search Results grid. The record will not be removed from the database, just from the grid.

Close

↘️ Print Options

The Reports available in KinderTrack can be printed directly and the Operator can select the output type in which to generate the report.

  • PDF - Creates a file that can be viewed using Adobe Acrobat. This is the preferred selection when you want to print or save the report, or forward to another individual.
  • Comma Delimited - Creates a text file with one line per record, and the fields within a line are separated by commas. This format is commonly used to open the report in a spreadsheet using Microsoft Excel or a similar program.
  • HTML - Displays the results directly on your screen to give you a quick look at the data.
  • Tab - Creates a text file with one line per record, and the fields within a line are separated by tabs. Some reports that are submitted to government entities require this format.
Close

↘️ History

It is possible to review a summary of all changes made to a record using the History.

The History feature of KinderTrack displays a summary of all changes to the currently selected record in reverse chronological order, based on the Effective Date of the change. The example below shows History for a Family.

1. Once you have selected the page you would like to work with, press History at the top of the page to generate a grid displaying all changes made to the selected record.

2. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Effective Date of the changes you would like to view in more detail to display information corresponding to that record in the lower portion of the page. Note that there is one entry row for every Effective Date. When selected, the record will show the current information, regardless of the date when the change was made.

 3. Press Exit History to return to the selected record page.

Edit History

Depending on your Operator permissions, it is possible to make changes to the History of a record.

1. To select, press the radio button corresponding to the Effective Date of the change you would like to edit the History.

2. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.

3. Enter the Effective Date for the change or click on the calendar to select.

4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.

5. Make the necessary changes.

6. Press Save. The new record is now part of the history.

7. Press Exit History to return to the selected record page.

Delete History

  1. To select, press the radio button corresponding to the Effective Date of the change you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the History item.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Sometimes deleting the history of a record will also change other aspects of the file. This action may generate a WPI and cause you to also receive a warning message.

Close

↘️ Audit

Audit records are computer generated and cannot be modified. They display a detailed history of all changes to the currently selected record in reverse chronological order based on the date the change was made.

 In the example below, you will notice a list of changes made to the record for the Beckham family, indicating the Effective Date that was affected by the change. The Family Fee Rate was changed on the record corresponding to the 04/09/18 Effective Date. The information available as the result of an Audit can be extensive depending on the number of columns selected to be displayed. It cannot be seen in a single screen, you might need to use the scroll bar at the end of the grid to view additional columns. Among others, you will be able to see the name of the Operator that made the change, the date and time of the change, and the reason.

Click Options to open and Select >> the columns you would like visible in the audit results.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Getting to Know KinderTrack page, click here.

4.content:
The activity pages can be found on the left side of the page.

Last Update On: 01/02/2024

5.content:
Family Case workers use the Family activity page to manage cases for family, parents and children. The information can be entered manually or imported from the Client portal. The system determines eligibility and family fees from the case data previously entered and generates Notices of Action. It also creates childcare schedules with selected providers and generates the appropriate timesheet.

Navigation Bar
Descriptions
Alerts
The Family > Alerts page allows you to view and process alerts issued to family case workers regarding critical areas of case management (e.g. birthdays when children no longer qualify to receive care). Other users may also send alerts to another caseworker for a family. Depending on the settings, alerts may also display in the Home page after a successful login.
Search
Use the Family > Search page not only to search for family, parent, and children records but also to access them. The Search page contains a variety of fields where you can enter one or more search criteria. The more criteria you add, the more specific your search results will be.
Summary
The Family > Summary page provides information on the last selected Family, Parent(s), Child(ren), Notices, Alerts, and Forms. Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.
Family
The Family > Family page displays general information relevant to the family. It also allows the user to Add, Edit and Delete family records. Use the Search page to locate the family you would like to work with. Once selected, use the links resulting from the Search Results or click on the sub-menu items on the Navigation Bar to access each section of the Family activity.
Parent
The Family > Parent page displays the information available for the selected parent. This section also explains how to Add, Edit and Delete a parent record.
Needs
Use the Family > Needs page to document the reason for the family request for childcare as well as the days and hours that require care.
Child
The Family > Child page displays information about the selected child such as age, Social Security number, and CIN. This section provides information on how to Add, Edit and Delete a child record.
Income
The Family > Income itemizes the family’s income, showing information for the family as a whole and for the selected family member. The Monthly Income Worksheet feature automatically calculates monthly total income when entering the amounts of different pay stubs.

Eligibility Characteristics

The Family > Eligibility Characteristics page is used to determine need and priority enrollment. This allows users to select additional criteria for a family. The available Eligibility Criteria are table driven and may be set in Administration > Tables page under Eligibility Type.
Schedule
Use the Family > Schedule page to set up a schedule for a child with a provider, based on the hours created on the Family> Needs page. Select a provider, indicate whether the schedule is fixed or varying, and enter the schedule times to appear on system-generated attendance sheets.
Notice
Use the Family > Notice page to approve, authorize, modify, and terminate child schedules. Any new updates (Family Fees, Family Size, etc.) will require a new notice, and the effective date will determine when the system applies those changes. The notice will not be in effect until it's authorized.
Family Notes
Use the Family > Family Notes to enter and view specific case notes about the selected family. The notes are for internal use only. By default, they are listed in reverse chronological order, but you can change the sorting at any time by clicking one of the column headings.
Payments
The Family > Payment page allows users to review payments made for the selected family. It is possible to view all records or specific records by specifying status and/or flags.
Absence Periods
Use the Family > Absence Periods page to track scheduled absences such as vacations.
RFI
Use the Family > RFI page to keep track of the documents needed from the parent, usually for verification purposes. The Family > RFI page lists documents that may be required for each particular case and allows the user to change the document status (Required, Not Required, Received, Pending, Unknown). It also keeps track of dates of documentation requests and receipts. The agency's system administrator sets up the required documents.
Additional Fees
Use the Family > Additional Fees page to track fees that the family owes for some childcare-related issues (e.g., diaper service, meals, transportation, field trip, reimbursement repayment, etc.). These are fees that a family has to pay on top of the income-based family fees determined by eligibility levels.
Documents
The Family > Documents page displays the existing documents associated with the selected family that are available in the system. All documents are imported from KinderConnect. Selecting a document enables the Download button.

To test your knowledge on the Family Activity, click here.

6.content:
KinderTrack is a program management software that streamlines all casework components—including eligibility determination, provider payments, attendance tracking, reporting, and more.

System benefits include:

  • Timely and Accurate Provider Payments: KinderTrack tracks time and attendance; Providers can receive and print timesheets online, which leads to timely payments and reduced postage costs. 
  • Reduction in Improper Program Payments: This system increases fiscal accountability by calculating consistent and accurate payments, comparing each child’s time and attendance with Provider rates and market rates to result in precise payments as configured. 
  • Improved Fiscal Management: KinderTrack provides many standard reports. Such reports provide consistent data for better fiscal planning and decision-making. 
  • More Efficient Program Administration: Automating tasks minimizes time-consuming data entry greatly.

What would you like to learn?

Log in to KinderTrack
Getting to Know Kindertrack
Main Activity Pages

8.content:
Use the Provider pages to manage childcare providers. The system allows you to add and update provider information. Access each section of the Provider activity by first choosing a Provider through the Search page. 

Using the Provider > Search page, select a provider file to work with, then navigate to the desired information section using the links in the Search Results or by clicking the sub-menu items on the Navigation Bar.

Navigation BarDescriptions
AlertsThe Provider > Alerts page allows you to view and process alerts for provider specialists generated for critical areas of case management (e.g. license expiring). 
A user may also manually generate an alert to another user.
SearchUse the Provider > Search page to locate and access records for all types of providers. The Search page contains a variety of fields you can use to enter one or more criteria for your search, thus narrowing the results.
SummaryThe Provider > Summary page provides information on the last selected Provider, Type of Care, Contact and Forms. 
Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.
ProviderThe Provider > Provider page displays information relevant to the selected Provider, such as phone number, address, region, quality rating, worker, etc. 
It also allows the user to Add, Edit and Delete provider records.
Use the Search page to locate the provider you would like to work with. 
Once selected, use the links resulting from the search or click on the sub-menu items on the Navigation Bar to access each section of the Provider activity.
ContactsUse the Provider > Contacts page to maintain information about individual contacts for a provider, such as name, e-mail address, alternate phone number and social security number. 
This information is useful when contacting providers directly. You can store as many contacts for a single provider as necessary.
Type of CareUse the Provider > Type of Care page to indicate the type of care that the provider offers, including information about the Provider’s license status.
RatesThe Provider > Rates page is used to enter, maintain and view information on the rates paid to Providers.
It is possible to enter different rates based on Provider’s different profiles. 
The system also accommodates future rates based on scheduled rate changes. 
The user can view rates according to effective dates and types as well as the Regional Maximum Rates (RMR) for the effective dates selected. The RMR rates can be imported to any Provider that is using them.
ProfileUse the Provider > Profile page to document the specifics for the selected provider, such as hours of operation, registration fees, calendars, programs supported, restrictions, etc.
PaymentsUse the Provider > Payments page to view payments processed for the selected provider. You can choose the criteria for the payments you would like to view.
NotesUse the Provider > Notes page to enter specific notes about a provider that can be accessed at a later date for internal use only.
Modified DaysUse the Provider > Modified Days page to note periods of Provider closure that are exceptions to the Provider's Hours of Operation. 
In general, the days a Provider is open is determined by the Hours of Operation entered in the Provider > Profile page.
However, a Provider might have exceptions to those days, such as holidays or vacations, which you can record on the Provider > Modified Days page. 
When querying for scheduled hours, the Payment page will set these days to Absent, Present or Not Scheduled, depending on the absence type selected when entering the modified Days.
Note: Select the calendar on the Provider > Profile page, then use the Provider > Modified Days page to record any exceptions to the calendar.
FamiliesThe Provider > Families page provides a list of all of the families with childcare schedules at the selected Provider. 
You can filter the list by the status of the schedules.
RFIUse the Provider > RFI page to keep track of documents needed from the Provider for verification purposes. 
The RFI page lists the documents that may be required for each particular case and allows tracking of the status and changing it accordingly when requested, received, pending, or not required, etc.
TransferUse Provider > Transfer to transfer child schedules from one Provider to another without the hassle of canceling the currently active schedule and having to create a new one at the new Provider. 
The Transfer page allows the transferring of multiple schedules at once, provided they are all for the same type of care. In order to transfer schedules, make sure the Provider you are transferring from is selected from the Search page.
LevyUse the Provider > Levy page to record and track any levies that may affect Provider's payment.
DocumentsUse the Provider > Documents page to upload the documents to the database that may be relevant to the Provider's file (e.g. driver's license, certifications, training verifications, etc.) or to review existing documents. Selecting a document enables the Delete and Download buttons.

To test your knowledge on the Provider Activity, click here.

9.content:
KinderTrack includes a standard payment calculator to accurately determine reimbursements to providers for childcare services.

Use the Payment activity to process payments. The agency can search for payments, enter and review attendance data , calculate payments, change the status of payments until Paid, create additional payments, and reconcile payment data.

Navigation Bar
Descriptions

Payment Search

Use the Payment > Payment Search page to find and access records of all types (approved, authorized, paid, returned, received, rejected, calculated, and not calculated) of payments. Enter one or more criteria in the available fields, the more criteria you add the more accurate your search will be.

Summary

The Payment > Summary page provides information on the last selected payment. It is possible to update payment status using this page. Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.

Payment

Use the Payment > Payment page to enter Timesheets and calculate payments on approved schedules. Each Payment can cover one or more schedules for a single child, at a single provider, and a single program or funding source.

Additional Payment

It is possible to make Additional Payments to providers to cover certain expenses. Since these payments are in addition to a provider's payment for regular childcare fees and correspond to a paid period of care, it might be necessary to refer to the original payment when creating it. After processing, the additional payment will have its own Payment ID. KinderTrack also allows creation of an Additional Payment outside of a specific childcare authorization, providing the flexibility of making payments and adjustments for situations where an authorization may not be available.

Payment Reconciliation

Use the Payment > Payment Reconciliation page to reconcile payments processed in KinderTrack with payments made by the client's accounting system. It is basically a way to associate a dollar amount and a check number with a batch of KinderTrack4 authorized payments. This is a valuable feature for tracking purposes.

The Payment Reconciliation feature is an optional custom feature, details only available when purchased.

Legacy Payments

Legacy Payments are payments generated from other systems made prior to deployment of the KinderTrack system. The data is imported to KinderTrack to facilitate Legacy Payment adjustments when necessary and reducing the amount of work required to research specific legacy payment issues in another system.

Payment Processing

Use the Payment > Payment Processing page to update the status of Provider payments. In order to issue each payment goes through several steps using the Payment Processing page.

Payment Matrix

Use the Payment > Payment Matrix to view all payment information, aggregated from the state, and down-selectable to county, providers, families and individual children.

To test your knowledge on the Payment Activity, click here.

10.content:
The Reports > Reports page contains folders with reports organized by type. Each folder might contain multiple reports. Note: The reports listed below are shown for example only. The reports on your screen may differ based on the Operator Roles set by the System Administrator.

Navigation Bar
Descriptions

Reports

The Reports > Reports page contains folders with reports organized by type. Each folder might contain multiple reports.

 

Print Queue

Use the Reports > Print Queue page to generate and print Certificates and Timesheets.

The Print Queue is part of the payment process but is also found under the Reports page.

Advanced


Use the Reports > Advanced page to create and save advanced reports with predefined parameters. You name the report, choose which parameters will be used in the report, and define the type of output for the report.


 Client Reports

Use Reports > Client Reports to add user-defined documents to the system (e.g. training guides, rules, etc.) so that other users can easily access them for informational purposes.

11.content:
Use the Operator page to manage and maintain information of all system users, including roles and permissions set for each operator.

Access each section of the Operator activity by first selecting an operator through the Operator > Search page, then navigate to the desired information section using the links in the Search Results or by clicking on the appropriate menu items on the Navigation bar.

Navigation Bar

Descriptions

 Search

Use the Operator > Search page to locate and access records of authorized operators for the KinderTrack system. The Operator > Search page contains a variety of fields used to enter one or more criteria to perform the search. The more criteria you select, the more accurate your search results will be.

 Details

Use the Operator > Details page to create and maintain the Operator information, including login. Here you assign user names, passwords, roles, supervisors, backup workers, etc. You can also flag the user to receive Night Run status alerts, force password change, and lock a user from accessing KinderTrack.

 Attributes

Use the Operator > Attributes page to enter and track additional information related to the selected Operator that is not already maintained in any of the other pages of the Operator activity. The agency's System Administrator predetermines the list of attributes that appears on the Operator > Attributes page.

 Notes

Use the Operator > Notes page to create, edit or review notes about an Operator. Notes are for internal use only. It is necessary to select the Operator using Operator > Search before creating, viewing or editing Notes.

 

 Roles

Use the Operator > Roles page to define the access levels, flags, permissions and alert types granted to a specific type of Operator. KinderTrack is deployed with certain Operator definitions already established that can be changed to suit the needs of the users. For example, a Family Case Worker is set on an Operator role, with view, edit and delete permissions for the Family activity but is only allowed to view files under the Provider activity. You may add additional Operator roles as needed.

To test your knowledge on the Operator Activity, click here.

12.content:
Use the Program activity to track and maintain all funding source information in KinderTrack. Access each section of the Program activity by first selecting a Program using the Program > Search page, then navigate to the various program pages using the links in the search results or by clicking on the appropriate sub-menu items on the Navigation bar.

Navigation Bar

Descriptions

 Search

Use the Program > Search page to locate and access information about the different programs (funding sources) your agency uses to reimburse a Provider for childcare services. The Program > Search page contains a variety of fields used to enter one or more criteria to perform the search. The more criteria you enter, the more accurate your search will be.

 Program

Use the Program > Program page to enter and maintain information about the programs (funding sources) your agency uses, including program type, age/grade limits and contact information for the Program Director.

 Allocation

Use the Program > Allocation page to allocate available Program funds to a fiscal year or specific time period. The Allocation page allows entry by both the State Wide Flagged Operator Role as well as by a Region Separated Role.

  Payment Transfer

The Program > Payment Transfer page is used to move one or many payments from one program to another. This will allow a case to be allocated to another program when a program has reach its threshold.

To test your knowledge on the Program Activity, click here.

13.content:
All maintenance and system setup tasks of KinderTrack are managed in the Administration activity. This area is used to maintain system parameters, configure table driven business rules, adjust system functionality, and re-assign cases to other workers, among others.

Navigation Bar

Descriptions

Tables

The Administration > Tables page contains a series of tables that affect KinderTrack use and performance. These Tables contain numerous Entries which the user can edit, delete, or add new ones necessary to accommodate the agency's needs and preferences.

Configuration Keys

The Administration > Configuration Keys page displays the system settings established during initial deployment which cannot be modified through the user interface. These settings include information KinderTrack4 needs to access the application and the database. This page is for information purposes only.

Family Fees

Use the Administration > Family Fees page to set and maintain the rate schedules for Family Fees.

Calendar

Use the Administration > Calendar page to create calendars to be used throughout the various activities of KinderTrack. Selecting the appropriate School Calendar when creating schedules that generate timesheets for school age children tells KinderTrack to apply school or non-school day schedules to specific day(s) on the timesheet, depending on when school is in session. 

Provider Calendars also allow the system to recognize when a Provider is open or closed for business. Maintaining a current Agency Calendar is beneficial in diverse situations, such as not allowing due dates to fall on days the agency is closed.

Reassign Case Worker

Use the Administration > Reassign Case Worker page to reassign a Family, a Provider or a Payment file from one case worker to another. You may transfer single cases or multiple cases at one time.

 WPI Settings

Use the Administration > WPI Settings page to maintain the WPI (Warn, Prevent, Ignore) messages in the system. The messages are listed in numerical order by ID, also available in the messages themselves for easy look up. The WPIs are defined during KinderTrack initial deployment and cannot be added or deleted.

 RMR

Use the Administration > RMR page to manage the Regional Maximum Rate (RMR) and effective dates for each district and Provider type. It is important to enter all the available RMR information accurately to ensure that payment calculation functions properly.

 Quality Rates

Use the Administration > Quality Rates page to manage the Quality Rate groups and effective dates for each District and Provider type. It is important to enter all the available Quality Rates information accurately to ensure that payment calculation functions properly.

 Copy Rates

Use the Administration > Copy Rates page to copy rates from one Provider to another, or more Providers at the same time. This feature is useful when a Provider has multiple sites with the same rates. It also allows you to copy the Regional Maximum Rate (RMR) to one or more Provider Rates.

Districts

Use the Administration > Districts page to assign selected zip codes to a specific District. In order to assign zip codes to a District, the codes first have to be set up in the Administration > Tables page. This page also allows you to assign selected School Districts to a specific District provided the School Districts are first set up in the Administration > Tables page.

Office Locations

Use the Administration > Office Locations page to define the different locations for your agency. The Office Locations information prints on many reports.

 Alerts

Use the Administration > Alerts page to activate and define the parameters for all Alerts generated by the system.

Error Log

The Administration > Error Log page is a research tool used only by the software developers to examine the details of all errors received by KinderTrack users. It is for viewing only and cannot be edited.

Attendance Groups

Use the Administration > Attendance Groups page to define the number of days of a certain type of attendance that are allowed in a specified length of time, such as four absences per month. The Attendance Groups need to be in place before creating Attendance Codes.

Attendance Codes

Agencies use the Administration > Attendance Codes feature to designate specific categories to attendance days, such as Present, Absent, Snow Day, Holiday, etc. The System Administrator can configure these attendance codes to be paid or unpaid as well as assign them to categories, or Attendance Groups, which define the frequency and number of days allowed in certain time periods. For example, an Agency can restrict payment of paid Absent days to a maximum of four per quarter. Once the Attendance Codes are defined here, the user can select them for each day on the Payment > Payment page.

Logged On Users

The Administration > Logged On Users page is a view only research tool used only by the software developers and cannot be modified. It provides details on the operators currently logged in to the system.

District Settings

Use the Administration > District Settings page to set preferences that govern how the system functions within a specific region.

Site Settings

The field values on the Administration > Site Settings page affect the internal operation of many KinderTrack functions and reports. Some of these values are set during deployment and cannot be changed while others can be modified by the System Administrator. It affects the preferences that govern how the system functions. Changes to these settings should only be performed with technical assistance from knowledgeable KinderSystems personnel.

To test your knowledge on the Administration activity, click here.

14.content:
After creating your account, you must log on each time you use the system.

  1. Open your browser to the page https://childcare.twc.texas.gov/KinderTrack.
    • Note: You cannot access KinderTrack using Internet Explorer. Please use another browser such as Google Chrome, Firefox, or Safari.
  2. Enter your User Name and Password created at the time of registration. Passwords are case-sensitive. If capital letters were used while creating the password, they must be used when logging on. 
  3. Press Log In to access your account.

Notes:

  • Some users log in to KinderTrack using Single Sign On (SSO).
  • Users who cannot log in to KinderTrack should contact their Administrator for assistance.

16.content:
The Family > Alerts page allows you to view and process alerts issued to family case workers regarding critical areas of case management (e.g. birthdays where children no longer qualify to receive care). Users may also send alerts to other family case workers. Depending on the settings, Alerts may also display in the Home page after a successful login.

View Alert

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Alerts page.
  3. Choose whether to view alerts for all families under the currently logged in case worker or click the check box to view Current Family Only.
  4. Press Select >> next to Alert Status to identify the type of alerts you would like to view, Processed and/ or Not Processed.
  5. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  6. Press Refresh to generate the list of Alerts meeting the parameters you entered.

↘️ Processing a Family Alert

  • Press Options to modify the number of records to be displayed in the Alert List search results and the visible columns.
  • Click the radio button corresponding to the alert you would like to process to activate additional buttons on top of the page.
  • Select an action:
    1. Press Delete to permanently remove the currently selected alert(s). The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
    2. Press Refresh to remove any criteria previously selected and reset the Alert List.
    3. Press Process to process the currently selected alert. The system prompts you to open the page associated with the selected Alert to review the details or to Cancel and return to the Alerts List. Press OK to proceed and open the Provider page where you can take any necessary action. Note that the status of the Alert changes to Processed.
    4. You can revert the Process action of an Alert. Click on the corresponding checkbox to select the Alert. Press Reset. The system prompts for confirmation prior to resetting a Processed alert status to Not Processed. Press OK.
    5. Press Snooze to change the alert for a future date. Type the number of days to postpone the alert and click OK.
Close

↘️ List of Family Alerts

Alert

Comment

Case Manager

Creates an alert for cumulative absences that occur during eligibility period for child when threshold of 15 & 30 days of absence is reached. When the threshold of 40 days of absence is reached, set actions to be taken.

Family Fee Change

Creates an alert a pre-defined number of days before a change in family fee occurs.

Family Fee Schedule Expires

Creates an alert a pre-defined number of days before a schedule with family fees assigned is set to expire.

Family Size/Income Change

Creates an alert when the family size or the family income is modified.

New Case Worker

Creates an alert when the family is assigned to a new Case Worker.

Pending RFI Document Due

Creates an alert when a pending document in the Family File has not been received by the due date.

Review Date Approaches

Creates an alert a pre-defined number of days before the Review Date.

RFI Document Expires

Creates an alert a pre-defined number of days before a document in the Family File expires.

Term Pending Notice

Creates an alert when a Termination notice is created and left in Pending status.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Alerts page, click here.

17.content:
Use the Family > Search page not only to search for Family, Parent and Children records but also to access them. The Search page contains a variety of fields where you can enter one or more search criteria. The more criteria you add, the more specific the results of your search will be.

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Click the Family radio button.
  4. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields.
  5. Press Search to display the results.

↘️ Family Search Criteria

Fields

Description

Effective DateKinderTrack is a flexible system that allows changes using past and future dates. 
Every time a record is created or edited, the system prompts the user to enter the Effective Date.
Note: Since the Effective Date field appears in different pages it is very important that they are always correct for each page.
Family IDDisplays the unique identifier ID number that the system generates for each family.
Family NameDisplays the family name.
Address 1, Address 2, City, State, Zip Code, CountyDisplays the home address and corresponding county for the Family in the appropriate fields.
EligibilityLists the program(s) or funding(s) a Family is eligible to receive.  
Press Select >> to display all available programs or fundings.
FlagsIndicates the type of Flags assigned to the Family, which drives how the system behaves.
Press Select >> to display all available Flags. The settings in Admin > Tables determine the values of the Flags.
Military StatusDisplays the current military status for the Family, if aTX.
LanguageDisplays the primary language spoken by the Family.
StatusIndicates the current Status of the Family application.
WorkerDisplays the name of the case worker in charge of the Family case. 
Press the drop-down arrow to open a window where you can view or search for a Case Worker based on Operator Roles.
Case NumberDisplays the case number assigned to the Family.
Closed ReasonIf the family is no longer eligible for services, displays the reason selected using the drop-down menu.
Auth. to DateDisplays the date when the Authorization ends.
Recertification DateDisplays the date when the parent(s) is/are scheduled to recertify.
Initial Eligibility DateDisplays the earliest date when the child(ren) in this family was first eligible to start receiving subsidized childcare services.
Application DateDisplays the date when the application for services was completed.
PhoneDisplays the telephone number for the Family.
Family TypeIndicates the type of Family. 
Select from the drop-down menu whether it is a Standard/Natural, Foster or Guardianship family. 
The parent(s) income and the family size count when selecting a “Natural/Standard” Family.
Private FamilyIf checked, this box indicates that the Family information is confidential, the Family is assigned to a case worker and the record can only be viewed by his or her supervisors.
HomelessIndicates if the Family is currently Homeless or not.
Child Only FamilyIf checked, this box indicates that the family share is waved.
NotesEnter aTX notes relevant to the Family.
Close

↘️ Parent Search

  1. Click the Parent radio button.
  2. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields.
  3. Press Search to display the results.
Close

↘️ Parent Search Criteria

FieldHow to enter informationWhat the search will find
Last NameManuallyAll parents with that last name listed on the Parent page beginning with the character(s) entered.
First NameManuallyAll parents with that first name listed on the Parent page beginning with the character(s) entered.
PhoneManuallyAll parents with that phone number listed on the Parent page.
Work PhoneManuallyAll parents with that work phone number listed on the Parent page.
Alternate PhoneManuallyAll parents with that alternate phone number listed on the Parent page.
Parent SSNManuallyThe parent with that SSN listed on the Parent page.
Family StatusUse multiselect to choose one or more family statusesAll parents that meet the selected family status(es) listed on the Family page.
Family TypeUse multiselect to choose one or more family typesAll parents that meet the selected family type(s) listed on the Family page
CINManuallyThe parent with that CIN listed on the Parent page.
Date of BirthSelect the parameter from the drop-down menu, then manually enter the date or use the calendar button to selectAll parents whose date of birth, as listed on the Parent page, is within the parameter (>,<,=) selected for the date.
Parent FlagsUse multiselect to choose one or more flagsAll parents that meet the selected flag(s) listed on the Parent page.
Need ReasonUse multiselect to choose one or more reasonsAll parents that meet the selected need reason(s) listed on the Parent page.
DistrictSelect from the drop-down menuAll parents who reside in the selected district.
Close

↘️ Child Search

  1. Click the Child radio button.
  2. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields.
  3. Press Search to display the results.

Note: Press Clear to remove aTX search parameters previously entered.

Close

↘️ Child Search Criteria

FieldHow to enter informationWhat the search will find
Last NameManuallyAll children with that last name listed on the Child page that begin with the character(s) entered.
First NameManuallyAll children with that first name listed on the Child page that begin with the character(s) entered.
Enrollment StatusUse multiselect to choose one or more enrollment status(es)All children that meet the selected enrollment status(es) listed on the Child page.
ProgramUse multiselect to choose one or more Program(s)All Programs available for the State will be listed with check-boxes that can be selected.
AgeSelect from the drop-down menu"Greater than", "Equal to", and "Less than" options available to choose from.
YearsManuallyThe child's year age listed on the Child page
MonthsManuallyThe child's month age listed on the Child page
Child SSNManuallyThe child with that SSN listed on the Child page.
Family StatusUse multiselect to choose one or more family status(es)All children with the selected family status(es) listed on the Family page.
Family TypeUse multiselect to choose one or more type(s)All families with the selected family type(s) listed on the Family page.
CINManuallyThe child with that CIN listed on the Child page.
CaseManuallyThe child with that case number listed on the Child page.
Foreign Key 3ManuallyThe child with that foreign key listed on the Child page.
ProviderUse multiselect to choose one or more provider(s)All children with the selected provider(s) listed on the Schedule page.
Child FlagsUse multiselect to choose one or more child flags(s)All children with the selected flag(s) listed on the Child page.
Date of Birth

Select the parameter from the drop-down menu, then manually enter the date or use the calendar button to select.

All children whose date of birth, as listed on the Child page, is within the parameters (>,<,=) chosen for the date.
DistrictSelect from the drop-down menuAll children who reside in the selected district.
Close

↘️ Working with Search Results

All search activities generate a Results grid on the lower portion of the screen listing all records matching the specified criteria. The results can be used as links to the pages under the Family activity, such as Summary, Family, and Parent pages corresponding to the families which fit the specified criteria. (If you search for a child, the result will also include Child Name.) The Search results can also be used to select the files to be included in the reports available from the Search page.

Close

↘️ Selecting Records

You can choose to view information for one family or for multiple families:

  • To select one family record, click on the box for the family you would like to view, click Summary next to the family name to display that family’s summary page. Likewise, clicking Family Name will display the Family page, clicking Parent Name will display the Parent page, and clicking the Child Name will display the Child page.
  • To select multiple families, click the check box next to each family record you would like to view. Click Summary, Family Name, Parent Name or Child Name to open the corresponding page. If selecting multiple families, the results will list details for each family in a different page which you can view by clicking on the scroll arrows.
  • To select all families, click the (+) plus sign on the upper left of the grid. Click Summary, Family Name, Parent Name or Child Name to open the corresponding page. Again, you can review the details for each family using the scroll arrows.

Note: If you are not certain which record you need, select all possibilities and review the Family records or Family Summary pages by clicking scroll arrows at the top of the page.

Close

↘️ Reports

It is possible to generate Family Listing reports and Family Mailing Labels from the Parent, Child or Family search pages. Click on the Family Listing report to generate a printable list of your selected search results displaying the family ID, parent name, KinderTrack case number, address, and phone number for each family. The Family Mailing Labels report generates printable mailing labels with the parent name and address of each selected family. The records on the reports are specific to and match the parameters entered in the search criteria.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Search page, click here.

18.content:
The Family > Summary page provides information on the selected Family, Parent(s), Child(ren), Case Worker, Alerts and Forms. Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Summary page.
  3. Families need to be preselected using the Family > Search page in order to view them in the Summary. Use the Search Result scroll arrows to locate the Family you would like to work with. Note that if you only selected one Family the last time, the arrows will be disabled.
  4. Select the Family you would like to view by clicking the appropriate link. To add a new family, parent, and/or child, click the appropriate Add button.
  5. A summary of the selected Family displays. It not only includes Family, Parent(s) and Child(ren) information, the Summary page also lists the name of the Provider for every child listed and covers relevant Alerts and Forms.

↘️ List of Available Forms

Form Name

Description

Eligibility Review Letter - 8 Weeks

This form prints a letter to send to a client informing them that it is time to review their childcare eligibility.

Income Worksheet

This form is used to print a document showing how income was calculated using information provided by the client.

Incomplete Review Letter - Spanish

This form prints a Spanish version of the letter to be sent to a client informing them of what they needs to send in to complete their childcare eligibility review.

Child Care Subsidy Certificate Spanish

This is the legal certificate document provided by the state of New York[AA1] , in Spanish.

FEDS Referral

The system will generate this form with the print date and the parameters specified for the allegation and explanation. This form is used to document potential indicators for fraud and abuse.

 

Incomplete File Notice

Use this form to let families know what documents are needed in order for services to continue and the deadlines for action regarding this documentation. It also warns families of deadlines that, if not met, will result in the termination of services.

 

Investigation Referral

The system will generate this form with the print date and the parameters specified for the allegation, explanation, and action requested. Use this form to document potential indicators for fraud and abuse.

 

Eligibility Review Letter

This form is used to let families know their case is up for review and to inform them of the deadlines for action regarding their case.

 

Front End Detection Referral

The system will generate this form with the print date with the reason for the referral and the comments from the wizard. This form is used to document potential indicators for fraud and abuse.

 Incomplete Review Letter

This form is used to print a document showing how income was calculated using information provided by the client.

 

Investigation Referral State

The system will generate this form will with the print date and the parameters specified for the allegation and explanation. This form is used to document potential indicators for fraud and abuse.

 Timesheet

This form is used to record/track attendance where children are scheduled for service.


Close


To test your knowledge on the Family > Summary page, click here.

19.content:
The Family > Family page displays general information relevant to the Family. It also allows the user to Add, Edit and Delete family records. Use the Search page to locate the family you would like to work with. Once selected, use the links in the Search Results or click on the menu items on the Navigation Bar to access each section of the Family activity.

Add a Family Record

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Family page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the Family case into the appropriate field. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field.
    • Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
    • Case Number / Status: The system automatically populates these fields based on information previously provided in other pages.
    • Private Family: Click this checkbox to set the family's data as private. It will require special permissions only for viewing.
  5. Press Save to create a new Family record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Family Fields

FieldsDescription
Effective DateEvery time a record is created or edited, the system prompts the user to enter the Effective Date. KinderTrack is a flexible system that allows changes using past and future dates. Note: Since the Effective Date field appears in different pages it is very important that they are always correct for each page. 
Family IDDisplays the unique identifier ID number that the system generates for each family.
Family NameDisplays the family name.
Address 1, Address 2, City, State, Zip Code, CountyDisplays the home address and corresponding county for the Family in the appropriate fields.
Different Mailing AddressIf checked, this box indicates if the family has a different mailing address from their primary address. Note: This will display extra mailing address fields.
EligibilityLists the program(s) or funding(s) a Family is eligible to receive.
Press Select >> to display all available programs or fundings.
FlagsIndicates the type of Flags assigned to the Family which drive system behavior.
Press Select >> to display all available Flags. The settings in Admin > Tables determine the values of the Flags.
Military StatusDisplays the current military status for the Family, if any.
LanguageDisplays the primary language spoken by the Family.
StatusIndicates the current Status of the Family application.
 WorkerDisplays the name of the case worker in charge of the Family case. Press the drop-down arrow to open a window where you can view or search for a Case Worker based on Operator Roles.
Case NumberDisplays the case number assigned to the Family.
Closed ReasonIf the family is no longer eligible for services, displays the reason selected using the drop-down menu.
Auth. to DateDisplays the date when the Authorization ends.
Recertification DateDisplays the date when the parent(s) is/are scheduled to recertify.
Initial Eligibility DateDisplays the earliest date when the child(ren) in this family was first eligible to start receiving subsidized childcare services. From this date, when their child reaches a certain amount of absences, a parent will receive a notification (email and KinderConnect message) to inform them that their care is at risk.
Application DateDisplays the date when the application for services was completed.
Absence Start DateDisplays the date that's used to count the children's absences and generate the reports and alerts in KinderTrack. In case of Recertification, it has to be updated to the date of the new authorization in the current eligibility period.
PhoneDisplays the telephone number for the Family.
Family TypeIndicates the type of Family. Select from the drop-down menu whether it is a Standard/Natural, Foster or Guardianship family. The parent(s) income and the family size count when selecting a “Natural/Standard” Family.
Private FamilyIf checked, this box indicates that the Family information is confidential, the Family is assigned to a case worker and the record can only be viewed by his or her supervisors.
HomelessIndicates is the Family is currently Homeless or not.
Child Only FamilyIf checked, this box indicates that the family share is waved.
On AppealIndicates if the Family is appealing a denial or termination or not.
Appeal Expiration DateDisplays the date when the Appeal expires. Note: An appeal must be handled within 30 days.
NotesEnter any notes relevant to the Family.
Close

↘️ Edit a Family Record

  1. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  2. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  3. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Family Record

  1. Press Delete to permanently remove a family record.
  2. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: A Family cannot be deleted if it has children with authorized schedules. Deleting a Family record also deletes the following information (pages) about the selected family:

  • Family, parents and child files
  • Need reason
  • Family, parents and child attributes
  • Income
  • Family notes
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Family page, click here.

20.content:
The Family > Parent page displays the information available for the selected parent. This section also explains how to Add, Edit and Delete a parent record.

The top section displays the existing information of the family previously selected. If more than one parent has been registered, it allows the user to click the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent and choose the one to review.

Add a Parent Record

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Parent page.
  3. Press New to open the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the parent into the fields. You can navigate from one field to another by using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Press Save to create a new parent record.

Repeat these steps to create an additional parent or responsible individual(s).

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Parent Page Field Descriptions

FieldsDescriptions
Last Name, First Name, Middle InitialDisplays the parent's or caretaker's Last Name, First Name, and Middle Initial.
SSNDisplays the Social Security Number of the selected parent or caretaker.
Birth DateDisplays the date of birth of the selected parent or caretaker.
Home PhoneDisplays the home telephone number of the selected parent or caretaker.
Work Phone / Ext.Displays the work phone and extension of the selected parent or caretaker.
Alternate Phone / Ext.Displays the alternate telephone number and extension, if any, of the selected parent or caretaker.
EmailDisplays the email address for the selected parent or caretaker.
RelationshipDisplays the type of relationship between the child and the parent or caretaker.
 Use the drop-down menu to select the appropriate type of relationship.
FlagsDisplays flags assigned to the selected parent or caretaker.
CINDisplays the CIN assigned by KinderTrack to that parent.
StatusUse the drop-down menu to select the status of the parent or caretaker in the system (active or inactive).
ResponsibilityDisplays the responsibility level for this parent or caretaker. Use the drop- down menu to select from the list whether the parent or caretaker is the primary guardian. KinderTrack uses the Primary Parent A for correspondence and both parents and caretakers for reporting. Another option is to select Other to reflect it is another individual that is responsible for the child.
GenderSelect the gender of the parent or caretaker from the drop-down menu.
SexSelect the sex of the parent or caretaker from the drop-down menu.
SSN StatusDisplays the Status of the Social Security Number of the selected parent or caretaker.
Hispanic/LatinoDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is Hispanic/Latino.
WhiteDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is White.
Black or African AmericanDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is Black or African American.
AsianDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is Asian.
American Indian or Alaskan NativeDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is American Indian or Alaskan Native.
Hawaiian or Pacific IslanderDisplays if the selected parent or caretaker is Hawaiian or Pacific Islander.
Citizen InformationDisplays the Citizen Information of the selected parent or caretaker.
Close

↘️ Edit a Parent Record

  1. Press the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent to choose the parent you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Parent Record

  1. Press the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent to choose the parent you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Deleting a Parent record also deletes the following information (pages) about the chosen family:

  • Parent Incomes
  • Parent Attributes
  • Needs
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Parent page, click here.

21.content:
Use the Family > Needs page to document the reason for the family request for childcare as well as the desired days and hours of care.

The top portion of the Needs page provides family information and allows the user to select the parent to which the need corresponds. The Needs List table details the reasons for services that have been saved for this parent and provides a general overview. Click on the radio button corresponding to the need you would like to review, the system highlights the selected record and the bottom half of the screen displays the details of the selection.

The example below describes the fields when the Need Reason High School Education is selected. The fields vary depending on the Need Reason selected.

Add a Need Record

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Press Needs.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent to choose the parent with the Need.
  4. Press New.Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
