  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select a Need Reason.
  6. Enter the details for the selected Need Reason in the appropriate fields. Note that the system opens the fields to be edited based on the type of need selected, some requiring more detail than others. The example below shows the fields for Working reason.
  7. Press Save to create the new Need record.

Note: 

  • If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.
  • There is another way to set up a Family Need. There are two steps:
    1. The Admin User must create the Need under the Admin > Tables page under Need Reasons.
    2. Then the Admin User must edit this in the District Setting > Need Reasons to choose the created Need.

↘️ Needs Fields Descriptions

FieldsDescriptions
Employer / Address 1/ Address 2 / City / State / Zip Code / Ext.Enter the Employer name and address in the appropriate fields.
Contact NameEnter the name of the contact at the Employer location.
NoteEnter any notes relevant to this employment or reason.
Phone / EmailEnter the telephone number and email for the contact at the Employer location.
VaryingClick on this checkbox if the Need Reason requires a flexible schedule.
Max Hours per weekIf this is a flexible schedule and Varying hours was selected, enter the maximum number of hours of care per week that can be provided under this need reason.
Max Hours per dayIf this is a flexible schedule and Varying hours was selected, enter the maximum number of hours of care per day that can be provided under this need reason.
Travel Time minutesEnter the additional time in minutes the parent will need to commute to and from the Need's location, in this case, the place of employment. 
The Max Hours will be adjusted accordingly to allow for additional time of childcare.
Travel DaysEnter the number of days when the parent will need to commute to and from the Need's location, in this case, the place of employment.
Start Date / End DateEnter the start and end dates for the need of care or use the Calendar button to select.
From / ToEnter the start time in the first From field, under the appropriate day of the week, followed by am or pm. Enter the end time in the first To field, under the appropriate day of the week, followed by am or pm. 
The system automatically populates the time if you just type an "a" for "am" or a "p" for "pm. 
Note: If the parent has a split schedule under the same Need Reason, enter the second pair of start and end times in the spaces provided below.
Total HoursWhen Type of Total Hours is selected, the system generates the total number of hours per day allowed under the need reason.
Paste M-S / ClearClick Paste M-S to populate the schedule across all the days of the week if they have the same start and end times. 
Since this selection populates the schedule for seven (7) days a week, press the Clear button above the day of the week to delete any days when care is not necessary. 
The Clear button at the right of the line will delete any times horizontally.
Close

↘️ Edit a Need Record

  1. Press the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent to choose the parent with the Need reason that you would like to edit.
  2. Click the radio button for the Need reason you would like to edit.
  3. Press Edit to make the necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Need Record

  1. Press the drop-down arrow next to Select Parent to choose the parent with the Need reason that you would like to remove.
  2. Click the radio button to select the Need reason you would like to delete.
  3. Press Delete to permanently remove the selected record.
  4. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Deleting a Need record will not affect any other portion of the Family file.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Needs page, click here.

22.content:
The Family > Child page displays information about the selected child such as age, birth date, Social Security number, and CIN. This section provides information on how to Add, Edit and Delete a child record.

Add a Child Record

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Child page.
  3. Press New.
  4. Enter the information about the child into the fields. Use the tab key or click on each field to navigate from field to field.
    1. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Enter any notes relevant to the child.
  6. Press Save to create a new child record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Family Child Fields

FieldDescription
Last Name, First Name, Middle InitialDisplays the child Last Name, First Name, and Middle Initial.
SSNDisplays the Social Security Number of the selected child.
Birth DateDisplays the date of birth of the selected child.
Child AgeThe system automatically calculates the age of the selected child based on the date of birth entered and populates this field.
GradeUse the drop-down menu to select the child’s school grade (I/T=Infant/Toddler, P=Preschool, K=Kindergarten, 1=First Grade, etc.)
FlagsIndicates the type of Flags assigned to the child which drive system behavior. 
Press Select >> next to Child Flags to choose the available flags that meet the child-specific information and/or needs (special needs) and make your selection. 
Your System Administrators sets the values of the Flags in the Admin > Tables section.
RelationshipUse the drop-down menu to select the relationship between the child and the parent/caretaker.
CINDisplays the Child Identification Number assigned to this child.
Foreign Key 2The child with that foreign key listed on the Child page. 
The foreign key is used to link the child to another system that interfaces with KinderTrack.
Foreign Key 3The child with that foreign key listed on the Child page. 
The foreign key is used to link the child to another system that interfaces with KinderTrack.
GenderUse the drop-down menu to select the gender of this child.
SexUse the drop-down menu to select the sex of this child.
StatusUse the drop-down menu to select the status of the child in the system (active or inactive).
Enrollment StatusThe system automatically determines the enrollment status of the selected child based on information previously entered populates this field.
Kindergarten DateDisplays the date when the child starts Kindergarten.
Child Has a DisabilityClick on the available checkboxes to indicate if the child has a Disability.
Child Deemed Eligible for Special Needs RateClick the checkbox if the child will receive a Special Needs Rate.
SSN StatusUse the drop-down arrow menu to select the status of the Social Security Number of the child, if present or the reason for it not been available.
Hispanic/LatinoDisplays if the selected child is Hispanic/Latino.
WhiteDisplays if the selected child is White.
Black or African AmericanDisplays if the selected child is Black or African American.
AsianDisplays if the selected child is Asian.
American Indian or Alaskan NativeDisplays if the selected child is American Indian or Alaskan Native.
Hawaiian or Pacific IslanderDisplays if the selected child is Hawaiian or Pacific Islander.
Citizen InformationDisplays the Citizen Information of the selected parent or caretaker.
Citizen InformationUse the drop-down arrow when editing to select the citizenship status of the child.
NoteEnter any notes relevant to the child.
Close

↘️ Edit a Child Record

  1. Select the child you would like to edit from the Select Child drop-down menu.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save
Close

↘️ Delete a Child Record

  1. Use the Select Child drop-down menu to choose the child you would like to delete. Press Delete to permanently remove the record.
  2. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: If a child has an authorized schedule, the system prevents deletion of the record. Deleting a Child record also deletes the following information (pages) about the selected child:

  • Attributes
  • Incomes
  • Notes
Close

↘️ View Absent Days

To view the number of days a child has been absent.

  1. Press View Absent Days to open the Absent Days window.
  2. Press OK when you are done reviewing the information.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Child page, click here.

23.content:
Family > Income

The Family > Income itemizes the family’s income, showing information for the family as a whole and for the selected family member. The Monthly Income Worksheet feature automatically calculates monthly total income when entering the amounts of different pay stubs.

Add/Edit Income

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Income page.
  3. Select the family member for which you would like to add an income record. If more than one family member receives income, add the income for each member separately.
  4. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.

  1. Enter the income Effective Date.
  2. If the family member receives compensation from different sources, KinderTrack calculates the monthly wages based on weekly or other frequency of wages from all sources. Click next to the appropriate income type to open the Monthly Income Worksheet.
  3. Complete the Monthly Individual Income fields for the selected individual.
    • Income description with (*) asterisks indicates eligibility income or income included in the total.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Status for this income verification, Active or Inactive.
  5. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  6. Once all of the correct information has been entered, click Save to create or modify the new income record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Monthly Income Worksheet

Monthly Income Worksheet

  1. Click on the corresponding to the desired income category. The income fields displayed will vary depending on your selection. The example below shows the fields corresponding to Wages.
  2. Select the Pay Period type. The number of pay stubs varies based on the pay period type selected.
  3. Enter the income per pay stub.
  4. If the family member has two jobs at one time, enter information for Job #2 as well.
  5. Press Reset to return all values to zero and re-enter pay stubs details.
  6. Select the Use Hours X Wage check box and hours and wage columns will display.
  7. Press Calculate.
  8. Press OK to populate the appropriate Total Monthly Income fields on the Income page.
  9. Press Save to create a new income record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Income page, click here.

24.content:
The Family > Eligibility Characteristics page is used to determine need and priority enrollment. This allows users to select additional criteria for a family. The available Eligibility Criteria are table driven, and may be set in Administration > Tables page under Eligibility Type.

Edit Eligibility Characteristics

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Eligibility Characteristics page.
  3. Press Edit
  4. Enter the effective date for the eligibility determination into the Effective Date field or use the calendar to select.
  5. Use the status drop-down menu to select whether the family is Eligible, Not Eligible, or Pending.
  6. Enter the end date for the eligibility determination into the End Date field or use the calendar to select.
  7. Click Select >> next to Characteristics to choose the characteristics of the Eligibility.
  8. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  9. Press Save.

To test your knowledge on the Family > Eligibility Characteristics page, click here.

25.content:
Use the Family > Schedule page to set up a schedule for a child with a Provider based on the hours entered in the bpage. 

If a child is school-age, it is necessary to create two schedules; a non-school schedule (for vacation days) and a school schedule. If a child has more than one provider, each provider will need a schedule.

↘️ Add a Schedule

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Schedule page.
  3. Use the Select Child drop-down menu to choose the child you would like to create a schedule for.
  4. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  5. Enter all the details relevant to the care the child will receive.
  6.  Enter the information about the Schedule into the fields. You can navigate from one field to another by using the tab key or by clicking on each field.
    • Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

    FieldDescription
    Fill Schedule
    		This option allows the user to copy schedule information from a pre-existing child schedule.
    Family
    		Displays the last name of the family.
    Family ID
    		Displays the unique identifier that the system generates for the family.
    Case Number
    		Displays the case number assigned to the Family.
    Select Child
    		Displays the name of the child previously selected for this schedule.
    Select Schedule
    		Use this drop-down list to display current and past schedules for the selected child which can be used for creating the new schedule.
    Fill From Schedule
    		Use this drop-down list to display all other family members' schedules that can also be used to populate the new schedule.
    Provider
    		Click Select >> to open a window where you can select a provider by its specifics or generate a list of available providers in the area. Selecting the Provider enables the Profile, Type of Care and Program fields.
    Profile
    		Use this drop-down list to display the selected provider's profile information, configured in the Provider > Profile page. Since a Provider may have more than one profile, select the one profile that applies to this schedule.
    Type of Care
    		This drop-down list displays the types of care the selected provider offers and is configured in the Provider > Type of Care page. It can also be selected in the Provider > Profile page.
    Program
    		This drop-down list displays the funding streams available for the selected provider. The programs are assigned to Providers in the Provider > Profile page.
    Rate Type
    		This drop-down list displays the types of rates the selected provider offers.
    Flags
    		Click Select >> to open a window that lists relevant flags. The flags are configured in the Administration
    Tables section.
    Billing Cycle
    		This drop-down list displays the billing cycle options available for Schedules.
    Pay to Parent
    		Check this box if payment is to be made directly to the parent/caretaker instead of the provider.
    Start Date, End Date
    		Enter the Start Date and the End Date of the
    Schedule or use the Calendar button.
    Inclusion Rate
    		Displays the inclusion rate. If left blank, it will default to 100%. If the check box was enabled for Child Deemed Eligible for Special Needs Rate, the percentage can be entered manually by TWC staff in the Family > Child page,
    Notes
    		Enter any notes relevant to this schedule.
  7. You can populate the Non-School Day Schedule and a School Day Schedule grid by copying from the Parent Needs page, filling from a previous schedule, or entering In and Out times manually. 
    FieldDescription
    Regular Hours
    		Use the drop-down to select the desired schedule.

    Note:
    Non-school day schedule: 
    Weekday - full time or part time 
    Weekend - full time or part time

    School day schedule:
    Weekday - can be blended
    Weekend - can be full time or part time
  8. Click Save to create a new Schedule record using the information just entered.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

Close Section

↘️ Fill a Schedule

If a family has more than one child, or the child has more than one schedule, the Fill Schedule button populates the Non-School Day Schedule and the School Day Schedule by copying the child's school and non-school schedule information from an existing schedule or from one child to another.

  1. Select the child you would like to create a schedule for.
  2. Press New.
  3. In the Fill From Schedule drop-down, select the child schedule that you would like to duplicate. Press Fill Schedule.
  4. Change the Schedule Start and End Date to the desired dates, edit the note, or make any other necessary changes.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Edit a Schedule

  1. Select the child and schedule you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make changes as necessary.
  3. Press Save.

Note: Any changes made to an existing schedule will create a new system generated NOA. Also, if payments have already been Calculated but not Paid, editing and saving the child's schedule will revert all payments covered by the schedule to Not Calculated. If any payments have already been Paid, any changes you make to the schedule will not affect the Paid payment. Payment adjustments will be necessary to include such schedule changes but will not be reflected on the existing payment. A payment adjustment will have to be made to reflect such changes.

Close

↘️ Delete a Schedule

  1. Select the child and schedule that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently delete that schedule.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed. The system also alerts the operator that an attempt is being made to delete a schedule, and if Auto NOAs is enabled, it also sends an alert indicating that an approved notice is in place.

Note: You cannot delete a schedule associated with payment in Calculated or higher status. Deleting a Schedule record will also delete the following information (pages) about the selected schedule:

  • Absence periods
  • Notices and Timesheets associated with that schedule
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Schedule page, click here.

26.content:
Use the Family > Family Notes to enter and view specific case notes about the selected family. The notes are for internal use only. By default, they are listed in reverse chronological order, but you can change the sorting at any time by clicking on any of the column headings.

Add Note

  1. Click New to create a new Note.
  2. Type your note about the family or child. Clickto spell check your entry.
  3. Select the Type of note you are adding from the drop-down menu. The System Administrator determines the Family Notes types available in the Administration > Tables > Family Note Types page. Common note types are:
    • Payment
    • Reminder
    • General
  4. Select the Contact Type of the note you are adding from the drop-down menu.
  5. Select the Event Type of the note you are adding from the drop-down menu.
  6. Press Save.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ View Notes

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Family Notes page.
  3. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  4. Press Select >> next to Note Type to identify the type of note(s) to be included in the search. Click OK.
  5. It is also possible to search for specific notes using a Keyword. For example, if entering the Keyword "recert," the search will return any notes that contain the word "recert" in them.
  6. Press Select >> next to Contact Type to identify the type of Methods of Contact(s) to be included in the search. Click OK.
  7. Press Select >> next to Event Type to identify the type of event(s) to be included in the search. Click OK.
  8. Press Options to select the number of records you would like to be displayed in the results grid per page. To select the visible columns, press Select >> next to Visible Columns and click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose.
  9. Press Refresh to update the search results.
  10. The system displays the search results under the Notes List. Select the note you would like to review. Press Notes Report to open the report parameters window where you can select the Notes to be included and the type of output. The selected Note and its details display in the section below the Notes Report.
Close

↘️ Edit Note

To edit an existing note, from the Notes List:

  1. Click the radio button next to the note you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit .
  3. Make the necessary changes to the contents of the Note, the Type, the Contact Type, the Event Type, or the Date.
  4. Press Save to overwrite the existing entry.
Close

↘️ Delete Note

To delete an existing note, from the Notes List:

  1. Click the radio button next to the note you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed. Once the note is deleted it no longer shows up in the Notes List section.
Close

↘️ Notes Reports

It is possible to print Family Notes by using the Report section.

  1. Click Notes Report to open the report parameters window.
  2. Select the notes that you would like to include in the report. Include All Notes in Queue will include all those that satisfied your search conditions or you can include only the Selected Note.
  3. Select the Output Type: PDF, Comma Delimited or HTML.
  4. Press Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Family Notes page, click here.

27.content:
Use the Family > Notice page to approve, authorize, modify and terminate child schedules. The system automatically authorizes the schedule after saving a notice. The system only requires an approval notice when a family has fees assigned, due to the fact that fees are not active until the system generates and authorizes the Approval notice. If a schedule is not authorized, the system will not allow recording attendance, printing timesheets or making payments.

The Notice page has two sections: Notice List and Detail.

The Notice List section lists all notices generated for the selected family, whether they have been created by an operator or automatically generated by the system. By default, the system sorts this list in reverse chronological order, but it is possible to change the sort order by clicking any of the desired column headings.

The user can define the columns to appear in the Notice List. Click Options and select by checking the boxes next to the available titles.

Click the radio button next to a specific notice to select. The system displays the information for the selected notice in the Detail section of this page.

All newly created notices also appear in this list. Remember, after creating a notice, it needs to be authorized in order for it to be active. For more information, refer to Authorizing a Notice.

Add a Notice

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Notice page.
  3. Click New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Add Family Notice.
  6. Type the effective date in the field provided for Effective Date or use the Calendar to select. The Effective Date is the date when the action been taken on the selected schedule(s) is effective. It can be a past, current or future date.
  7. Select the Action for the chosen schedule from the drop-down list. The available options are Approval, Change, Denial, Discontinue and Recertification. The data fields vary depending on your selection.
  8. Use the drop-down arrow to select the primary Language of the family.
  9. Use the drop-down arrow to select the Regulations for the Notice.
  10. Check the box in the Fees column, next to the child name, to indicate to which child(ren) the fees will be assessed.
  11. Select the Schedule(s) by clicking in column S next to the child name. You can include multiple children's schedules in the same notice.
  12. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Office Location that is issuing the notice.
  13. Press Select >> next to Worker to choose the name of the individual responsible for issuing this notice. Please note that the system automatically defaults to the name of the worker currently logged in.
  14. Enter the telephone number under Phone.
  15. Type the Issue Date for the notice or use the Calendar to select.
  16. Press the drop-down arrow to select the method of Distribution of Notice.
  17. Type the Date of Distribution for the notice or use the Calendar to select.
  18. Use this field to enter the Tracking Number associated with the selected method of delivery of the notice, if any.
  19. Type any Comments for the action.
  20. Type any Provider Notes for the action.
  21. Press Save to create a new record.
    Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.
  22. You can now Print the Notice using the print button available for Pending Notices.
  23. The Notice will not go into effect until it's Authorized.

Note: If Use Automated Notices is selected in Administration > Region Settings, the system generates notices each time a change occurs in a child schedule.

↘️ Family Notice Fields

FieldDescription
StatusDisplays the status of the Notice.
Effective DateEnter the date or use the Calendar button to select the Effective Date the Notice.
ActionUse this drop-down list to select the type of Notice of Action. 
The available options are Approval, Change, Denial, Discontinue and Recertification.
Family NameDisplays the name of the Family previously selected for this Notice.
LanguageUse this drop-down list to select the Language you want the Notice to be.
RegulationsUse this drop-down list to display all Regulations that can also be used to populate the new Notice.
Family Share Effective DateEnter the date or use the Calendar button to select the Family Share Effective Date.
Family ShareCheck the box in the Fees column, next to the child name, to indicate to which child(ren) the fees will be assessed. Note: if you select a date after the selected Notice date, the Previous Notice  will display as a second row.
OverriddenCheck the box to show Override current Family Fees. 
This will automatically show the Overridden Family Fee Amount text box.
SchedulesCheck this box to select the Schedule(s) by clicking in column S next to the child name. 
You can include multiple children's schedules in the same notice.
Office LocationUse this drop-down list displays the Office Location of where the Notice is being created.
WorkerDisplays the Agency Representative that is creating the Notice.
PhoneEnter the Agency Representative that is creating the Notice.
Issue DateEnter the Issue Date or use the Calendar button to select the date the notice was issued.
Distribution of NoticeUse this drop-down list to select the Distribution of Notice. 
This can be through Regular Mail, Certified Mail, or Other.
Date of DistributionEnter the Date of Distribution or use the Calendar button to select the date the notice was distributed.
Tracking numberEnter the Tracking Number associated with the distribution.
CommentsEnter any comments associated with the notice.
Provider NotesEnter any notes relevant to this schedule.
Close

↘️ Edit a Notice

You can only Edit Notices that are Pending authorization.

  1. Click the radio button to select the notice that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make changes as necessary.
  3. Press Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new reason.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Notice

  1. Click the radio button to select the notice that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove this notice.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
    • Note: It is not possible to completely delete Authorized Notices. They will continue to show in the list with "Deleted" status. Only "Pending" notices will be completely removed from the list after deletion. In some cases, such as when a Payment has already been made for the authorized care, it is not possible to delete a Notice. The System Administrator sets the conditions that disallow deleting a notice. Deleting a Notice will not affect any other portion of the Family file.
  4. Upon deletion of a Notice, timesheets are no longer available for the period covered by that authorization. If a system generated Notice still exists, and only the fee generating Notice is deleted, the timesheets can still be generated but the system does not apply any Family Fees.
Close

↘️ Print a Notice

  1. Click the radio button to select the notice that you would like to print.
  2. The system displays a screen to select if you would like to Address Page or not and to select your Output Type.
  3. Use the drop-down arrows to select your preferences.
  4. Press Print.
  5. The system displays the Notice of Action.
  6. Press the Print icon in the right corner of your screen. Note: Depending on your browser, the steps might be different.
Close

↘️ Send to KinderConnect

  1. Click the radio button to select the notice that you would like to send to KinderConnect.
  2. Press Send To KinderConnect.
  3. The system displays a screen to confirm. Press Send.
  4. A message displays confirming it sent successfully to parent in KinderConnect.
  5. The Notice is now loaded on the Family > Documents Page, meaning that the Primary Parent will be able to see it in KinderConnect:
Close

↘️ Send to BridgeCare

The Send to BridgeCare button allows the user to send the Notice through BridgeCare for those Primary Parents that never had an account in KinderConnect. Note: This button will only display when selecting an Initial Denial Notice.

  1. Click the radio button to select the notice that you would like to send to BridgeCare.
  2. Press Send To BridgeCare.
  3. The system displays a screen to confirm. Press Send.
  4. A message displays confirming it sent successfully to parent in BridgeCare.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Family Notice page, click here.

28.content:
The Family > Payment page allows the user to review payments made for the selected family. It is possible to view all records or specific records by specifying status and/or flags.

View Payments

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payments page.
  3. Enter the date range for the records you want to view, or use the Calendar to set the Period dates.
  4. Press Select >> to choose the Payment Status and Payment Flags parameters for the records you would like to view.
  5. Press Refresh to display all payments in the Payments Queue that match the selected criteria.
  6. Click on the Payment ID to view the details of a specific payment.

Reports

It is possible to generate the following reports from the Family > Payments page:

  • The Payment Summary Report includes a summary of all payments in the queue, showing basic payment information for each.
  • The Payment Details Report generates a much more in-depth report for each payment, including schedule and rate information for each paid day.
  • Timesheets can be printed from this page and sent to the provider for child attendance tracking.

To print a report, select the payments to be included by clicking on the check box next to each desired Payment ID number or press + to select all (press again to deselect).

  1. Click on the name of the desired Report to open the report parameters window.
  2. Select the desired parameters, whether the report should be grouped by Provider or by Operator, whether you would like page breaks separating the different providers or operators, the output type, the address location, etc. Note that parameters vary for each report.
  3. Press Print.

To test your knowledge on the Family > Payments page, click here.

29.content:
Use the Family > Absence Periods page to track scheduled absences such as vacations.

Add an Absence Period

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Absence Periods page.
  3. Select the Child for which you are creating an absence period.
  4. Select a Schedule for the child.
  5. Press New.
  6. The lower portion of the screen opens for editing.
  7. Enter the date range for the absence, or use the Calendar to set the Start Date and End Date.
  8. Enter any notes relevant to the absence in the Notes field.
  9. Use the drop-down menu to select the Attendance Type. Select Blackout or Excused.
    • Blackout is typically used for absence periods such as family vacations. Setting an attendance type to Blackout results in days being non-reimbursable.
    • When Excused is selected, the system enables the Attendance Code drop down. Press the drop-down arrow to select the corresponding Attendance Code for the absence.
      Note: The selected attendance code automatically appears on the child's timesheet and payment or non-payment of these days will adhere to the Attendance Code rules, described later under Admin > Attendance Codes.
  10. Press Save.

↘️ Edit an Absence Period

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Absence Periods page.
  3. Select the Child for which you are editing an absence period.
  4. Select a Schedule for the child.
  5. Click the radio button next to the Start Date to select the Absence Period you would like to edit.
  6. Press Edit.
  7. Make the necessary changes. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  8. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Absence Period

  1. Select the Child for which you would like to delete the absence period.
  2. Click the radio button next to the Start Date to select the Absence Period you would like to delete.
  3. Press Delete to permanently remove the absence period. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Absence Periods page, click here.

30.content:
Use the Family > RFI page to keep track of the documents needed from the parent, usually for verification purposes. 

The Family > RFI page lists documents that may be required for each particular case and allows the user to change the document status (Required, Not Required, Received, Pending, Unknown). It also keeps track of dates of documentation requests and receipts. The System Administrator sets up the documents that are required.

Edit a File Page

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Family > RFI page.
  3. Select the item you would like to edit by clicking on the appropriate check box. This action enables the Edit button. If there is more than one item requiring the same changes, click the appropriate check boxes.
  4. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.
  5. Enter the information into the enabled fields.
    • Status: Press the drop-down arrow to select the appropriate status for the item(s): Not Required, Pending, Received, Required or Unknown.
  6. Enter the Date Requested, Date Received, Date Due and Date Expires or use the Calendar to select.
  7. Press Save.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record. You will receive a warning message if the Due Date or Date Expires falls on a closed business day.

Reports

It is possible to print the Incomplete File Notice (English or Spanish) report by using the Report section on the Family File page. Use the Incomplete File Notice to notify parent(s) whenever it is necessary to review information or continue the enrollment process.

  1. Click the report Incomplete File Notice to display the report parameters window.
  2. Enter the due date of the document request in the Document Deadline field.
  3. In the Discontinue Date field, enter the date when childcare payments will be discontinued if the document is not received.
  4. Press Select >> next to Signer to select the name of the Operator who will be signing the notice.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow next to Show Pending and select Yes to show both Pending and Required, or No to only show those with a Required status.
  6. Press the drop-down arrow next to Application and select if this is an Existing or a New application.
  7. Modify the FileText as needed.
  8. Enter any relevant comments.
  9. Select the Output Type: PDF.
  10. Press Print.

To test your knowledge on the Family > RFI page, click here.

31.content:
Use the Family > Additional Fees page to track fees that the family owes for some childcare- related issue (e.g. diaper service, meals, transportation, field trip, reimbursement repayment, etc.). These are fees that a family has to pay on top of the income-based family fees determined by eligibility levels.

The System Administrator sets the parameters in the Admin > Region Settings page that determine if the Additional Fee Collection By is Provider or County. If set to Provider, the Provider collects the fee from the family and future payments by the Agency to the Provider are reduced by the amount of the fee. If set to County, the payment amounts to the Provider are not affected and the Agency is responsible for collecting the fee from the Family.

Add an Additional Fee

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Additional Fees page.
  3. Press New.
  4. Select the type of Additional Fees by pressing the drop-down arrow.
  5. Click Select >> and choose the names of the Child(ren) the Additional Fees applies to.
  6. Click Select >> and choose the names of the Provider(s) that will receive the Additional Fees.
  7. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  8. Enter the Total Amount. Use this field when there is a finite amount to be deducted in weekly increments.
  9. Enter the Amount Per Week due for each week of childcare.
  10. Enter the Priority level for the Additional Fees.
  11. Press Save to calculate the additional family fee into payments beginning on the start date specified.

↘️ Edit an Additional Fee

  1. Click the radio button next to the Additional Fee that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  3. Make the necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Additional Fee

  1. Click the radio button next to the Additional Fee that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the additional fee.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Family > Additional Fees page, click here.

32.content:
The Family > Documents page displays the existing documents associated with the selected family that are available in the system. All documents are imported from the Intake application. Selecting a document enables the Download button.

If a document is set to Read-Only in KinderTrack, then it will not be possible to delete or modify it in KinderConnect. However, in KinderTrack, the document Read-Only state does not affect which actions can be performed on the document.

Preview a Document

  1. Select the Family activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Documents page.
  3. A table listing all Documents corresponding to the selected Family displays.
  4. Press the Thumbnail Size drop down arrow to select the size of the image displayed in the table. The image under the Thumbnail column header image immediately adjusts to the selected size.
  5. Click Options to set up the visible columns and how many results to display per page.

Download a Document

  1. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Family document you would like to download. The details of the selected document display on the lower portion of the page.
  2. Press Download.
  3. The name of the selected file displays in the lower portion of your screen. Click on the file name to open.
    Note: Depending on your browser, the steps might be different.

To test your knowledge on the Family > Documents page, click here.

33.content:
The Provider > Alerts page allows you to view and process alerts for Provider specialists generated for critical areas of case management (e.g. license is expiring). A user may also manually generate an alert to another user.

View Alert

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Alerts page.
  3. Choose whether to view alerts for all providers assigned to a provider specialist or just the current provider selected. If you would like to see the alerts for the current provider only, click the check box for Current Provider only.
  4. Press Select >> next to Alert Status to identify the type of alerts you would like to view, Processed and/ or Not Processed.
  5. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  6. Press Refresh to view the Alerts matching the selections just made.

Processing a Provider Alert

The system will generate a list of alerts based on your selections.

  1. Press Options to modify the number of records to be displayed in the Alert List search results and the visible columns.
  2. Click the check box corresponding to the alert you would like to process to activate additional buttons on top of the page.
  3. Select an action:
    • Press Refresh to remove any criteria previously selected and reset the Alert List.
    • Press Process to process the selected alert. The system prompts you to open the page associated with the selected Alert to review the details or to Cancel and return to the Alerts List. Press OK to proceed and open the Provider page where you can take any necessary action. Note: The status of the Alert changes to Processed.
    • You can revert the Process action of an Alert. Click on the corresponding checkbox to select the Alert. Press Reset. The system prompts for confirmation prior to resetting a Processed alert status to Not Processed. Press OK.
    • Click the Snooze button to set the alert date for a future date. Type the number of days you would like to postpone the alert. Press OK to proceed.

↘️ List of Provider Alerts

Alert
Comment
New Case Worker
Creates an Alert when a case worker is assigned a new provider.
New Payment Tech
Creates an Alert when a new payment tech is assigned a provider.
Pending RFI Document Due
Creates an Alert when a pending document in the Provider File section‘s due date has been reached.
Provider Document RequiredCreates an alert when a document in the provider RFI expires.
Provider Inactive
Creates an alert when a provider’s type of care end date has passed.
Provider Renewal
Creates an Alert a pre-defined number of days before a provider is due for renewal.
RFI Document Expires
Creates an Alert a pre-defined number of days before a document in the Provider File section will expire.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Alerts page, click here.

34.content:
Use the Provider > Search page to search for and access records for all types of providers. The Search page contains a variety of fields you can use to enter one or more criteria to look for in your search.

This page has three (3) sections:

  • Search Criteria
  • Search Results
  • Reports

Search for a Provider

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria into the available fields. The more criteria you enter the more exact your search results will be.
  4. Press Options to modify the number of records to be displayed in the Alert List search results and the visible columns.
  5. Press Search to display the findings in the Results grid.

↘️ List of Provider Search Criteria

FieldHow to enter informationWhat the search will find
Legal NameManuallyAll providers with the Legal Name listed on the Provider page that begins with the characters entered.
Last NameManuallyAll providers with the Last Name listed on the Provider page that begins with the characters entered.
First NameManuallyAll providers with the First Name listed on the Provider page that begins with the characters entered.
RoleUse multiselect to select one or more rolesAll providers with the selected Role(s) listed on the Provider page.
Provider TypeUse multiselect to select one or more provider typesAll providers with the selected Provider Type(s) listed on the Provider page.
WorkerUse multiselect to select one or more workersAll providers with the selected Worker(s) (Operators) listed on the Provider page.
Provider IDManuallyAll providers with the Provider ID listed on the Provider page that begins with the characters entered.
CCF SIDManuallyAll providers with this CCFS ID Number listed on the Provider page.
Vendor NumberManuallyAll providers with this Vendor Number listed on the Provider page.
StatusUse multiselect to select one or more statusesAll providers with the selected Status (es) listed on the Provider page.
Tax ID or SSNManuallyAll providers with that Tax ID or SSN listed on the Provider page.
License NumberManuallyAll providers with that License Number listed on the Provider page.
PhoneManuallyAll providers with that Phone Number listed on the Provider page.
Care Address 1ManuallyAll providers with that Address listed on the Provider page.
CityManually or use the House button to select cityAll providers with the selected City listed on the Provider page.
StateManually or it automatically appears when using the House button to select a cityAll providers with that State listed on the Provider page.
Zip Code / ExtManually or it automatically appears when using the House button to select a cityAll providers with that Zip Code / Ext listed on the Provider page.
LanguagesUse multiselect to select one or more languagesAll providers with the selected Language(s) listed on the Provider page.
Missing DocumentationClick the check boxAll providers with items listed on the File page as Required or Pending.
Contract StatusUse the drop-down to select a districtAll providers with the selected contract status.
Attendance MethodUse multiselect to select one or more methodsAll providers with the selected method(s) used to submit attendance listed on the Provider page.
DistrictUse the drop-down to select a districtAll providers with the selected District listed on the Provider page.
Close

↘️ Working with Search Results

Working with Search Results

  1. Click Options to customize your Search Results.
  2. Click Select >> next to Visible Columns to define the visible columns to display in your Search Results.
  3.  Click on the desired checkboxes to select, click again to deselect.
  4. Press OK.
  5. Enter the number of records you would like to view per page in the Page Size field.
  6. Press OK. 

Selecting Records

You can view information for one provider, multiple providers, or all providers:

  • For one provider, click the Provider Name you would like to view to open that Provider page.
  • For multiple providers, select by clicking the check box(es) next to each Provider Name you would like to view or click the (+) plus sign on the upper left of the grid to select all (click again to deselect). Click on one of the provider names to open that provider's page which will now include arrow keys in the Search Results section that can be used to navigate between the pages of the selected providers.

Note: If you are not certain which record is the one you need, select all possibilities and review when on the Provider page.

Close

↘️ Reports

Reports are available based on the operator roles assigned by the System Administrator. The Provider Listing Report and various Provider Mailing Labels are generated from the Provider > Search page:

  • The Provider Listing Report generates a listing displaying the provider ID, name, vendor number, address, city/state/zip, phone number and type of care offered for each Provider selected in the Search Results. Click on Provider Listing Report to select the order you want it generated, sorted by Zip or Name.
  • The Provider Mailing Labels report generates mailing labels for each Provider selected in the Search Results. Click on the desired type of label to select the order you want it generated, sorted by Zip or Name.

All records on the reports are specific to the search criteria. Once you have selected the report you would like to print:

  1. Click the report name.
  2. A new window opens allowing you to choose the parameters for the report.
  3. Sort By: Choose Zip or Name.
  4. Output Type: PDF.
  5. Press Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Search page, click here.

35.content:
The Provider > Summary page provides information on the last selected Provider, Type of Care, Contact and Forms. Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Summary page.
  3. Use the Search Result arrows to locate the provider you wish to work with. If you only selected one provider the last time, the arrows will be disabled. Providers need to be preselected using the Provider > Search page for you to view them in the Summary.
  4. Choose the Provider you would like to view by clicking the appropriate link.
  5. The system opens that Provider page.

↘️ Provider Forms

It is possible to print the Provider Closure Letter report from the Provider > Summary page.

  1. Use the Search Result arrows to locate the provider you wish to work with. If only one Provider is selected on the Search screen, the system disables the arrows.
  2. Once in the desired Provider > Summary page, click the Form you would like to print to open a new window where you can select the report parameters.
  3. Choose the desired parameters.
  4. Click Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Summary page, click here.

36.content:
The Provider > Provider page displays information relevant to the selected Provider, such as phone number, address, region, quality rating, worker, etc. It also allows the user to Add, Edit and Delete provider records. Use the Search page to locate the provider you would like to work with. Once selected, use the links resulting from the Search or click on the menu items on the Navigation Bar to access each section of the Provider activity.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

Add a Provider Record

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Provider page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the Provider into the appropriate fields. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field. 
  5. Press Save to create a new Provider record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Provider Search Fields

FieldDescription
Provider IDDisplays the unique identifier ID that the system generates for each Provider.
Type of CareDisplays the type of care that is provided to the Child.
Tax ID or SSNDisplays the Provider Tax ID or SSN.
Vendor NumberDisplays the unique vendor number assigned to the Provider.
Last NameDisplays the Last Name of the Provider.
First NameDisplays the First Name of the Provider.
Business NameDisplays the Provider's Business Name.
Tax Payer NameDisplays the Provider's Name for tax purposes.
StatusDisplays the Provider Status as selected from the drop-down menu. (KinderSystems use only)
ContractedDisplays the Provider's contract status.
Care Address 1, Care Address 2These fields display the Provider’s address information.
City, State, Zip Code / Ext, CountyThese fields display the Provider's City, State, Zip Code/Ext, and County information.
Phone / ExtDisplays the Provider’s Telephone Number and Extension.
RMR RegionThis field automatically populates based on the Provider's Zip Code. Note that a Provider may serve more than one Zip Code.
Quality RatingDisplays the Provider's position in regards to Quality Rating.
WorkerDisplays the name of the case Worker assigned to the Provider. 
Press Select >> to identify by searching by First Name, Last Name, or Operator Roles.
Payment TechnicianDisplays the name of the Payment Technician assigned to this Provider. 
Press Select >> to identify by searching by First Name, Last Name, or Operator Roles. 
Note: This field is required when setting Provider for Web Submittal.
Mail Address 1, Mail Address 2This field is used when the mailing address of the Provider is different from Care Address. 
Note: If a complete Care Address is listed, many documents mailed use this field. If the Mail Address is left blank or incomplete, then the Care Address is used.
Mail City, Mail State, Mail Zip Code / ExtThis field is used when the mailing city, state and zip code of the Provider if different from Care Address.
LanguagesDisplays the languages the Provider and/or his staff speak. 
Press Select >> to display a list of languages to choose from.
FlagsThe Flags link displays any flags applicable to the Provider. 
Options include Remote Attendance which is a required field when setting up a provider for submitting attendance remotely and for online billing.
Attendance MethodIndicates if the method that the Provider uses to submit attendance is online (Web Submittal) or using Timesheets.
FaxThis field displays the Provider’s fax number.
NotesDisplays any notes relevant to the Provider.
CCFSIDThis field is for state users. 
Providers can have multiple CCFSIDs in the same District (Region) and also across multiple Districts (Regions).
Close

↘️ Edit a Provider Record

  1. Select the Provider that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Provider

  1. Select the Provider that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Provider record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: It is not possible to delete a Provider when there are active or expired schedules associated with that Provider. The following information (pages) about a selected Provider are also deleted:

  • Contact
  • Profile
  • Rates
  • Files
  • Notes
  • Modified days
  • Attributes
  • Levies
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Provider page, click here.

37.content:
This information is useful when contacting providers directly. The provider will use the contact information to register their account in KinderConnect.

Add a Contact

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Contacts page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the Provider Contact into the appropriate fields. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Press Save to create a new Provider Contact record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Provider Contacts Fields

FieldDescription
ProviderDisplays the name of the Provider.
Provider IDDisplays the unique identifier number that the system generates for each Provider.
ContactDisplays the name of the Contact at the Provider. 
Use the drop-down arrow to identify the Provider Contact to view or edit.
Provider Contact IDDisplays the unique identifier number that the system generates for each Provider Contact.
Effective DateDisplays the effective date for this Provider Contact. 
Note: This is a required field.
First Name, Last Name, InitialThese fields display the Provider Contact first, last and middle initial. 
Note: This is a required field.
Maiden Name, Other NameDisplays the Provider Contact maiden name or any other name that can be used for identification.
Phone / ExtDisplays the Provider Contact telephone number and extension.
Birth DateDisplays the date of birth of the Provider Contact.
AgeThe system calculates and displays the age of the Provider Contact based on the date of birth previously entered.
EmailDisplays the email address for the Provider Contact.
Alternate PhoneDisplays any alternate telephone numbers for the Provider Contact.
SSNDisplays the SSN of the Provider Contact.
Care Address 1, Care Address 2Displays the address of the Provider Contact.
City, State, Zip Code / ExtDisplay the city, state and zip code of the Provider Contact.
RolePress the drop-down arrow to select the role of this Provider Contact within the selected Provider organization.
RelationshipPress Select >> to choose the personal relationship between the Provider and this Provider Contact, if any. 
If the contact you are adding is the primary Provider, leave this field blank.
StatusUse the drop-down arrow to select the status of the Provider Contact (Active or Inactive). 
Note: This is a required field. (KinderSystems use only)
Other states residedPress Select >> to open a link where you can check all other states where the Provider Contact has previously resided.
Close

↘️ Edit a Contact

  1. Select the Provider Contact that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Contact

  1. Select the Provider Contact that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Contact record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Deleting a Contact will not affect any other portion of the Provider record.

Close

↘️ Copy Contacts

It is possible to import Contacts from one Provider to another (name and all contact details). This is useful when the Contact is employed by more than one Provider, owned by the same organization. You only need to enter the Contacts details under one Provider and copy the information to other Provider(s) as many time as necessary.

  1. Select the Provider Contact that you would like to copy.
  2. Press Copy.
  3. The Provider Search window opens. Enter parameters to locate the Provider you would like to copy the Contact to, then press Search.
  4. Click the check box next to the desired Provider to select the location to copy to. Press OK. The selected Contact information now also appears on the other Provider Contact page.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Contacts page, click here.

38.content:
Use the Provider > Type of Care page to indicate the type of care that the provider offers. It includes information about the Provider’s license status.

Add Type of Care Information

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Type of Care page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the date when the Provider started offering the Type of Care. Enter an End Date if available.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Type of Care offered. The types correspond to those available in the Provider Type field in the Administration > RMR page. The type of care selected affects Payments to that Provider.
  6. Enter the corresponding License/Registration Number.
    • Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  7. Press Save.

Repeat these steps to add all licenses held by this Provider.

 Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit Type of Care Information

  1. Click the radio button next to the Type of Care that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete Type of Care Information

  1. Click the radio button next to the Type of Care that you would like to delete.
  2.  Press Delete to permanently remove the Type of Care record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. 
  4. Press OK to proceed.

Note: If a Type of Care is associated with a Provider Profile, the system prevents deletion. Deleting a Type of Care record will not affect any other portion of the Provider's file. 

Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Type of Care page, click here.

39.content:
The Provider > Rates page is used to enter, maintain and view information on rates paid to Providers. It is possible to enter different rates based on Provider’s different profiles. The system also accommodates future rates based on scheduled rate changes. The user can view rates according to effective dates and types as well as the Regional Market Rates (RMR) for the effective dates selected. The RMR rates can be imported to any Provider that is using them.  

If an agency wants to add a Rate, it is possible to add it by navigating to Administration > Tables > Provider Rate Types.  

We recommend that the agency collects and enters in the system all possible rates for any given Provider, regardless of which rates apply to the schedule in place at the time the agreement is established between the agency and that Provider. 

Note: If the state has enabled Standardized Rate Types in the Administration > Table > Provider Rate page, the available Standardized Rate Types will be listed and the user will be able to make a selection by pressing the drop-down arrow instead of entering an individual rate type for each provider in the Rate Type Description field. 

Activate Rates

Since the system default for Provider > Rates has no amounts associated to it, when the user is ready to add rates to Provider for the first time, it is necessary to edit the default rates.

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Rates page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Rate Type.
  4. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.
  5. You can now modify the Rate Type selected for editing.
  6. Enter the Effective Date for the rates or use the Calendar button to select.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Status indicating whether the rates are Active or Inactive. 
  8. If the Provider offers a discounted rate for siblings enrolled at the same facility, click the Sibling Reduction check box. When checked, additional fields open requiring additional information for the discount.
  9. Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the Preferred Rate Mode of the Provider is based on charging a Fixed Rate or on using pre-set Thresholds to determine whether to pay Full Time or Part Time rates.
  10. You can now edit the Provider rate amounts in the table. Make sure to enter amounts for Normal Hours, based on Part Time or Full Time status and the age of the child.
  11. If desired, click the Show Market Rates/Quality Rates check box. The system automatically selects the current date and displays the rates. To change, type the desired as of date or use the Calendar button to select. Press Refresh to update. Note: The Market Rates can only be edited through the Admin activity. The system then displays the Market Rates/Quality Rates as of the selected date.
  12. The request to Show Market Rates/Quality Rates enables the Fill – Market Rates button on the top of the page, press to populate the Provider rate fields with the Market Rates/Quality Rates currently displayed.

Note: The Fill – Market Rates button only populates the rates in the Normal Hours section. The user needs to populate other sections manually.

  1. Click Select next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  2. Press Save.

If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit Rates

Since the system default for Provider > Rates has no amounts associated to it, when the user is ready to add rates to a Provider for the first time, it is necessary to edit the default rates.  

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.  
  2. Open the Rates page.  
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Rate Type.  
  4. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.  
  5. You can now modify the Rate Type selected for editing.  
  6. Enter the Effective Date for the rates or use the Calendar button to select.  
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Status indicating whether the rates are Active or Inactive. (KinderSystems use only)  
  8. If the Provider offers a discounted rate for siblings enrolled at the same facility, click the Sibling Reduction check box. When checked, additional fields open requiring additional information for the discount.  
  9. Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the Preferred Rate Mode of the Provider is based on charging a Fixed Rate or on using pre-set Thresholds to determine whether to pay Full Time or Part Time rates.  
  10. You can now edit the Provider rate amounts in the table. Make sure to enter amounts for Normal Hours, and based on Part Time or Full Time status and the age of the child.
  11. If desired, click the Show Market Rates/Quality Rates check box. The system automatically selects the current date and displays the rates. To change, type the desired as of date or use the Calendar button to select. Press Refresh to update. Note: The Market Rates can only be edited through the Admin activity. The system then displays the Market Rates/Quality Rates as of the selected date.  
  12. The request to Show Market Rates/Quality Rates enables the Fill – Market Rates button on the top of the page, press to populate the Provider rate fields with the Market Rates/Quality Rates currently displayed. Note: The Fill – Market Rates button only populates the rates in the Normal Hours section. The user needs to populate other sections manually.
  13. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  14. Press Save.
  15. Use the lower scroll bar to review additional columns.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record. 

Close

↘️ Auto Calculation of Payments

The Auto-Calculation feature offers a convenient way to save time and set business rules for payment creation. You may create payments in advance based on the number of days in the application setting using the created auto-calculation stored procedure. Doing so sets the payment status to approved, once selected in the board-level setting.

Approved Payments allows boards to review all payments and manually bulk set status to authorized.

Setting up Auto-Calculation

  1. Enable the Use Approved Status check box on the Administration > District Settings page.
  2. Enter the number of days before the next billing cycle in the Auto Calculate Payments In Advance section under the Administration > Site Settings page.
  3. Board Level Status is now set to Approved.

Note: Once the board level setting is set to Approved, the received payments you recorded should display as Approved in the Payment > Search page. If there is an error in the calculations, you can manually fix it. The payment status must be changed to Received when making corrections. 

If all approved payments are calculated correctly, you may either Void, Reject, or Authorize.

  • You can bulk-select the set status to Authorize if you wish to authorize all the payments.
  • Then bulk set the status to Paid.

Payment Status Definitions

Not Calculated:

A payment has been created but has not been calculated yet.

Received:

A payment has been imported and the data related to this payment is in KinderTrack.

Approved:

A Calculated Payment has been reviewed by the Board and has been accepted.

Authorized:

An Approved Payment has been reviewed by the Board and has been Authorized for Payment.

Void:

The payment has been reviewed by the Board and marked as Void.

Rejected:

The payment has been reviewed by the Board and rejected.

Calculated:

Payment has been calculated and is ready for review (in case a payment is manually calculated).

Paid:

The payment has been paid.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Rates page, click here.

40.content:
Use the Provider > Profile page to document the specifics for the selected provider, such as hours of operations, registration fees, calendars, programs supported, restrictions, type of care, etc.

Add a Profile

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Profile page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the Provider Profile into the appropriate fields. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field.
    • Enter the Effective Date or use the calendar to select.
    • Enter the Name.
    • Press Select >> next to Supported Programs to open the list of the available ones. Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select or click on check-all to select all. You can remove your selection by clicking on clear-all.
    • Press Select >> next to Supported School Calendars to open the list of the available ones. You can press the District drop-down arrow to narrow your search to a specific or search by Calendar Name. Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select or click on check-all to select all. You can remove your selection by clicking on clear-all.
    • Enter the Registration Fee for this Provider. Click on the appropriate checkbox to indicate whether the fee is Annual.If Annual is selected, the fee is applied each year. If not selected, the fee is applied only once.
    • Press Select >> next to Paid Absences to open the list of the available absences. Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select or click on check-all to select all. You can remove your selection by clicking on clear-all.
    • Press the Profile Status drop-down arrow to select whether this Provider is Active or Inactive. (KinderSystems use only)
    • Press the Primary Contact drop-down arrow to select the name of the individual who is the primary contact at this Provider.
    • Press Select >> next to Type of Care to open the list of the available types of care provided. Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select or click on check-all to select all. You can remove your selection by clicking on clear-all.
    • Press the Calendar drop-down arrow to select the type of calendar this Provider uses.
    • Press Select >> next to Rates to open the list of the available rates for this Provider. Click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to select or click on check-all to select all. You can remove your selection by clicking on clear-all.
    • Under Hours of Operation, click on the box(es) corresponding to the days this Provider offers care. You can enter the start and end times of care for this Provider manually in the corresponding fields, or use Start Time Fill and End Time Fill to automatically populate the columns for the selected days after entering the first one.
    • Enter any Restrictions that apply to this Provider. 
    • Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Press Save to create the new Provider Profile record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Provider Profile Fields

FieldDescription
ProviderDisplays the name of the Provider.
Provider IDDisplays the unique identifier number that the system generates for each Provider.
ProfileDisplays the name assigned to the current Profile for this Provider. 
Note: This is a required field when creating a Profile.
Effective DateDisplays date when this Provider Profile becomes effective. 
Note: This is a required field when creating a Profile.
Profile NameDisplays the name of the current Profile for this Provider. 
If creating a new Profile, use this field to type the desired name.
Supported ProgramsDisplays the Programs that this Provider supports. 
Press View >> to see all programs supported.
Supported School CalendarsDisplays the School Calendars that this Provider supports.
Registration FeeDisplays the Provider's registration fee.
Paid AbsencesDisplays the Paid Absences for this Provider. 
Press View >> to see all Absences that are paid.
Profile StatusDisplays the status of the Profile (active or inactive). 
Note: This is a required field. (KinderSystems use only)
Primary ContactDisplays the name of the Primary Contact at the Provider for this Profile. 
Note: Contacts are added under Provider >> Contacts page.
Type of CareDisplays the type of care this Provider offers that applies to this Profile.
CalendarDisplays the type of Calendar this Provider uses that applies to this Profile.
RatesDisplays the type of Rates this Provider offers that applies to this Profile.
Hours of OperationCheck the appropriate boxes to indicate the days this Provider offers services. 
Enter the Start and the End Time for services on the selected days, or enter it on the first day and, if the hours are the same every day, press Start Time Fill to automatically populate the other days. If all of the days but one have the same hours, you can check the boxes for all of the days but that one day, click Start Time Fill button to automatically populate those days, check the box for the other day and enter the times manually. Use the second Start and End Time columns if the hours of operation of this Provider are not continuous.
Notes: If entering the Start Time on a day other than the first day of the week, pressing the Fill button will not populate other days. 
The system only enables the fields for the selected days of operation. 
If a Provider is open overnight, enter 11:59 PM for the end time of one day, and 12:00 AM for the start time of the next.
RestrictionsDisplay any Restrictions that apply to this Provider.
Close

↘️ Edit a Profile

  1. Select the Provider Profile you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Profile

  1. Select the Provider Profile you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Profile record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
    Note: Deleting a Profile record will not affect any other portion of the Provider record.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Profile page, click here.

41.content:
Use the Provider > Notes page to enter specific notes about a provider that can be accessed at a later date for internal use only.

Add a Note

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Notes page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Type your note about the Provider. Click  to spell check your entry.
  5. Use the drop-down arrow to select the Type of the Note you are adding. The System Administrator determines the Provider note types available in the Administration > Tables > Provider Note Types screen. Common note types are:
    • General
    • Payment Note
    • Schedule Note
  6. Select the effective Date by typing it in or use the Calendar button.
  7. Press Save.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

↘️ View Notes

You can choose to view Notes by Note Type which will show all notes of same type for the selected Provider, or by date which will display all notes within the selected date range.

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Notes page.
  3. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select. Note: System default is a 30-day period ending on the current date.
  4. Press Select >> to choose the Note Type(s) you would like to see.
  5. It is possible to search for a specific Note previously created for this provider by using the Keyword. For example, the Keyword "provider" will return any Note entries with the word "provider" in them.
  6. Click on Options to set up the page size and the visible columns parameters for displaying the results.
  7. Press Refresh to generate a list of the notes matching the criteria selected.
  8. Click the corresponding radio button to select a specific Provider Note. The contents of your selection appear on the lower portion of the screen.
  9. It is possible to view and print the notes by pressing Notes Report.
Close

↘️ Edit a Note

  1. Click on the radio button next to the Note you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  3. Make the necessary changes.
  4. Press Save to overwrite the existing entry.
Close

↘️ Delete a Note

  1. Click on the radio button next to the Note you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Note record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Notes Report

It is possible to print the Notes found in Provider Notes by using the Report section.

  1. Click on the Report you would like to print. The system opens the Report parameters window.
  2. Click the drop-down arrow to select the notes you would like to Include in the Report. Selection includes All Notes in Queue to print all the notes that satisfied the search conditions, or Selected Note to print only the selected note.
  3. Click the drop-down arrow to select the desired Output Type from PDF, Comma Delimited, or HTML. 
  4. Press Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Provider Notes page, click here.

42.content:
Use the Provider > Payments page to view payments processed for the selected provider. You can choose the criteria for the payments you would like to view.

View Payments

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payments page.
  3. Select the Start Date and End Date for the Payments you would like to view by typing in the dates or by using the Calendar button.
  4. Click Select >> to choose the Payment Status(es) you would like to filter by. The available choices are:
    • Approved
    • Authorized
    • Calculated
    • Not Calculated
    • Paid
    • Received
    • Rejected
    • Returned
    • Void
  5. Click Select >> to choose the Payment Flag(s) you would like to filter by.
