  6. Once you have selected the criteria, press Refresh to generate the Payment Queue on the lower portion of the screen listing all Payments matching the specified criteria.
  7. Click on Options to set up the Visible Columns and the Page Size parameters to use when displaying the results.
  8. All underscored results can be used as links. Click the ID number to view the payment details under the Payment Summary, click on a Family Name to view Family Summary results matching that last name, or click the Child Name to view that Child page.
  9. To generate Reports on a specific payment, click on the checkbox next to the desired ID number(s). You can click + to select all (click again to deselect).

Reports

It is possible to generate Reports from the Provider > Payments page. Reports are available based on the Operator role. Operator role. Some of the available reports are:

Report NameDescription
Payment DetailsThe report will return payment detail information for payments selected by the operator in the payment grid.
TimesheetProviders use this form to record/track attendance when children are scheduled for service. When selected, you can choose if you want the Provider's Address Location to print (to fit a window envelope) as well as the Type of Output.
Payment SummaryDisplays all Payments that were made during the date range selected in the parameters. When chosen, you can group results by Operator or Provider Name, select the Type of Output, and other parameters.


To print the Report:

  1. Click on the Report that you would like to generate. The report parameters window opens. Note: The parameters will vary depending on the selected Report.
  2. Select the desired parameters.
  3. Press Print.

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Payments page, click here.

43.content:
The Provider > Families page provides a list all of the families which have childcare schedules at the selected Provider. You can filter the list by the status of the schedules.

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Families page.
  3. Click the drop-down arrow to select the Status. You can choose to display a list of Families with all types of schedules by leaving the selection blank, or to display only Families with Authorized or with Non-Authorized schedules. The list will automatically refresh with Families matching the selected Status.
  4. Click on Options to set up the Visible Columns and the Page Sizeparameters to use when displaying the results.
  5. All underscored results can be used as links. Click on a Family Name to view the Family Summary page, click the Child Name to view the Child page. Click on Start Date or Schedule End Date to view the Family Schedule page.

Reports

It is possible to generate the Child Schedule Report from the Provider > Families page. Other Reports might be available based on Operator roles.

  1. Click the radio button to select the child you would like the report for.
  2. Click on the name Report that you would like to generate and select the parameters you would like to use:
    • The Effective Date of the Report is a required field.
    • Press the drop-down arrow to select the Output Type.
  3. Press Print.

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Families page, click here.

44.content:
Use the Provider > Modified Days page to note periods of Provider closure that are exceptions to the Provider Hours of Operation. 

In general, the days a Provider is open is determined by the Hours of Operation entered in the Provider > Profile page. However, a Provider might have exceptions to those days, such as holidays or vacations, which you can record on the Provider > Modified Days page. 

When querying for scheduled hours, the Payment page will set these days to Absent, Present or Not Scheduled, depending on the Absence Type selected when entering the Modified Days. Note: Select the calendar on the Provider > Profile page, then use the Provider > Modified Days page to record any exceptions to the calendar.

Add Modified Days

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Modified Days page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Fiscal Year corresponding to the Modified Days you would like to create. Note: The system will assign the corresponding Fiscal Year based on the dates entered.
  4. Press Options to set up the Visible Columns and Page Size parameters to display your results.
  5. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  6. Type a description of the Provider Modified Days period into the Description field.
  7. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  8. Press the drop-down arrow to select the appropriate Absence Type.
  9. Press Save.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit Modified Days

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the correct Fiscal Year for the Modified Days period you would like to edit.
  2. Click the radio button next to the Modified Days period you would like to edit.
  3. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing and make necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Modified Days Period

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the correct Fiscal Year for the Modified Days period you would like to delete.
  2. Click the radio button next to the Modified Days period you would like to delete.
  3. Press Delete to permanently remove the Modified Days period from this Provider.
  4. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  5. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Modified Days page, click here.

45.content:
Use the Provider > RFI page to keep track of documents needed from the Provider for verification purposes. The RFI page lists the documents that may be required for each particular case and allows tracking the status and changing it accordingly when requested, received, pending, not required, etc.

Edit RFI

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the RFI page. The system displays information on the documents required from the Provider.
  3. Press Select >> next to Status and choose to narrow the criteria for the status you would like to see.
  4. Click on Options to set up the Visible Columns and the Page Size parameters to use when displaying the results.
  5. Select the item you would like to edit by clicking the RFIs check box next to the desired Document. This action enables the Edit button. If the same change affects more than one document, click to select the check box next to each Document.
  6. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.
  7. Enter the information into the fields. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field.
    • Status: Press the drop-down arrow to select the new status for the item(s) (Not Required, Pending, Received, Required or Unknown).
    • Type or use the Calendarbutton to enter the Date Requested, Date Due, Date Received and Date Expires.If a date entered falls on a closed day on the business calendar, the system issues a WPI warning.
  8. Press Save.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

Note: Documents listed on the RFI page are set up by your System Administrator in the Administration activity.

Reports

Depending on your settings, it is possible to print the Request for Information report by using the Report section on the Provider RFI page. Use the Request for Information to notify parent(s) whenever it is necessary to review information or continue the enrollment process.

To test your knowledge on the Provider > RFI page, click here.

46.content:
Use Provider > Transfer page to transfer child schedules from one Provider to another without the hassle of canceling the currently active Schedule and having to create a new one at the new Provider. The Transfer page allows transferring multiple schedules at once, provided they are all for the same type of care. 

In order to transfer schedules, make sure the provider you are transferring from is selected from the Search page.

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Transfer page.
  3. Click on the appropriate radio button to select the Transfer Type.
  4. Select the Transfer Date by typing it or using the Calendar button.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Profile associated with the desired child schedule.
  6. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Program associated with the desired child schedule.
  7. Press Search.
  8. The system generates the list of matching schedules. Click the check box(es) corresponding to the Schedule(s) you would like to transfer.
  9. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider you would like to Transfer to.
  10. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Profile you would like to Transfer to.
  11. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Type of Care you would like to Transfer to.
  12. Once you have all the information entered correctly, press Transfer. The schedules are now transferred to the new provider as of the specified date. The Schedule page now reflects all schedules.
  13. Press Reset to clear the existing search criteria.

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Transfer page, click here.

47.content:
Use the Provider > Levy page to record and track any levies that may affect Provider payment. When a Provider Levy is set up, a flat amount is taken of the total amount for each payment. It is then displayed on the Payment > Summary page.

Press Options to select the number of records to be displayed in the table and the visible columns.

Add a Levy

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Levy page.
  3. Press New.
  4. Enter the Start Date to indicate when the Levy will start being assessed or use the Calendar button to select. Enter the End Date if necessary.
  5. If there is a total amount to be levied, enter it in the Total Amount field.
  6. Enter how much you would like to deduct from each Provider Payment in the Amount Per Payment field.
  7. Press Save.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

Delete a Levy

  1. Click the radio button next to the Levy you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Levy record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. 
  4. Press OK to proceed.

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Levy page, click here.

48.content:
Use the Provider > Documents page to upload documents to the database that may be relevant to the Provider file (e.g. drivers license, certifications, training verifications, etc.) or to review existing documents. Selecting a document enables the Delete and Download buttons.

Preview a Document

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Documents page.
  3. A table listing all Documents corresponding to the selected Provider displays.
  4. Press the Thumbnail Size drop down arrow to select the size of the image displayed in the table. The image under the Thumbnail column header immediately adjust to the selected size.
  5. Click Options to set up the visible columns and how many results to display per page.

↘️ Download a Document

  1. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Provider document you would like to download. The details of the selected document display on the lower portion of the page.
  2. Press Download.
Close

↘️ Add a New Document

  1. The name of the selected file displays in the lower portion of your screen. Click on the file name to open. Note: Depending on your browser, the steps might be different.
  2. Press New to enable the fields.
  3. Enter the File Name you would like to display.
  4. Enter the Description corresponding to the file you are adding.
  5. Click on Choose File.
  6. Select the name of the file you would like to add. Note: The name of the file will be displayed.
  7. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Document

  1. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Provider document you would like to delete.  
  2. Press Delete to remove the selected Provider document.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. 
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Documents page, click here.

49.content:
Use the Provider > Agreements page to enter and track the Agreements between Boards and Child Care Providers. These Agreements are displayed and managed on this page.

Add New Agreement

  1. Click New to enable the fields.
  2. Enter the Agreement Number you would like to display.
  3. Enter the Agreement Start Date or use the Calendar button to select.
  4. Enter the Agreement End Date or use the Calendar button to select.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Intake Closed Reason.
  6. Enter the Intake Closed Start Date or use the Calendar button to select.
  7. Enter the Intake Closed End Date or use the Calendar button to select.
  8. Click on Choose File.
  9. Press Save.

↘️ Preview a Document

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Agreements page.
  3. A table listing all Agreements corresponding to the selected Provider displays.
  4. Check the box to select the Agreement you want to preview.  
Close

↘️ Edit Agreement

  1. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Provider Agreement you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit.
  3. The lower portion of the page enables allowing you to make the necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Agreements page, click here.

54.content:
Use the Payment > Payment Search page to find and access records of all types of payments (approved, authorized, paid, returned, received, rejected, calculated, and not calculated). Enter one or more criteria in the available fields, the more criteria you add the more accurate your search will be. There are three sections in the Payment Search page:

  • Search Criteria
  • Reports
  • Results

Search for a Payment

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria for the available fields. The more criteria entered, the better results.
  4. Press Search.

↘️ List of Payment Search Criteria

FieldHow to Enter InformationWhat the Search Will Find
Family NameManuallyAll payments issued for a family name listed on the Family page that matches or begins with the characters entered.
Family IDManuallyAll payments issued with a family ID that matches the characters entered.
Case NumberManuallyAll payments issued with a case number that matches the characters entered.
SuffixManuallyAll payments issued with a child Suffix that matches the characters entered. The Suffix, along with the Case Number, is the unique child identifier for ACS (New York City) cases.
Child Last NameManuallyAll payments issued with a last name listed on the Child page that matches or begins with the characters entered.
Child CIN ManuallyAll payments with a child CIN number that matches the characters entered.
Payment StatusUse multiselect to select one or more statusesAll payments with the selected status(es) listed on the Payments page.
ProgramUse multiselect to select one or more programsAll payments with selected program(s) on the Schedule page.
Worker / Payment TechUse multiselect to select one or more workerAll payments assigned to the selected Worker(s) listed on the Family page.
Payment FlagUse multiselect to select one or more flagsAll payments matching the selected Flag(s).
Schedule TypeUse multiselect to select one or more methods of attendance submissionAll payments made to a provider with the selected type(s) of schedule listed on the Family page.
Print StatusUse multiselect to select one or more statusesAll payments with the selected print status(es) listed on the Payments page.
From/ ToType the start and end date of the billing period or use the calendar buttonAll payments effective on or after the selected From date and ending on or before the To date.
Provider NameManuallyAll payments made to a provider name listed on the Provider page that matches or begins with the characters entered.
Provider IDManuallyAll payments made to a provider ID number listed on the Provider page that matches the characters entered.
Provider TypeUse multiselect to select one or more provider typesAll payments made to a provider with the selected provider type(s) listed on the Provider page.
Attendance MethodUse multiselect to select one or more attendance methodsAll payments made to providers with the selected attendance method(s) listed on the Provider page.
Vendor NumberManuallyAll payments made to a provider with a vendor number listed on the Provider page that matches or begins with the characters entered.
Attendance CollectionUse multiselect to select one or more methods of attendance submissionAll payments made to providers that submitted attendance using the method(s) selected.
Payment/ Timesheet IDManuallyThe payment made that is assigned to the Payment or Timesheet ID listed on the Payment page.
Payment TypeUse multiselect to select one or more methods of attendance submissionAll payments made to a provider with the selected payment type(s) listed on the Payment page.
Priority PaymentsSelect from the drop- down menuAll payments made that match the priority selection: To show all priority payments or to exclude priority payments.
RestrictedSelect from the drop- down menuAll payments made that match the restricted selection: To show only restricted providers or to exclude restricted providers.
Close

↘️ Working with Search Results

The Search Results grid on the bottom portion of the screen displays the payments found that match the specified criteria. Any entry underlined in the Search Results is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing. 

The user can define the columns to appear in the Search Results grid. Click Options and select the desired columns by checking the boxes next to the available titles.

The search results can also be used to select the files you would like to include in the Reports available from the Payment Search page.

Close

↘️ Selecting Records

The underlined information on the Search Results grid acts as a link to other related pages within KinderTrack.

  • Summary: Click an entry under this heading to open the Summary page under the Payment activity for the selected record.
  • ID: Click an entry under this heading to open the Payment page under the Payment activity for the selected record.
  • Provider: Click an entry under this heading to open the Provider page under the Provider activity for the selected record.
  • Child: Click an entry under this heading to open the Child page under the Family activity for the selected record(s).

Check the corresponding box on each payment record you would like to view or click the + on the title row to select all records (click again to deselect). 

If selecting multiple records, after clicking on the Summary link to view additional details, you can click on the Search Results arrows to move from one record to another among the selected results.

Note: If you are not certain which record is the one you need, select all possibilities and review all the records on the Summary page.

Close

↘️ Payment Search Reports

It is possible to generate various Reports from the Payment > Search page. The records on the report will be specific to the parameters of your search criteria.

  • Payment Details - Generates payment detail information for all selected payments.
  • Payment Summary - Generates a summary of all payments in the queue, including the case number, family name, payment IDs, billing period, unit cost, gross amount, family fees and net amount of each. It also includes a gross total amount, total family fees, and net payment due for all payments in the report.
  • Payment Statement - Generates a summary of all payments issued to the provider, including the provider name, the program account number, vendor number/program number, the status date, payment ID, covered period, and the amount. It also includes a gross total amount and a grand total.
  • Provider Statement - Generates a summary of all payments to the selected provider, including the family name, child name, program account number, status date, payment ID, covered period, basis of payment, program, reason and the amount. It also includes a total per provider and a grand total.
  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment > Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. The more criteria entered, the better the search results will be.
  4. Press Search.
  5. Check the box corresponding to each record that you would like to include in the report or use click + to select all records (click again to deselect).
  6. Click on the Reports that you would like to generate. The report parameters window will open. Note: The parameters will vary depending on the selected Reports.
  7. Press Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Payment Search page, click here.

55.content:
The Payment > Summary page provides information on the last selected Payment. It is possible to update a payment status using this page. Any word underlined in the Summary page is a link to the associated page, allowing quick access to a record for more details or for editing.

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Summary page.
  3. Use the Search Result arrows to locate the payment you would like to work with. Note: The Payment needs to be preselected using the Payment > Search page in order to view them in the Summary. If you only select one payment from the search results, the scroll arrows will be disabled.
  4. Choose the Payment you would like to view by clicking the appropriate link. If you need to add an additional payment to this provider, press Add Additional Payment on the lower right. Refer to Payment Additional Payments for more details.
  5. A new window opens where you can select the Type of update for the New Payment Status. The options listed vary depending on the current status of the Payment. For example, the Update Status button might not be available in some instances, such as when a Payment has a current status of “Paid".
  6. Press OK.

↘️ Update Status

  1. Press Update Status to make changes to the status of the current Payment record.

Note: The update sequence is usually Calculated > Approved > Authorized > Paid. Any payment in any status, except Paid, can be updated to Not Calculated status.

Close

↘️ Payment Forms

You can run the Payment Summary and the Payment Details reports from the Reports section of the Payment > Summary page. 

The Payment Summary report allows you to print a summary of the payments in the queue and includes the case number, family name, Payment IDs, billing period, unit cost, gross amount, family fees, and net amount for each payment, along with a gross total amount, total family fees, and net payment due for all payments in the report. The records on the report are specific to your search criteria. 

The Payment Details report will return payment detail information for payments selected by the operator in the payment grid.

  1. Use the Search Results arrows to locate the payment you would like to work with. Note that payments need to be preselected using the Payment > Search page in order to view them in the Summary. If you only select one payment the from the search results, the arrows will be disabled.
  2. Click on the Report you would like to print to open a new window where you can choose the report parameters.
  3. Select the output parameters.
  4. Press Print. 
Close

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Summary page, click here.

56.content:
It is possible to make Additional Payments to providers to cover certain expenses. Since these payments are in addition to a provider's Payment for regular childcare fees, and correspond to a period of care, it is necessary to refer to the original payment when creating it. After processing, the additional payment will have its own Payment ID.

Create an Additional Payment

To create an additional payment:

  1. Select Payment > Search from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields and press Search to look for the desired childcare Payment record. (Refer to the Payment > Search section for more details.)
  3. Locate the desired payment in the Search Results. Click on Summary to open the details.
  4. Press Add Additional Payment on the Summary page to open the Additional Payment page.
  5. Type the Date of the desired payment or use the Calendar button to select.
  6. The Status field will automatically populate after you save the Additional Payment. It is set after you save it.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Type of the additional payment. The available types indicate the reason for the payment.
  8. Enter the dollar amount for the Additional Payment.
  9. Enter any Note(s) relevant to the payment.
  10. Press Save. The system creates an Additional Payment record with a new Payment ID.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

The Additional Payment just created now needs to be processed. Refer to Payment > Payment Processing for additional details.

↘️ View an Additional Payment

You can review details on an Additional Payment using the Payment > Search page and selecting the desired payment in the results. (Refer to the Payment > Search section for more details on searching for a payment.)

It is also possible to review an Additional Payment from the Payment > Additional Payment page. Note that it is necessary to have the Payment ID available.

Close

↘️ Edit an Additional Payment

It is possible to edit an Additional Payment as long as the status has not been marked as Paid.

  1. Locate the desired Additional Payment by entering the Payment ID number into the field and pressing Refresh, or thru the Payment or Summary pages.
  2. Press Edit and make changes as necessary.
  3. Press Save.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

Close

↘️ Delete an Additional Payment

It is possible to edit an Additional Payment as long as the status has not been marked as Paid:

  1. Locate the desired Additional Payment by entering the Payment ID number into the field and pressing Refresh, or thru the Payment or Summary pages.
  2. Press Edit and make changes as necessary.
  3. Press Save.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Additional Payment page, click here.

57.content:
Use the Payment > Payment page to enter Timesheets and calculate payments on approved schedules. Each Payment can cover one or more schedules for a single child, at a single provider, and a single program or funding source.

It is possible to review the scheduled hours for each day of the week for the Timesheet ID entered. If there are changes to be made to the original hours on the attendance sheet, you can edit the hours before calculating the payments.

The Payment page has two sections: Summary information and a Detail section where you can review additional Details, Authorizations, Notes, Attendance, Payment Summary, Provider Rates, Market/Quality Rates, and Trace. Click on the corresponding check boxes to display the sections for which you would like to review more details.

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Payment page, click here.

58.content:
The upper section displays summary information about the Payment. The information in this section is for viewing purposes only and cannot be edited, except for the ID field which allows the user to change the ID number in order to view a different Payment. 

After changing the ID number, press Refresh to display the information and the details of the different Payment. If multiple payments have been made to that Provider for the selected Child, you can move among payments by clicking on the arrow keys next to the ID number.

The lower section contains various grids used to separate the many details. Once the system calculates the timesheet, it populates each grid with the information under the appropriate sections. Click on the corresponding checkbox(es) to expand or close the sections to view.

  • Show Details
  • Show Authorizations
  • Show Notes
  • Show Attendance
  • Show Payment Summary
  • Show Provider Rates
  • Show Market/Quality Rates
  • Show Trace

Note: When all the grids are selected and expanded, it is necessary to use the scroll bar on the right side of the page to view all the information.

59.content:
Show Details

The Payment > Payment page displays a summary of the Child information. The Details grid displays details on the payments issued for that Child.

Show Authorizations

The Authorizations grid displays all the authorizations for children in the same family.

Show Notes

The Show Notes grid displays all notes entered for that billing period from the Family Notes page, of Payment Note type, and from the Notes field in the Schedule page.

Notes can be added to a Payment as long as it has not yet been Paid. To add a new Payment Note while on this page:

  1. Press Edit.
  2. Type the details of the note.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.

Note: These locally entered Notes will appear in a different format, not inside the grid.

Show Attendance

The Attendance grid displays attendance information for the selected timesheet. It can be modified by pressing Edit as long as it has not yet been Paid. For additional information, refer to the Edit Payment page.

Show Payment Summary

Once the Payment is calculated, if selected to show, the Payment Summary grid breaks the total amount payable to the provider into individual line items for clarification.

Show Provider Rates

If selected to show, the Provider Rates grid displays the current child care rates for the selected Provider. If more than one type of rates, use the drop-down arrow to select the desired type.

Show Market/Quality Rates

If selected to show, the Market/Quality Rates grid displays the District Market Rates for child care and the TRS rating rates right below.

Show Trace

After the payment is calculated, if selected to show, the Trace grid displays an assessment of the way the payment was calculated. For additional information, refer to the Payment Trace page.

60.content:
The Payment > Payment Reconciliation page is used to view payments processed in KinderTrack that have been reconciled with payments made by the Client's accounting system. 

It is basically a way to view a dollar amount and a check number associated with a batch of KinderTrack authorized payments. This is a valuable feature for tracking purposes. 

The Payment Reconciliation is an optional custom feature, and only operational when purchased.

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Payment Reconciliation page, click here.

61.content:
Legacy Payments are payments generated from other systems made prior to deployment of the KinderTrack system. The data is normally imported to KinderTrack to facilitate Legacy Payment adjustments when necessary, and reducing the amount of work required to research specific legacy payment issues in another system. 

Once the data of a Legacy Payment is imported into KinderTrack, the details are easily accessed via the Legacy Payments page.

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Legacy Payments page.
  3. Enter the desired search criteria in the available fields.
  4. Press Search to generate a list of all payments made meeting the desired search parameters.

Create an Additional Payment

It is possible to make an Additional Payment to an existing Legacy Payment.

  1. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Legacy Payment you would like to make an additional payment to.
  2. Press Create Additional Payment.
  3. Enter the required information for the new Additional Payment.
  4. Press Save.

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Legacy Payments page, click here.

62.content:
Use the Payment > Payment Processing page to update the status of Provider payments. In order to be issued, each payment goes through several steps using the Payment Processing page. The statuses are:

  • Not Calculated
  • Received
  • Returned
  • Rejected
  • Calculated
  • Approved
  • Authorized
  • Paid

Note: During processing, statuses are only set to Approved, Authorized, and Paid. Received and Returned refer to payment statuses linked to KinderConnect. Rejected is a status that can be updated only using the Payment > Summary page.

↘️ Search for Payments to Process

In order to process payments, you must first select which Payment ID(s) will be moved to a different phase of the payment process. The Payment ID(s) may be moved back a status, if needed to make corrections, using the Summary page. The Payment Processing page only allows moving up to finalize processing until Paid.

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment Processing page.
  3. Click on the List all payments that can be moved to: drop-down arrow to select the payment status to which you would like to move the selected Payment(s). Making a selection enables the Update Status button.
  4. If a Batch Number was previously assigned to the Payment(s), enter the number in the space provided and press Search to display it in the results. You can assign a Batch Number to the Payment(s) at any step of the process by pressing Assign Batch Number.
  5. Enter the From and To date range by typing the dates or use the Calendar button to select.
  6. Click Select >> next to Worker/Payment Tech and enter the search parameters to locate the worker(s) or payment technician(s). Press Search and, after selecting from the results, press OK to proceed.
  7. Click Select >> next to Program and check the box(es) corresponding to the appropriate Program(s). Press OK to proceed.
  8. Click Select >> next to Provider Name and enter the search parameters to locate the Providers(s) to be paid. Press Search and, after selecting from the results, press OK to proceed.
  9. Enter the Vendor Number.
  10. Click Select >> next to Provider Type and check the box(es) corresponding to the appropriate types of payment(s). Press OK to proceed.
  11. Click Select >> next to Provider Category and check the box(es) corresponding to the appropriate types of payment(s). Press OK to proceed.
  12. Click Select >> next to Payment Type and check the box(es) corresponding to the appropriate types of payment(s). Press OK to proceed.
  13. Click Select >> next to Payment Flag and check the box(es) corresponding to the appropriate types of flags(s). Press OK to proceed.
  14. Once you have entered all desired parameters for the Payment(s) that you would like to move, press Search. The system generates a list of Payment(s) that meet the selected criteria and that are ready to be moved to the selected status.
  15. Click the radio button next to the desired Provider(s) name(s) to view details about Payment(s) pending to that specific Provider. The system enables the Provider Payments section below with details.
Close

↘️ Processing Payments

Note that the system will Update Status and move all Payment(s) selected. If you only want to move Payment(s) for one specific Provider, or for a specific date range, program, etc., you must first narrow the search criteria in order to only have the desired Payment in the results grid. Select the payments to be included by clicking on the check box corresponding to each desired Payment or press + to select all (press again to deselect).

  1. Press Options above the results grid, next to Providers and select the number of records you would like to be displayed in the results. Click Select >> to define the visible columns.
  2. It is possible to group certain payments together for later processing by clicking on Assign Batch Number and entering the number you would like to assign to the payment group.
  3. Press OK after entering the Batch Number. You can then recall these payments at a later time by searching for the batch number on the Payment Processing initial page.
  4. If you choose the payments to be processed by batch number or by individual payment, once you have completed selecting the Payment(s) to be processed, press Update Status. The system will display a confirmation message indicating the New Payment Status. 
  5. Press OK to proceed.

Note: You are required to enter the date of processing when updating a Payment status to Paid.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Payment Processing page, click here.

63.content:
Use the Payment > Payment Matrix page to view all payment information, aggregated from the state, and down-selectable to county, providers, families and individual children. Search results are always displayed in a grid and can be exported to a CSV file.

Search Totals

The Search Totals option provides you with the total number of payment transactions that meet the search criteria.

Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment Matrix page.
  3. Click the radio button to select whether you would like the results sorted by Date Paid or by Payment Period. If selecting the Date Paid, the results will include all payments made within the selected date range. If Payment Period is selected, the results will include all payments made for services rendered within the selected date range.
  4. Enter the From and To date range by typing the dates or use the Calendar button to select.
  5. Click Select >> next to Payment Type and click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose the search parameters if based on types of payments. Click on check-all or clear- all to select or deselect all criteria. After selecting from the results. 
  6. Press OK to proceed.
  7. Click Select >> next to Payment Status and on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose the statuses that you would like included in the results.
  8. Click Select >> next to Program and on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose the programs that you would like included in the results.
  9. Click Select >> next to Payment Technician and on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose the payment technicians that you would like included in the results.
  10. Click Select >> next to Provider Type and select the names of the desired provider(s).
  11. Click Select >> next to Provider and select the names of the desired provider(s).
  12. Click Select >> next to Provider Worker and select the names of the desired provider worker(s).
  13. You can select whether you would like to search by: Child, or Family Worker:
    • If searching by Family, click Select >> and enter the desired search criteria. Press Search to generate the results including all families with authorizations within the selected date range.
    • Click on the radio button corresponding to the desired Family to select. The selected family will populate the Family field in the Payment Matrix page.
    • If searching by Child, click Select >> and enter the desired search criteria. Press Search to generate. The results include all children with authorizations within the selected date range.

Note: If there is no payment status selector available. The system only searches for completed payments with a "Paid" status which are considered payments with a settlement date.

It is possible to create Search Profiles based on the search criteria entered for future Search Totals. The Search Profiles are unique to the currently logged user. This is very convenient when you plan to duplicate the type of search regularly.

  1. The Saved Searches field indicates the number of Search Profiles available. Click on the drop-down arrow to select the one you would like to use.
  2. To create new Search Profiles, after you complete entering all the desired search parameters, assign a Profile Name and press Save.
  3. It is possible to modify the search parameters of existing Search Profiles by pressing the drop-down arrow and selecting its name, making the necessary changes, assigning a new Profile Name, then pressing Save.
  4. It is also possible to delete Search Profiles using the drop-down arrow to select its name, then pressing Delete. 
  5. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Search Details

The Search Details option provides additional details to the Search Totals results of payment transaction. Usually containing many rows of data, viewable in two separate sets: primary detail results and full detail results, that include more columns of the report. 

Follow the steps above, under Search Totals, to define the criteria you would like to search by. Due to the size of these results, the user can customize the number of columns to appear and the number of records to display at any given time.

  1. Once you have entered all desired search parameters, press Search Details. The results grid will list details on all payments issued that meet the desired criteria.
  2. Press Options to select the number of records you would like to be displayed in the results grid per page. To select the visible columns, press Select >> next to Visible Columns and click on the appropriate checkbox(es) to choose.
  3. Click << Less to only view the primary detail results columns. Click More >> to view all full detail results columns.
  4. To move among the pages, click on the page number.
  5. To scroll and view other columns, click on the scroll bar arrow.
  6. Click on the radio button corresponding to the Payment(s) you would like to view. The details of the selected Payment display below the Search Results.
  7. Click Press on the checkbox corresponding to the desired Payment(s) to select. Press on + on top of the first column to select all records (press again to deselect). Once you complete your selection, press Export to export to the CSV file.

Note: Some of the Search Results, such as Provider Name, are hyperlinks which can be used by hovering over and clicking to quickly move to that page.

To test your knowledge on the Payment > Payment Matrix page, click here.

64.content:
Use the Reports > Advanced page to create and save advanced reports with predefined parameters. Name the report, choose which parameters will be used in the report, and define the type of output for the report.

Create a New Report

  1. Select the Reports activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Advanced page.
  3. Press New to enable the field for naming the report.
  4. Type the Report Name you would like to use for your report.
  5. Press Parameters to open the window where you select the parameters you want to use for the Input and the Output for the report. Note: The parameters available to choose from are all of the fields in the KinderTrack system.
  6. Click the corresponding check box(es) to select the Input and Output parameters you would like to use.
    The Free Form feature, selected by clicking the radio button in upper section, is only available to the System Administrator. To create a Report using Free Form, type or paste the query code in the text box, then press Check Syntax to verify the query is typed correctly.
  7. Once you have selected your Parameters or entered the query code, press Save. A list of your selections will display in the Advanced Reports page. Note: If upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.
  8. Review the parameters to verify you selected the correct Input and Output options to obtain the desired results. If incorrect, press Parameters and reselect accordingly. Press Clear Inputs or Clear Outputs to remove all prior selections before entering new ones.
  9. Verify you have the correct parameters and the correct Report Name, then press Save.
  10. You can now run the report. Enter the desired criteria:
    • Results: This is a required field. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Result that you would like to generate.
    • Select the type of Output you would like to generate:
      • HTML: Results display on the lower portion of the screen.
      • Comma Delimited: Opens in a spreadsheet program, such as Microsoft Excel.
    • The Input Parameters section displays the parameters specific to your report, as selected when creating it. Enter the necessary criteria in these fields to narrow the search results.
  11. When you are satisfied with the search criteria parameters entered, press Run. The system generates the Report in the type of Output format previously selected and displays it under the Results section.

↘️ Run a Report You Created

  1. You can run Advanced Report(s) that you created at any time.
  2. Select the Reports activity from the Navigation Bar.
  3. Open the Advanced page.
  4. Use the drop-down arrow next to Report Name to select the Report you would like to generate.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select the type of Results to appear in the Report. To return all records, select Record Set.
  6. Select the type of Output you would like to generate.
  7. Enter the criteria for the fields listed.
  8. Press Run.
Close

↘️ Edit a Report

  1. You can always make change to Reports you previously created to accommodate other needs:
  2. Select the Reports activity from the Navigation Bar.
  3. Open the Advanced page.
  4. Use the drop-down arrow next to Report Name to select the Report you would like to edit.
  5. Press Edit.
  6. Press Parameters to open the Parameters window 
  7. Edit the Parameters. Press Clear Inputs or Clear Outputs to remove all prior selections before entering new ones.
Close

↘️ Delete a Report

  1. Select the Reports activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Advanced page.
  3. Use the drop-down arrow next to Report Name to select the Report you would like to delete.
  4. Press Delete to permanently remove the report from the system.
  5. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Reports > Advanced Reports page, click here.

65.content:
Use the Intake > Search page to search for Application Data in the KinderWait database. The tool can also transfer one or more batches of applications from KinderWait to KinderTrack. This feature allows users to search for eligible children by application status, program, zip code or age group or to use search criteria based on parents, children, or important application information related to the children displayed.

There are two types of applications: Initial Application and Full Application. The initial application will show as "Waiting" under the status column. The full application will show as "Ready to import" under the status column.

How to search for an application

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.
  4. When an application expires, it will not show in the search results. Check the Include Inactive checkbox if you want the expired applications to show in the search results.
  5. Press Search to display the results. You may select to order by Rank or by Last Message received. Note: Make sure you are in the correct Region when searching for families
  6. Click on Detail to review all the details of the application.

↘️ Update Status

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar. 
  2. Open the Search page. 
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family. 
  4. Press Search to display the results. 
  5. Select the check box of the Child, Parent, or Family you want to update the status for. 
  6. Click on the Update Status button. 
  7. When clicking the Update Status button, the multi-selector will allow selection of statuses. Note: Only statuses that can be manually set are available. These include Not Eligible, Case Pending Provider, and Additional Information Required.
  8. Showing the statuses have been updated screen. Select on the Status you want to change. Press Change Status. 
Close

↘️ Request a Full Application

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Select the check box of the Child, Parent, or Family you want to request the Full application for. Note: the status must show as Waitlist in order to request a full application.
  6. Click on the Request Full App button. The family will receive an email letting them know they need to submit their full application.
  7. Once they submit the full application their information will be ready to be imported into KinderTrack.
Close

↘️ Intake Status Descriptions

Status NameDescription
Not EligibleThis status is manually set. hen an application has been in the Not Eligible status for s certain number of days, the application is removed from the list. The applicant must restart the process from the beginning by re-submitting their waitlist application.
Case Pending ProviderThis status is manually set when a full application has been received and is ready for import but there is not space available at the Provider. 
Application SubmittedThis status is systematically set when a full application has been submitted. 
Case CreatedThis status is systematically set upon import. 
WaitlistThis status is systematically set. When an application has been in the Waitlist status for a certain number of days, the application is removed from the list. The applicant must restart the process from the beginning by re-submitting their waitlist application.
Pending Full ApplicationThis status is systematically set when the email request via the Request Full Application button has been sent. When an application has been in the Pending Full Application status for a certain number of days, the application is removed from the list. The applicant must restart the process from the beginning by re-submitting their waitlist application
Close

↘️ Import a Family Information

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Select the check box of the Child, Parent, or Family you want to request the Full application for. Note: the status must show as "Ready for Import" in order to import a Family's information. The status updates once the family submits their application.

  6.  Click on the Import button.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Intake > Search page, click here.

66.content:
Use the Intake > Referrals page to search on the KinderWait database. You will be able to assign a case worker to a Referral once it has been imported into KinderTrack so that the case worker can process the Referral.

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Referral page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Select the check box of the Referral you want to import to and select Import.
  6. An Operator Search page automatically displays.
  7. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. Press Search. Note: The person selected will be the case worker assigned to the Referral once it has been imported into KinderTrack. The caseworker will then be able to process the Referral.
  8. Select the Operator radio button and press Import.
  9. Select the Operator radio button and press Import.
  10. A message displays saying the Import request has been submitted.

Note: Once the Referral has been imported, you will be able to see it under the Alerts section of the Family > Summary page.

To test your knowledge on the Intake > Referrals page, click here.

67.content:
The Intake > Application page allows Case Workers to examine applications in KinderTrack, as well as the supporting documentation (images, PDFs, etc) prior to import. This will allow informed decisions on whether to reject or accept them.

Use the Intake > Search page to search for Application Data in the KinderWait database.

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Click the Detail link of the Child, Parent, or Family Application you want to view.
  6. KinderTrack automatically redirects you to the Application page. The application information and documents are displayed. The information is divided in different sections: Household, Family, Parents, Children, Forms, and Messages.
  7. Click on the Document links to review the documents uploaded.
  8. Click on View PDF to download the application details in PDF form.

Print PDF 

You may print an application to be presented in PDF format. 

  1. Press View PDF to generate a PDF version of the application. 
  2. KinderTrack displays the Application Details screen. You may print if needed. Note: this will appear differently depending on your browser. 

Messages 

You may receive communications from the Case Worker in the BridgeCare Application Messages screen. These messages will be displayed on the Intake > Application screen. Note: this could include messages sent by the Provider, Case Manager, or Applicant and is dependent on what is captured in BridgeCare. 

The Messages will be displayed newest to oldest and will include the Date, Sender, and Message. 

Read a Message

  1. To review the full message, select the radio button of the desired message. 
  2. The selected message will be highlighted in yellow and displayed in the Message Body section.

Send a Message

Intake users or Case Managers will be able to send communications to the Applicants application intake portal from KinderTrack. 

  1. Press New Message to send a message to the application family. 
  2. Type message in the Message Body.
  3. If you wish to clear the subject, press Cancel. This will clear the message field and the screen will return to View state. 
  4. After finalizing the message, press Send. 
  5. The system will display a message stating that your message sent successfully. 

To test your knowledge on the Intake > Application page, click here.

68.content:
Use the Operator > Search page to locate and access records of authorized operators for the KinderTrack system. 

The Operator > Search page contains a variety of fields used to enter one or more criteria to perform the search. The more criteria you select, the more accurate your search results will be.

Search for Operators

  1. Select the Operator activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Search page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields.
  4. Click Options to define the columns you would like to appear in the Search Results grid. Click on the desired checkboxes, or use check-all or clear-all to select or deselect all options at once.
  5. Press Search to display the results. 

↘️ Operator Search Criteria

FieldHow to enter informationWhat the search will find
Last NameManuallyAll operators with the Last Name listed on the Details page that begins with the characters entered.
Middle NameManuallyAll operators with the Middle Name listed on the Details page that begins with the characters entered.
First NameManuallyAll operators with the First Name listed on the Details page that begins with the characters entered.
User NameManuallyAll operators with the User Name listed on the Details page that begins with the characters entered.
Worker NumberManuallyAll operators with that Worker # listed on the Details page.
Active StatusUse the drop-down arrow to select the Active StatusAll operators with the selected Active Status listed on the Details page.
Operator IDManuallyThe operator with that Operator ID listed on the Details page.
Operator SupervisorUse multiselect to choose one or more Operator SupervisorsAll operators with the selected Operator Supervisor(s) listed on the Details page.
Operator RolesUse the multiselect to choose one or more Operator RolesAll operators with the selected Operator Role(s) listed on the Details page.
Phone NumberManuallyAll operators with a Phone Number listed on the Details page that match or begin with the characters entered. For example, enter 555 to find all Operators in area code 555.
Email AddressManuallyAll operators with that Email Address listed on the Details page.
Office LocationUse multiselect to choose one or more Office Locations.All operators in the selected Office Location(s) listed on the Details page.
Close

↘️ Working with Search Results

All search activities generate a Results grid on the lower portion of the screen listing all records matching the specified criteria. The results can be used as links to the other pages under the Operator activity, such as Details.

You can view information for one operator, multiple operators, or all operators:

  • For one operator, click the Operator ID or Operator name you would like to view to open that Operator Details page.
  • For multiple operators, click the check box next to each Operator ID or Operator name you would like to view or click the (+) plus sign on the upper left of the grid to select all (click again to deselect). 
  • Click on one of the Operator names to open that Operator page which will now include arrow keys in the Search Results section that can be used to navigate between the pages of the selected operators.

Note: If you are not certain which record is the one you need, select all possibilities and review when on the Operator Details page.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Operator > Search page, click here.

69.content:
Use the Operator > Details page to create and maintain the Operator information, including login details. It is in this page that you assign username, passwords, roles, supervisor, backup workers, etc. You can also flag the user to receive Night Run Status alerts, force password change, and lock a user from accessing KinderTrack.

Add an Operator

  1. Select the Operator activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Details page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  4. Enter the information about the operator into the fields. You can navigate from field to field using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Since most of the fields are self explanatory, we are only defining a few here.
    • Active Status - Press the drop-down arrow to select whether this is an Active or Inactive Operator.
    • Locked - Check this box if you would like to block access to this Operator. The system automatically locks access, it also automatically checks this box after an Operator exceeds the number incorrect login attempts as set by the System Administrator.
    • NightRun Status Alert - Check this box if this Operator needs to receive an alert if Night Run fails to run.
    • Force Password Change - Check this box if you would like this Operator to be forced to change passwords during the next login.
    Note: Office Locations need to be selected before the Operator Roles can be selected.
  5. Press Save to create a new Operator record.

Note: If upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit an Operator

  1. Select the Operator that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Operator

The system does not allow deletion of an Operator who has history. Users with the right permission can inactivate users. 

  • Family Case Worker 
  • Provider Worker 
  • Operator Surrogate 
  • Operator Supervisor 
  • or that has any effective History

If it is necessary to remove an Operator with any of the above listed roles, you first need to change the Active Status to Inactive. 

To delete an Operator: 

  1. Select the Operator that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Deleting an Operator also deletes the corresponding roles, settings, password history, and notes.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Operator > Details page, click here.

70.content:
Use the Operator > Notes page to create, edit or review notes about an Operator. These notes are for internal use only. It is necessary to select the Operator using Operator > Search page before creating, viewing or editing Notes.

Add a Note

  1. Select the Operator activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Notes page.
  3. Press New to open the lower portion of the page for editing.Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  4. Type your note about the Operator. Click  to spell check your entry.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Type of note you are creating from the Note Type list.
  6. Select the Date of the note by typing it or using the Calendar button.
  7. Press Save.

↘️ View Operator Notes

The available Notes are based on Operator, type and date range parameters. The system generates a list of all Notes matching the selected type and within the specified date range, including the name of the Worker who created the note, and its contents.

  1. Select the Operator activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Notes page.
  3. Enter the Start Date and the End Date range or use the Calendar button to select.
  4. Click Select >> to choose the Note Type.
  5. You may also choose to search for a specific note by typing a Keyword. For example, if using Keyword "paperwork," the system will return all Notes that contain the word "paperwork."
  6. Click Options to define the columns you would like to appear in the Search Results grid. Click on the desired checkboxes, or use check-all or clear-all to select or deselect all options at once.
  7. Press Refresh to generate the list of Notes that match the search criteria. You can modify search criteria and Refresh as many times as necessary.
  8. Click the radio button next to the Note to expand the details for further review.
Close

↘️ Edit Operator Note

  1. Click the radio button to select the Note you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit.
  3. The system enables the lower section of the screen with the existing Note details. Make the necessary changes.
  4. Press Save to overwrite the existing Note.
Close

↘️ Delete Operator Note

  1. Click the radio button to select the Note you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Note from the system.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Operator Note Reports

It is possible to print the notes found for an Operator using the Reports section.

  1. Click the radio button corresponding to the Note you would like to print to select.
  2. Click Operator Notes.
  3. Press the Include: drop-down arrow to select whether you would like to print only the
  4. Selected Note or All Notes in queue (to print all notes in the Notes List).
  5. Press the Output Type: drop-down arrow to select the format you would like for the Output: PDF, Comma Delimited or Html.
  6. Press Print.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Operator > Notes page, click here.

71.content:
Use the Operator > Roles page to define the access levels, flags, permissions and alert types granted to a specific type of Operator. 

KinderTrack is deployed with certain Operator definitions already established. For example, when a Family Case Worker is set on an Operator role, the Family Case Worker has view, edit and delete permissions for the Family activity but is only allowed to view files under the Provider activity. You can change the initial permissions to suit the needs of the users. You may also add additional Operator roles as needed.

Add an Operator Role

  1. Select the Operator activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Roles page.
  3. Click New to enable the fields.
    1. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  4. Enter the name for the new Operator Role into the Role Description field.
  5. If you would like to make this Operator Role available to others outside your region, click on the Systemwide checkbox to select.
  6. Click on the boxes corresponding to the Operator Flags, Alert Types, and Permissions you would like to give access to the new type of Operator. Use the scroll bar to review all options. To learn more about Alerts specific to each Operator, go to the Administration > Alerts page.
  7. Press Save.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit an Operator Role

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Operator Role that you would like to modify .
  2. Press Edit.
  3. If necessary, type a new Role Description.
  4. Click on the boxes corresponding to the Operator Flags, Alert Types, and Permissions you would like to add or remove access to this type of Operator. Use the scroll bar to review all options.
  5. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  6. Press Save.

Note: Some Alert Types are hard coded by KinderSystems developers and may not be edited. These include Intake, Interface Change, NightRun Failed, Operator-to-Operator, Parent, and Referral.

Close

↘️ Delete an Operator Role

The system does not allow deletion of an Operator Role that is assigned to an Active Operator. To delete an Operator Role:

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Operator Role that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the role from the system.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Operator > Roles page, click here.

72.content:
Use the Program > Program page to enter and maintain information about the programs (funding sources) that your agency uses, including program type, age/grade limits and contact information for the Program Director. Programs can be State-wide or for local boards.

Programs can have rules set so when a child’s authorization is associated with them they will produce a WPI(Warn Prevent Ignore) message.

For example, the program can set age requirements.

Add a Program

  1. Select the Program activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Program page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the information about the Program into the appropriate fields. You can navigate from one field to another using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Press Save to create a new Program record.

Note: If, upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Program Field Descriptions

FieldDescription
Program NameDisplays the name of the Program or funding source.
DescriptionDisplays a description of the Program or funding source.
Program TypePress the drop-down arrow to select the type of Program.
Program FlagsPress Select >> to identify the type of Program Flag(s).
Age CheckPress the drop-down arrow to identify whether the Program eligibility is based on the child Age or the Grade level. The system enables different fields depending on the selection.
Child Age Min Yrs./Mon.If Age Min is selected, this field displays the minimum age required for the child to be eligible to participate in this Program.
Child Age Max Yrs./Mon.If Age Max is selected, this field displays the maximum age required for the child to be eligible to participate in this Program.
Special Needs Age MaxDisplays the maximum age required for a special needs child to be eligible to participate in this Program.
Program DirectorDisplays the name of the Program Director.
Phone NumberDisplays the telephone number of the Program Director.
Fax NumberDisplays the fax number of the Program Director.
EmailDisplays the email address of the Program Director.
Age Check DateDisplays the date when the child has to be of certain age in order to be eligible to participate in the Program.
Claiming CodeDisplays the claiming code assigned to this Program. Note this field is for ACS use only.
Claiming Not ReimbursableCheck this box if claiming is not reimbursable to this Program. Note this field is for ACS use only.
Wrap Around ThresholdDisplays what is used to calculate a family share if the family is eligible and using this Program.
Claiming CategoryPress the drop-down arrow to select the Claiming Category. Note this field is for ACS use only.
StatusPress the drop-down arrow to select if the Program is Active or Inactive.
Alpha CodeDisplays the alpha code assigned to this Program.
Include in 801Check this box if you would like this information to be included on the CDD 801B form.
Capped at SMICheck this box if you would like to cap eligibility at the State Medium Income level.
Eligibility TypesPress Select >> to identify the type Eligibility Types.
StatewideCheck this box if this program is Statewide.
NotesDisplays any notes relevant to this Program.
Close

↘️ Edit a Program Record

  1. Select the Program that you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  3. Press Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Program Record

  1. Select the Program that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Program record.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion.
  4. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Program > Program page, click here.

73.content:
Use the Program > Allocation page to allocate available Program funds to a fiscal year or specific time period. The Allocation page allows entry by both the State Wide Flagged Operator Role as well as by a Region Separated Role.

You can search for a Program by Board, Program Type and Program Name.  You may search for State Wide Boards if you desire to. Only already created Programs will be available to add/enter Allocations.

Add an Allocation

  1. Select the Program activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Allocation page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter all the required fields. You can navigate from one field to another by using the tab key or by clicking on each field. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Click Save to create a new Allocation record using the information just entered.

↘️ Edit an Allocation

  1. Select the Allocation you would like to edit.
  2. Press Edit and make changes as necessary.
  3. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Allocation

  1. Select the Allocation that you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently delete that schedule.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed. The system also alerts the operator that an attempt is being made to delete a schedule.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Program > Allocation page, click here.

74.content:
The Program > Payment Transfer page is used to move one or many payments from one program to another. This will allow a case to be allocated to another program when a program has reached its threshold.

Payments set in KinderTrack will remove the amount from the allocated amount. Payment transfers allow the moving of payments from one Program to another to allow for additional funds for that Program.

Users can select the current Funding Stream by clicking on the Program selection, and the new Funding Stream by clicking on the To Program selection.

Transfer Funds

  1. Select the Program activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment Transfer page.
  3. Select where the Funding Stream will be transferred to by selecting a program in the To Program. Search for the Program that has the current Funding Stream. 
  4. Enter all the required fields. The search results will display below.
  5. Click on the check box of the Program of the current Funding Stream. 
  6. You can select individually or in bulk. Press Transfer. The system automatically shows you a screen to confirm your transfer. Press OK.

To test your knowledge on the Program > Payment Transfer page, click here.

75.content:
The Administration > Tables page contains a series of tables that affect KinderTrack use and performance. These Tables contain numerous entries which the user can edit or delete as needed. New entries can also be added to an existing table to accommodate the agency's needs and preferences.

Add a Table Entry

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Tables page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Table you would like to add an Entry. Note: Once you make your selection, the system enables the New button.
  4. Press New to activate the fields that describe the new Entry.
    The enabled fields on the lower section of the screen vary depending on the Table selected, except for the Description field which is standard on all Entry.
    1. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Enter the details of the new Entries in the available fields.
  6. Press Save.

↘️ Edit a Table Entry

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Tables page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Table and Entry you would like to modify. The Table type and Entry selection enables the New, Edit and Delete buttons.
  4. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.The enabled fields on the lower section of the screen vary depending on the Table selected, except for the Description field which is standard on all Entries. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Make the necessary changes.
  6. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Table Entry

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Table you would like to delete an Entry from.
  2. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Entry you would like to delete. The system displays the specifics for that Entry in the lower section of the screen.
  3. Press Delete to permanently remove the selected entry from the table.
  4. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Some table Entries cannot be deleted if they are associated with other data.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Administration Tables page, click here.

76.content:
Use the Administration > Calendar page to create calendars to be used throughout the various activities of KinderTrack. There are three types of calendars: School, Provider, and Agency.

Select the appropriate School Calendar when creating schedules that will generate timesheets for school age children. Defining which School Calendar the child's schedule uses tells KinderTrack to apply the school or non-school day schedule to a specific day on the timesheet, depending on when school is in session. It is important to create School Calendars for each region in order to calculate the schedules and attendance timesheets correctly.

Provider Calendars allow the system to recognize when a Provider is open or closed for childcare services.

Maintaining a current Agency Calendar is beneficial in diverse situations, such as not allowing due dates to fall on days when the agency is closed.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Calendar page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Calendar. Note that the Edit and Delete buttons do not activate until you make a selection .
  4. The details of the selected Calendar display: Calendar Type, Calendar Name, Default Status and whether it includes weekends or not.
  5. Use the arrows to view different months.

Add a Calendar

  1. Press New to open the fields for editing.
  2. Press the Calendar Type drop-down arrow to select the Calendar Type: Provider, School or Agency.
  3. If adding a School Calendar, press the drop-down arrow to select a School District. Note: This field is only enabled if selecting the School Calendar Type.
  4. Enter a Calendar Name.
  5. Press the drop-down arrow to select a Default Status: Open or Closed.
  6. Click the Include Weekends checkbox when appropriate.
  7. By default, the system displays the current month with all weekdays set to Open.
  8. To edit the calendar, click the radio button next to Closed or Open to select a Day Status.
  9. Once selected, click on the days that you would like to change to the new status. For example, since the calendar defaults on all weekdays set to Open, if you select Closed, you can then click on the calendar days that you would like to change the status from Open to Closed. If all of the days in the Calendar are going to have the same status, click the Fill Month button to populate.
    • Tip: If only a couple of days are different, click the Fill Month button and then change the status for the days that are different.
  10. When you are ready to add the next month, click +> to the right of the listed month on top of the Calendar, or click <+ to the left of the listed month to add a prior month. You must add every month for the new Calendar. The system will prompt you to confirm that you want to add a new Start or End month. Press OK.
  11. Press Save to create the new Calendar.

↘️ Edit a Calendar

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Calendar page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Calendar you would like to edit. The calendar specifics display in the lower portion of the screen.
  4. Press Edit to activate the fields for editing.
  5. Make the necessary changes.
  6. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  7. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Calendar

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Calendar you would like to Delete. The calendar specifics display in the lower portion of the screen.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the calendar from the system.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Copy a Calendar

The Copy feature of the Calendar allows users to duplicate similar or very close calendars to avoid having to re-enter all of the information.
