For example, if there are multiple schools with the same calendar days or if there is a Provider that follows a particular school calendar for days off, you may want to just copy the existing school calendar to the Provider calendar, then make minor adjustments if necessary.

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Calendar you would like to Copy. The calendar specifics display in the lower portion of the screen.
  2. Press Copy to open the fields for editing.
  3.  Press the drop-down arrow to select the Calendar Type you are copying to.
  4. If adding a School Calendar, press the drop-down arrow to select a School District. (This field is only enabled if selecting School Calendar Type.)
  5. Enter a Calendar Name.
  6. Press the drop-down arrow to select a Default Status: Open or Closed.
  7. Click to Include Weekends, if necessary.
  8. Make any adjustments to the Calendar to reflect the new specifics.
  9. Press Save to create the new Calendar.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Calendar page, click here.

77.content:
Use the Administration > Reassign Case Worker page to reassign a Family, Provider or Payment file from one case worker to another. You may transfer single cases or multiple cases at one time.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Reassign Case Worker page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Transfer Type: Family - Worker, Provider - Worker or Provider - Payment Technician. Your selection will determine the active fields under the Transfer Type field.
  4. Press Select >> to choose a specific Family - Worker if reassigning a Family - Worker; to choose a Provider Worker if reassigning a Provider - Worker; or to choose a Payment Technician if reassigning a Provider - Payment Technician. You can click on the corresponding checkbox to select (click again to deselect) or click + to select all (press again to deselect).
  5. Press Select >> to choose a specific Status: Active, Inactive and Pending.
  6. Enter the appropriate Last Name and First Name into the available fields, if known. Press Select >> if you would like to limit the results to a specific type of Operator Role.
  7. Click on the appropriate radio button to select the Operator. Press OK to continue.
  8. The system returns to the initial Reassign Case Worker page displaying the results for the selected worker.
  9. Click Select >> to choose the name of the New Case Worker if reassigning a Family, to choose the name of a New Provider Worker if reassigning a Provider, or to choose the name of a New Payment Technician if reassigning a Payment.
  10. Click the check box(es) next to the Case(s) you would like to reassign.
  11. Press Reassign.
  12. The system prompts you to confirm reassigning. Press OK to proceed.

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Reassign Case Worker page, click here.

78.content:
Use the Administration > WPI Settings page to maintain the WPI (Warn, Prevent, Ignore) messages in the system. The messages are listed in numerical order by ID, which are also available in the messages themselves for easy look up. The WPIs are defined during KinderTrack initial deployment and cannot be added or deleted.

Edit WPI

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the WPI Settings page.
  3. Click on the Systemwide Default Settings and Locks checkbox if you would like to make changes and restrict other users to change the settings.
  4. Press Edit to open the fields for editing. Note that not all fields are editable, Locked fields cannot be edited. The system only enables those fields that can be modified.
  5. If available, press the Action drop-down arrow and make your selection.
  6. Make the necessary changes.
  7. Press Save.

↘️ List of WPI Settings

IDNameDescriptionLockedTypeParametersNOTES
1Password Same As User NameWhen operator's password is same as their username.NoIgnore
SSO
2Password Already In HistoryWhen operator's password has recently been used.NoIgnore
SSO
3Password Less Than Min LengthWhen operator's password contains less than the minimum number of characters.YesIgnorePassword Min Length:8SSO
4Password Less Than Min DigitsWhen operator's password contains less than the minimum number of digits.NoIgnorePassword Min Digits: 1SSO
5Password Same As Existing PasswordWhen operator's password is same as existing password.NoIgnore
SSO

79.content:
Use the Administration > RMR page to manage the Regional Maximum Rate (RMR) and effective dates for each district and Provider type. It is important to enter all the available RMR information accurately to ensure that payment calculation functions properly.

Add RMR

It is possible to create new RMR Rates for new Districts. In order to do it, the new District has to first be created using Administration > Tables page. Once the new District has been created:

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the RMR page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the District you would like to create RMR Rates for.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type you would like to add the Rates to. The system enables the Edit, Delete, History and Audit buttons.
  5. Press Edit.
  6. Enter the Effective Date or use the Calendar to select.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the RMR Status: Active or Inactive.
  8. Enter the Rates for the Provider Type in the newly created District.
  9. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  10. Press Save.

↘️ Edit RMR

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the RMR page. 
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select a District.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type.
  5. The corresponding RMR Rates for the selected District, Provider Type and Category display in the lower portion of the screen. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  6. Enter the Effective Date or use the Calendar to select.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the RMR Status: Active or Inactive.
  8. Make the necessary changes to the rates in each section.
  9. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  10. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete RMR Rates

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the RMR page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select a District.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type. The corresponding RMR Rates for the selected Region and Provider Type display in the lower portion of the screen.
  5. Press Delete to remove the Rates.
  6. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > RMR page, click here.

80.content:
Use the Administration > Quality Rates page to manage the Quality Rate groups and effective dates for each District and Provider type. It is important to enter all the available Quality Rates information accurately to ensure that payment calculation functions properly.

The rates for TRS (Texas Rising Star) and TSR (Texas School Ready) are displayed below. They are used in calculating payments. There are four grids for entry, one for each quality rate group. These include: TRS 2, TRS 3, TRS 4, and TSR. The rates are based on Time and Age Group. 

The times include: 1/2 Day Rates and Daily Rates. The age groups include: Infant 1, Infant 2, Toddler 1, Toddler 2, PreSchool 1, PreSchool 2, PreSchool 3, School Age 1, and School Age 2. 

↘️ Edit Quality Rates

It is possible to edit Quality Rates for new Districts. In order to do it, the new District has to first be created using Administration > Tables page. Once the new District has been created:

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Quality Rates page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the District you would like to create Quality Rates for.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type you would like to add the Rates to. The system enables the Edit, Delete, History and Audit buttons.
  5. Press Edit.
  6. Enter the Effective Date or use the Calendar to select.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Quality Rates Status: Active or Inactive.
  8. Enter the Rates for the Provider Type in the newly created District.
  9. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  10. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete Quality Rates

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Quality Rates page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select a District.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type. The corresponding Quality Rates for the selected District and Provider Type display in the lower portion of the screen.
  5. Press Delete to remove the Rates.
  6. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Quality Rates page, click here.

81.content:
Use the Administration > Copy Rates page to copy rates from one Provider to one or multiple providers at the same time. This feature is useful when a Provider has multiple sites with the same rates. It also allows you to copy the Regional Market Rate (RMR) to one or more Provider’s Rates.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Copy Rates page.
  3. Click on the radio button for Provider or Maximum State Rate to define which Rate category you would like to copy.
  4. If copying the Provider rate:
    • Press Select >> next to Provider to enter the appropriate parameters to search for the desired Provider.
    • Press Select >> next to Rate Type and click to choose the desired type.
  5. If copying the Maximum State Rate:
    • Press the drop-down arrow and select the Provider Type.
  6. Press Select >> next to Copy To and enter the appropriate parameters to search for the Provider you would like to copy the Rates to.
  7. Click on the check box next to the Business Name to select the Provider(s) you would like to copy to.
  8. The system returns to the initial Copy Rates page. The name of the selected Provider you are copying to appears next to Copy To. If you selected more than one Provider to copy the Rates to, you can view the list of recipients by positioning the cursor on top of the Provider name listed.
  9. Press Copy.

Note: If, after your selection, the Copy button is not enabled, verify that the Provider you are copying from has rates in the selected rate type.

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Copy Rates page, click here.

82.content:
Use the Administration > Districts page to assign selected zip codes to a specific District. In order to assign zip codes to a District, the codes first have to be set up in the Administration> Tables page. This page also allows you to assign selected School Districts to a specific District, provided the School Districts have first been set up in the Administration > Tables page.

Assign District Zip Codes and School Districts

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the District page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the District you would like to work with.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Effective Date for the settings to apply. Selecting the District populates the fields.
  5. Press Edit.
  6. Click on the Zip Codes Unassigned list to select the zip codes you would like to assign:
    • To select one zip code, click on the zip code you would like to assign.
    • To select multiple consecutive zip codes from the list, click on the first zip code then, holding down the left mouse button, drag it to the last zip code or click the first zip code, hold down the SHIFT key and click the last zip code you would like to assign.
    • Select multiple non-consecutive zip codes, click the first zip code, hold down the CTRL key, point and click to select the other zip codes you would like to assign.
  7. Once you have made the selection, click the appropriate arrow button to assign:Click the < button to assign the selected Zip Codes Unassigned to Zip Codes Assigned.
  8. Repeat the above directions to assign the selected School Districts Unassigned to School Districts Assigned 
  9.  Repeat the above directions to assign the selected Counties Unassigned to Counties Assigned.
  10. Press Save.

↘️ Unassign District Zip Codes and School Districts

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Districts page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Districts you would like to work with.
  4.  Press the drop-down arrow to select the Effective Date. Selection the District populates the fields.
  5. Press Edit.
  6. Click on the Zip Codes Assigned list to select the zip codes you would like to unassign:
    • To select one zip code, click on the zip code you would like to unassign.
    • To select multiple consecutive zip codes from the list, click on the first zip code then, holding down the left mouse button, drag it to the last zip code or click the first zip code, hold down the SHIFT key and click the last zip code you would like to unassign.
    • Select multiple non-consecutive zip codes, click the first zip code, hold down the CTRL key, point and click to select the other zip codes you would like to unassign.
  7. Once you have made the selection, click the > button to unassign:
  8. Repeat the above directions to unassign the selected School Districts Assigned to School Districts Unassigned.
  9. Repeat the above directions to unassign the selected Counties Assigned to Counties Unassigned.
  10. Press Save.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Districts page, click here.

83.content:
Use the Administration > Office Locations page to define your agency's different locations. The Office Locations prints information on many reports.

Add an Office Location

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Office Locations page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the Effective Date for the new location.
  5. Enter the information about the new office in the available fields.Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  6. It is in this page that the System Administrator will enter other information that will appear in pre-printed Notices, particular to each agency, such as contact information. These fields are customized prior to deployment.
  7. Press Save to create a new office location.

Note: If upon clicking Save, the information is incomplete or incorrect, you will receive one or more pop-up messages/WPIs letting you know what needs to be changed in order to save the record.

↘️ Edit an Office Location

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Quality Rates page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select a District.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Provider Type. The corresponding Quality Rates for the selected District and Provider Type display in the lower portion of the screen.
  5. Press Delete to remove the Rates.
  6. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Delete an Office Location

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the office location you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the office location from the system.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: Deleting an Office Location will not affect any other portion of the system.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Office Locations page, click here.

84.content:
Use the Administration > Alerts page to activate and define the parameters for all Alerts generated by the system. 

Note: 

  • Editing existing Alerts and creating new Alerts depends on the Alert Type selected and on that specific Alert. The Edit and New buttons are not always enabled.
  • Alerts are specific to Operator Roles. To set up Alerts specific to each Operator, go to the Operator > Operator Roles page.

New Alert

Creation of new Alerts depends on the selected Alert Type and specific Alert.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Alerts page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Alert Type.
  4. Press New.
  5. Enter the Description of the new Alert you are creating.
  6. Enter the Value 1 and Value 2 for the new Alert.
  7. Press Save.

↘️ Edit Alerts

The information available for editing depends on the selected Alert Type.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Alerts page.
  3. Alerts set by the System Administrator will be the default settings for all Regions. Individual Regions can modify their Alerts. However, if the System Administrator makes any changes to the settings and clicks on the Systemwide Default Settings and Locks checkbox, the new settings will override the locally made changes and the Region will not be able to modify the Alerts.
  4. Press the drop-down arrow to select an Alert Type.
  5. Press the Alert Type drop-down arrow to select the specific type of Alerts you would like to edit.
  6. Press the Alerts drop-down arrow to select the Alert you would like to edit.
  7. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  8. Make the necessary changes.
  9. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  10. Press Save.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Alerts page, click here.

85.content:
The Administration > Error Log page is a research tool used only by the software developers to examine the details of all errors received by KinderTrack users. It is for viewing only and cannot be edited.

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Error Log page, click here.

86.content:
The Administration > Logged On Users page is a view only research tool used by the software developers and cannot be modified. It provides details on the operators currently logged in to the system.

Upon selection of the Logged on Users page, the system automatically displays a list of all users currently logged in. Press Select next to the user you would like more information about to display the details.

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Logged On Users page, click here.

87.content:
The field values on the Administration > Site Settings page affect the internal operation of many KinderTrack functions and reports. Some of these values are set during deployment and cannot be changed, while others can be modified by the System Administrator. It affects the preferences that govern how the system functions. We recommend that changes to these settings be performed with technical assistance from knowledgeable KinderSystems personnel.

↘️ Edit Site Settings

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Site Settings page.
  3. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing. Use the scroll bar to the right to move to additional fields.
  4. Make the necessary changes.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Site Settings Fields

Setting Name

Description

Site Name

The Site Name cannot be modified since it is specific to the Client and set up during initial deployment

Agency GUID

The Agency GUID is a read only field used for background purposes. This unique identifier does not affect the system performance.

Passwords Saved in History

Enter the number of Passwords Saved in History that will prevent the user from repeating when changing a password.

Password Expiration (days)

Use the Password Expiration (days) field to enter the number of days a password can be used before the system forces the user to change it.

Password Warning (days)

Use the Password Warning (days) field to enter the number of days in advance when the system will start warning the user of the approaching password expiration.

Max Login Attempts

Use the Max Login Attempts field to set the maximum number of incorrect login attempts a user can make before being locked out of the system. Once this happens, only an Administrator has rights to verify identity and unlock the user.

 

Session Timeout Warning (mins)

The system default allows a user to remain logged in for two hours. However, it automatically closes (timeout) after an extended time of inactivity, forcing the user to log in again. There is a timer at the top right of the screen that indicates the amount of time remaining in the session. Use the Session Timeout Warning (mins) to set the number of minutes in advance when the system generated warning message starts blinking, letting the user know the amount of time left. The user can click on the warning to reset the timer and start the count-down again

Inactivate Months

Use to indicate the amount of time before a user will be inactivated due to no login activity.

Report Engine Mode

Press the drop-down arrow to select the Report Engine Mode indicating the type of reports that the system report engine generates.

Report Export Directory

Use the Report Export Directory field to indicate the name of the directory where reports to be exported are temporarily stored.

Report Export Path

Use the Report Export Path field to indicate the path to the directory where reports to be exported are temporarily stored.

Report Export URL

Use the Report Export URL field to indicate the location of the directory where the report export files have been created.

Report Export to Stream

Check the Report Export to Stream box to indicate whether to use streaming or normal file download to send the report file to the client’s browser.

Client Reports Path

Use the Client Reports Path field to indicate the path to the directory where the user defined reports created by the Clients are stored.

Report Server URL

Enter the Report Server URL to indicate the location where the system connects to the Report server to generate reports.

Report Server Report Path

Enter the Report Server Report Path to indicate the sub-directory on the Report server where the system stores reports.

Report Server Datasource Path

Enter the Report Server Datasource Path to indicate the location of the database sub-directory that the system uses to collect the data needed to generate reports.

Report Server Datasource Name

Enter the Report Server Datasource Name to indicate the name of the database that the system uses to collect the data needed to generate reports.

Extended Help File Path

Enter the Extended Help File Path to indicate the location of the folder where customer provided (extended help) documents or web resources such as tutorials, agency web pages, etc., are stored.

Extended Help File URL

Enter the Extended Help File URL to indicate the path to the location on your server where the Extended Help File resides.

Extended Help Max File Size (bytes)

Enter the Extended Help Max File Size (bytes) to indicate the maximum number of bytes allowed for an uploaded extended help file.

Extended Help File Types

Enter the Extended Help File Types to indicate the type of file extensions allowed for extended help files.

Max Records Returned

Enter the Max Records Returned to indicate the maximum number of records that a search can generate.

Maximum Number of Active Time Pairs

Specify the number of time pairs that can be entered on the Attendance Detail page for a child on a given day.

Max Popup Records Returned

Enter the Max Popup Records Returned to indicate the maximum number of search results returned from a popup search which takes place when the user selects unlimited options for a Search using the parameters available in Select >>, such as those identifying Providers, Calendars, and agency staff (e.g. Worker, Payment Technician, Appeal Contact). This field limits the number of options that can appear in the pop-up list that the system generates in response to the search.

Effective Date NewMode Default

Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the Effective Date NewMode Default that the system inserts into the Effective Date of a new record by default is Today’s Date or No Date. If No Date selected, the user enters the date.

Effective Date EditMode Default

Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the Effective Date EditMode Default that the system inserts into the Effective Date field of an edited record by default is No Date, Today’s Date or the already Existing Date previously assigned to the record. If No Date selected, the user enters the date.

Vendor Number

Enter the Vendor Number assigned to the agency which will appear in certain Reports, if required.

State Code

Enter the two letter code for the State in which the agency is located in the State Code field.

Age Out

Use the Age Out field to enter the age at which a normal child becomes ineligible to receive subsidized childcare.

Age Out (Special Needs)

Use the Age Out (Special Needs) field to enter the age at which a special needs child becomes ineligible to receive subsidized childcare.

Grade Effective Date

Enter the Grade Effective Date or use the Calendar button to select the date when the child has to be at certain school grade to participate in the program.

Temp File Upload Path

The Temp File Upload Path is an available location reserved for future expansion.

Starting Day-Of- Week

Press the drop-down arrow to select the Starting Day-Of-Week indicating the first day of the week for calculating payments.

Home Screen Message

Enter the message that you would like to appear in the Home page upon successful login. Click on the icon to spell check your entry.

Enable Attendance Scanning

If checked, the system will import attendance recorded from scanned attendance sheets.

Scanned Image URL

Use the Scanned Image URL field to indicate the location of where the scanned attendance is stored.

Scanned Image Retrieval Frequency

Enter the time frequency, in minutes, between retrieval of scanned images.

Scanned Image Retention Period

Enter the number of months that the system maintains a scanned image before deleting it.

Enable CCFS Checking

Check to enable the CCFS Checking when saving scheduled and setting payments to Paid status.

Homeless %

The state wide differential percentage for Homeless families.

Non-Traditional %

The statewide differential percentage for care provided during Non-Traditional hours.

Determine Region by County Instead of Zip

 Check to enable to determine a Region by County instead of a Zip Code.

Enable Internal SSO

Check to enable the internal SSO.

Enable Program Regions

Check to enable regions to create their own list of Programs. This will add a new currency field showing the total amount of the program to be added to the Program > Program page.

Enable Provider Registration

 Check to enable the Provider Registration.

Schedule by Hours Type

Check to enable scheduling by Hour Types.

Payment Details VersionEnter the number of Payment Details Version that the system creates
Auto Calculate Payments in AdvanceEnter the number of days the system auto-calculates payments in advance. 
Create Family Case NumbersCheck to enable the system to create Family Case Numbers.
Login Page DisclaimerEnter the Login Disclaimer Text that you would like to appear on the Login page. Click on the Showing the spell check icon.  icon to spell-check your entry. 
Close

↘️ Edit Generic Notice Settings

The field values for this section affect the Family > Notice page. Some of these values are set during deployment and cannot be changed while others can be modified by the System Administrator. It affects the preferences that govern how the system functions. We recommend that changes to these settings are only be performed with technical assistance from knowledgeable KinderSystems personnel.

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Site Settings page.
  3. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing. Use the scroll bar to the right to move to additional fields.
  4. Make the necessary changes.
  5. Press Save.
Setting NameDescription
Actions with Visible Notice NeedsSelect the Actions (Approval, Change, Denial, Discontinue, and Recertification) Visible Notice Needs you want to show up as options for the user.
Available Notice LanguagesSelect English, Spanish, or Vietnamese as the language of the Notice.
Rate Type VisibilitySelect which rates to show. You can pick between No Rates, NH (Normal Hours) Rates Only, NH Rates and AH Rates.
Add Fees to ScheduleIf checked, the system will add fees to schedule.
Rate Type PeriodSelect the Rate Type preferred. The options are Hourly, Daily, Weekly, or Monthly.
Family Fee CalculationSelect where you want the Family Fee Calculation to show. You can choose between the Family Fees page or the Eligibility Levels page.
Notice Web AddressEnter the web address ofthe site that the notice will be delivered.
Enable Electronic NoticeIf checked, the system will enable electronic notice delivery through KinderConnect.
Notice Parent Foreign Key LabelEnter the Parent Foreign Key page that will show up in Notices.
Close

↘️ Return SOS Import

The SOS Import runs automatically at 5:30 a.m. every day. In case of failure, it automatically runs again at 6:00 p.m. 

There are times where it might say that it ran successfully at 5:30 a.m., but it didn't. In this case, press the Rerun SOS Import button to schedule another rerun at 6:00 p.m.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Site Settings page, click here.

88.content:
1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment page.
  3. The previously selected Payment displays. If you would like to make the adjustment to a different payment, open the Payment > Search page to locate.
  4. Press Edit to enable all fields for additions or modifications.

Calculate

Press Calculate to calculate the amount of the Payment.

89.content:
Use the Administration > Family Fees page to set and maintain the rate schedules for Family Fees.

Edit Family Fees

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Family Fees page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow next to Family Fee Type and select the desired type. The system displays a list of all Family Fees of the selected Type.
  4. Click the radio button next to the Fee you would like to review.
  5. Press Edit to open the fields for editing.
  6. Enter the Effective Date or use the Calendar to select.
  7. Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the current Status is Active or Inactive.
  8. Click to select the appropriate checkbox to indicate if it is necessary to Check IEL (Income Eligibility Level) and/or Check AEL (Absolute Eligibility Level) for this Family Fee Type.
  9. To modify an existing Fee, click on the corresponding field(s) and make the necessary changes.
  10. To add a new Fee, press Add Row to create a new row at the end of the chart, then type the new Family Fee rates for each family size, if hourly, part-time, or full-time.
  11. Press Save.

↘️ Inserting and Deleting Rows

  1. Once you click on a radio button under to select a fee, the system enables the Insert Row and Delete Row buttons.
  2. If you would like to insert a new row at a different location, click on the radio button corresponding to the Fee that should follow the new insertion, then press Insert Row. Repeat as many times as necessary.
  3. If you would like to delete a row of the selected Family Fee Type, click on the radio button corresponding to the fee you would like to remove, then press Delete Row. Note: The system does not prompt you to confirm deletion. Repeat as many times as necessary.
  4. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete a Family Fee Type

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Family Fees page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select a Family Fee Type.
  4. Press Delete to remove the selected Family Fee Type.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Family Fees page, click here.

92.content:
The Administration > Attendance Codes is a feature used by Agencies to designate specific categories to attendance days, such as Present, Absent, Snow Day, Holiday, etc. The System Administrator can configure these attendance codes to be paid or unpaid as well as assign them to categories, or Attendance Groups, which define the frequency and number of days allowed in certain time periods. 

For example, an Agency can restrict payment of paid Absent days to a maximum of four per quarter. Once the Attendance Codes are defined here, the user can select them for each day on the Payment > Payment page.

The KinderConnect system, used for submitting attendance to KinderTrack, maps the KinderConnect attendance codes to the KinderTrack attendance codes.

Add an Attendance Code

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Attendance Codes page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the appropriate information into the enabled fields.
  5. Enter a Description for the new Attendance Code. This will act as a title for this new Attendance Code.
  6. Enter the Display Code. These are specific codes configured by the state.
  7. Enter the Display Color. These are specific hex values, configured by the state.
  8. Enter any Note that you would like to appear with this Attendance Code.
  9. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Status: Active or Inactive.
  10. Press Select >> to choose the Attendance Group you would like to assign the new Attendance Code to. (An Attendance Group must be configured on the Administration > Attendance Groups page before you will be able to assign it.)
  11. Click on the check box to indicate whether this is an Absent Attendance Code.
  12. If associated with a KinderConnect Code, press the drop-down arrow to select the code you to would like to associate it with.
  13. Check the appropriate check boxes to configure the Attendance Code for reporting and payment purposes.
  14. Press Save to create a new Attendance Code.

↘️ Edit an Attendance Code

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Attendance Codes page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Attendance Code you would like to modify.
  4. Press Edit to enable the fields and make the necessary changes.
  5. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  6. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Attendance Code

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Attendance Code you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Attendance Code from the system.
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: It is not possible to delete an Attendance Code if it has been previously used in a payment.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Attendance Code page, click here.

93.content:
Use the Administration > Attendance Groups page to define the number of days of a certain type of attendance that are allowed to be used in a specified length of time, such as four absences per month. The Attendance Groups need to be in place before creating Attendance Codes.

Add an Attendance Group

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Attendance Groups page.
  3. Press New to enable the fields for editing.
  4. Enter the appropriate information into the enabled fields. Red asterisk (*) indicates a required field.
  5. Enter a Description for the new Group.
  6. Enter the Max Days per Period to indicate how many times an Attendance Code can be used in a Period.
  7. Enter the Period Length to define the number of times within the Interval parameters that a code can be used in the group, for example, how many Intervals can be within a specific period.
    1. Example:
      • Max Days per Period: 10
      • Interval: Months
      • Period Length: 6
    2. This means that 10 of the defined days can be used in a 6-month period.
  8. Press the drop-down arrow to select the number of Units, whether Days, Months or Quarters.
  9. Press Save to create the new Attendance Group.
  10. Press the Start Date drop-down arrow to select the Start Date for the Group, whether: First Day of Fiscal Year or Today, if the current date.

↘️ Edit an Attendance Group

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Attendance Groups page.
  3. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Attendance Group you would like to modify.
  4. Press Edit to enable the fields and make the necessary changes.
  5. Press Save.
Close

↘️ Delete an Attendance Group

  1. Press the drop-down arrow to select the Attendance Group you would like to delete.
  2. Press Delete to permanently remove the Attendance Group from the system. 
  3. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.

Note: An Attendance Group cannot be deleted if it is currently assigned to an Attendance Code.

Close

To test your knowledge on the Administration > Attendance Group page, click here.

94.content:
The Reports > Reports page contains folders with reports organized by type. Each folder might contain multiple reports. 


Notes:

  • The reports listed below are shown for example only. The reports on your screen may differ based on the Operator Roles set by the System Administrator.
  • When entering the parameters to generate a specific report, if the Start Date entered is after the End Date entered, the system will issue a message informing you that The Start Date must be less than or equal to the End Date. Click OK if you would like to keep Start Date. Press OK if you would like to clear and re-enter the End Date, otherwise the Start Date will be cleared.

View Reports

  1. Press Reports under Reports.
  2. Select the Report you would like to generate. Reports are organized by type. Each folder might contain multiple reports.
  3.  Enter the criteria for the fields listed. Note: These will vary depending on the selected Report.
  4. Select the type of Output you would like to generate. Note: These will vary depending on the selected Report.
  5. Press Print to generate the report.

↘️ List of Reports

Report NameDescription
Administration Central Office
Absence NotificationThis report prints a list of cumulative absences that occur during eligibility period for child when threshold of 15 & 30 days of absence is reached. When the threshold of 40 days of absence is reached, set actions to be taken. Output is CSV.
Absence ActivityThis report prints a list of children that have multiple absences within a date range when the number is greater than the selected threshold. The user can limit the report to specific attendance codes. Records are grouped by region and sorted by family name. Output is PDF.
Active Schedules by FamilyThis report prints a list of all active schedules as of a given date for the families. It is grouped by region and sorted by family name, then child name. Output is PDF.
Average Cost of CareThis report provides average cost of care for programs by type of care and age group. Records are grouped by region, then program, then type of care. There is a subtotal for each region and a grand total for all regions. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Caseload ManagementFor the period selected, this report shows the monthly caseload figures for the specified caseworkers. It can be limited to specific programs. It is grouped by region, caseworker and program, with subtotals for each group and a grand total at the end. Output is PDF.
Cases by Program TypeThis report displays the following data for all active cases within the specified time period: Case Name, Case #, Child Name, CIN, Funding Type, Provider Type, Child Age, Auth To Date, Worker Name and ZIP Code. If a child goes to multiple providers, there is a separate record for each provider. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Child Care Children on Suspension ReportThis report specifies the children's count who are on suspension for the TWC staff. That would allow the board to be responsive and to reach back out to the family when the suspension was supposed to end. When there is a suspension, the referral is updated and TWC does not pay for these children anymore. They also have the option to suspend the referral while the family is out, in order to avoid to terminate the child for excessive absences.
Child Care Income Eligible ReportThis report shows the number of children in each eligibility ranking, based on income and family size. The rankings are expressed as percentages of the National Poverty Level. The percentages and Poverty Level figures are stored in a database table and can be adjusted. The report shows a count of the children in each ranking for each region, and each count is also expressed as a percentage of the total children served in the region, a percentage of the total children in that rank in all service areas, and a percentage of the total children of all ranks in all service areas. The counts can be of children who were eligible, children who attended care, or children for whom payments were made. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Child Care Program District ReportThis report shows total unduplicated families, children and costs for each region for the specified month, grouped by Program, report subtotals by Region, with grand total. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.style="width: 50.0000%;"
Child Care Program ReportThis report keeps track of child care funding streams. It shows YTD totals of unduplicated children, families and expenditures by program, for each payment month of the fiscal year. "Fiscal Year" is based on the service month, therefore the fiscal year that the bill was charged against. Thus, if care was provided in June 2016 (FY 2016) and payment was made in August, 2016 (FY 2017), the FY 2016 report would include the 8/2016 payment. There would be a row for 8/2016, even though that month isn't in the 2016 fiscal year. It has subtotals for Program and Region. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Child Care Providers ReportThis report computes the total number of child care providers paid per month by type of care. It is grouped and subtotaled by region and has a grand total. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Child Profile ReportThis report shows the number of children for whom payment has been made during the specified period, and the number of hours and cost for an entire fiscal year, grouped by program, region, type of care and age group. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Children and Providers ReportThis report displays the following data for all active cases within the specified time period: Case Name, Case #, Child Name, CIN, Funding Type, Provider Type, Child Age, Auth To Date, Worker Name and ZIP Code. If a child goes to multiple providers, there is a separate record for each provider. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Children Served by DC ModalityFor the specified period, this report shows the number of children served in each age group by each type of care. It has subtotals by District and Grand Totals. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Children with Multiple ProvidersThis report lists the children who have multiple schedules with different providers as of a specified effective date. Report is grouped by region, and then grouped by Family Name, and then grouped by Child Name. Output type is PDF.
Children with No AbsencesThis report retrieves a list of children of the selected providers for the date range specified who have no recorded absences. It also shows the total for each provider and for the region. Output type is PDF.
Families Over IncomeFor the specified districts and period, this report shows the cases that are over income. It shows the District, Case Name, Case Number, Notice Date, Annual Income and the Percentage Income To FPL. Output is Comma Delimited.
Family and Income LevelsFor the specified districts and period, this report shows the District, Case Name, Case Number, Income And Family Size for each family served during the period. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Family Listing by Need ReasonThis report lists families who received care during the specified period with the specified reason(s) for care. It shows the family, child, city, zip, caseworker, provider, program and contact information for the employer, doctor, etc. It has subtotals by District and Grand Totals. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Family Summary ReportFor the specified effective date, caseworker(s) and program(s), this report shows Caseworker Name, Alpha Code, Case Name, Case Number, Child Last, Child First, Child DOB, Auth Start, Auth End, Notice Effective Date, Provider Name, Vendor Number, Family Share Effective Date and Family Share. It can be grouped by Caseworker or Alpha Code. It has subtotals by Program and Caseworker. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
New Child in Child Care ListingThis report gives specification for New Children in Child Care From a First Referral Report, so that they can view the list of new children enrolled into child care from a first referral. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited, and HTML.
Payments with Consecutive AbsencesFor the specified districts and period, this report lists payments that included consecutive absences. The user can specify the minimum number of absences. It shows the District, Provider Name, Vendor Number, Case Name, CIN, Child Last, Child First, DOB, Age, Program, Payment ID, Cycle and Absence Date. It has subtotals by Provider and District and Grand Totals. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Percentage of Poverty by Case NumberThis report lists families and their level of poverty compared to the federal poverty level for each family’s size. The comparison is based on the family’s income as of the service date. Case information on the report includes Case Name and #, Address, Family Size, Gross Income, Federal Poverty Level, Poverty Percentage, Program Type, Auth From Date, Auth To Date, Recertification Date, Last Transaction Date, Unit ID and Worker ID. It can be sorted by Poverty Percentage, Case Name, Case Number Or Income. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Program ActivityThis report shows enrollment activity per district for the case managers, programs selected for the date range specified. Report is grouped by each region, then by program. Report subtotals by each region, and then grand total. Output is PDF.
Provider Rates and Market Rates ReportThis report displays the number of providers whose rates for each age group are below market rate, at market rate, or enhanced rate. These are the rates actually paid to the providers, not necessarily the providers’ listed rates. The counts are grouped by type of care, then totaled for each district. Grand totals for all selected districts are displayed at the end. Output is PDF.
Provider Summary with Children ServedThis report shows children with active schedules within the date range, for the programs selected, for providers who are located within the districts selected, whose payment technicians are selected. If this report is being run for a user who can select multiple districts, payment technician’s parameter can be left blank to return all the districts selected. The report groups on region, then program, and then provider. Subtotals are shown for region and program, with grand total. Output is PDF.
Quality Child Care Provider ReportsThis report shows any provider with a Quality Rating regardless of whether they have subsidy children or not. Output is PDF, Comma Delimited, and HTML.
Recertification ReportThis report returns a listing of families whose recertification date falls within the date range of the report. It can be used by caseworkers as a checklist when working through their caseloads for recertifications due within a time period. Report groups by caseworker and sorted by Recert Date, then by Case Name.Output is PDF.
TEA Student ID Assignment ReportThis report shows a list of eligible children with or without Texas Education Agency Student ID assigned. Output is PDF, Comma Delimited, and HTML.
Web Submittal Providers ReportThis report shows the count of attendance submittals by each provider. It can show web submittals only, timesheet submittals only, or both. It has subtotals by submittal type, provider, provider type and district, and grand totals. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
WPI Override Reportstyle="width: 50.0000%;" There are certain events that the system will either warn about, prevent entirely, or ignore, depending on the "WPI" (Warn, Prevent, Ignore) settings. If an event is set to "Warn and Log," the operator can override the warning, but that override will be logged in the system. This report displays overrides that occurred during the specified period. The report groups by operator name, and then groups by WPI date and time. Output is PDF.
Payments
Additional Family FeesThis report lists all families with Additional Family Fees during a period. It shows the Family Name, Case Number, Child Name, Provider Name and #, Type of Additional Fee, Fee Start and End Dates, Fee Amount and Amount per Week. It grouped and sorted by district. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Additional Payment ReportThis report lists information about various additional payments that are for something other than child care, including: Activity Fee, Differential Bonus, Meals, Registration, School Closure, Transportation Fee, Other. Output choice is PDF.
Annual Child Care Spending History by MonthThe report will list each program on it's own page, grouped by type of care, with columns by month which display the number of payments and total payment amount, by month, for 12 months including the month of the start date. The user may filter by program and may select 1 program, many programs or all programs. The report output is PDF.
BICS by BatchThis report shows payments for the current operator’s district for the batches selected. The user is prompted for a date range for populating a multiselector of batches whose assignment to the batch fell within the date range specified. It can be sorted by Vendor Number or Provider Name. It has subtotals by Provider and District and Grand Totals. Output is PDF.
BICS by Date RangeThis report shows payments that will be exported to BICS, payments that have been exported to BICS, and then what is returned post submittal from BICS for the current operator’s district, for the date range selected. It can be sorted by Vendor Number or Provider Name. It has subtotals by Provider and District and Grand Totals. Output is PDF.
Cumulative Back Payment DetailThis is a Nassau County specific report and only runs for Nassau County. This report returns payment detail information for the operator’s district for any payments for previous billing cycles that were set to authorized for the billing cycle specified. The report prints in triplicate by design with a predefined order for vendor number. It shows the Attendance Cycle, Auth Number, Last Name, First Name, Case No., CIN No., Service Type, Days Paid, Hours Paid, Minutes Paid, Payment ID, Max Auth, Trans Fee Paid, Gross Pay, Parent Fee, Child Support Deduction, Net Payment and Net Payment & Trans Fee. It has provider totals for Days Paid, Transportation Paid, Hours Paid, Gross Payment, Child Support Deductions, Parent Fee, Net Payment and Net Payment with Tran. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Family Fees by FamilyThis report returns all the family fee information and agency payment amount for payments paid within the specified period for the programs selected. It is grouped by Region, then Program, then Family. It has subtotals for Family, Program and Region and a grand total. Output is PDF.
Family Fees by Family or ProviderThis report will return all the family fee information for payments paid within the current operator’s district for the period specified for the programs selected. It can be run by Family or Provider. Output is PDF, Comma Delimited, or HTML.
Family Fees by ProviderThis report returns all the family fee information and agency payment amount for payments paid within the specified period for the programs selected. It is grouped by Region, then Program, then Provider, then Family. It has subtotals for Program, Provider and Region and a grand total. Output is PDF.
Hours Claimed DiscrepancyThis report lists clients who claimed too many or too few hours over or under the authorized number during the specified period. If the discrepancy is greater than the limit specified in the region's Hours Claimed Discrepancy setting, it will be shown on this report. Optionally, the report can be limited to specific workers who approved the payments. The user can choose to show only claims that are too high, too low, or both. The data can be sorted by Family or Provider. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Invoice Processing Time ReportThis report lists how long it took to pay an invoice after the attendance was recorded and calculated. It includes all paid payments that were originally calculated between the Start and End dates. The report lists the average number of days it took a worker to process invoices. If the Details parameter is selected, the report shows the details of each individual payment. Results can be limited to payments that took more than a specified number of days. Output choices are PDF, Comma Delimited and HTML.
Nassau BICS Payment RosterThis is a Nassau County specific report and only runs for Nassau County. This report returns BICS payment information for the operator’s district for any recipients authorized to receive daycare between the specified Payment Month Start and End Dates with a paid payment as of the report date. The report is run from the Reports\Payment page. The report is grouped by Provider ID, then Roster Number, Sorted Provider Vendor Number ascending, Roster Number Ascending, Child Last, Child First Name Ascending. Output is PDF.
Overridden PaymentsThis report lists all the overridden payments for the date range specified. The report is grouped by region and sorted by Period Start Date, then Payment ID. It has subtotals for region and the grand total. Output type is PDF.
Payment Adjustment ReportThis report shows adjustments made to payments during the period specified in the selected districts. It shows the Payment ID, Adjustment ID, Note, Provider Name, Child Last, Child First, Original Payment Amount, Adjustment Amount and Adjusted Total. It has subtotals by District and Grand Totals. Output is PDF.
Payment by Parent ListingThe Payment by Parent report returns all the payment information for payments paid within the month and year selected, for the type of care selected, for the families who are assigned to the case managers selected and located in the city and zips selected. It can be run for single parent or two parent families. The report is grouped by region, program, and parent ID. It is further sorted by parent name, then child name. The report totals by region, program, with grand total. Output type is PDF.
Payment by Provider ListingThis report will return all the payment information for payments paid within the payment month and year selected, for the type of care selected, for the providers who are assigned to the case managers selected. The report is grouped by region and override date and sorted by Payment ID. The report totals by provider, program, region, with grand total. Output type is PDF.
Payment DetailsThis report returns payment detail information for paid payments that were made during the date range specified when run from the Reports\Payment page. The report returns payment detail information for payments selected by the operator in the payment grid on the Payment\Search, Family\Payments and or the Provider\Payments page. The report is also launched from the Payment\Summary page for the working payment for the operator. The following are displayed in red: Overridden payments, split week from a previous payment, payment adjustments, and additional payments. The report is grouped by region, provider, and payment ID. Report totals by provider, region, with grand total. Output type is PDF.
Payment ExportThis report shows payments that will be exported to BICS, payments that have been exported to BICS, and what is returned post submittal from BICS for the current operator’s district, for the service month and year selected. The user can select Export Status of Check Sent, Response Processed, Exported, or All. This report can be sorted by Vendor Number or Provider Name. It has Provider Subtotals, District Subtotals and Grand Totals. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Payment OverrideThis report returns a list of overridden payments where the date of the override falls between the start and end date specified. It shows both the operator who originated the payment and the one who overrode it. The report is grouped by region and override date, then sorted by Payment ID. It totals by region, with grand total. Output type is PDF.
Payment Pre-Exportstyle="width: 50.0000%;" This report helps Districts determine what will and will not be uploaded to BICS before they run the export. The purpose of the Pre-Export report is to list:
  • Payments that if set to paid would export to BICS.
  • Payments for which payline exist, but payments would not export.
  • Paylines that exist where there is no matching CCTA payments in KinderTrack.
  • CCTA payments that exist in KinderTrack where there are no matching paylines.
The user can select the payment status (Paid, Authorized or Both). It can be sorted by Vendor Number or Provider Name. It has subtotals by Provider and District. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Payment SummaryWhen run from the Reports\Payment page, this report returns summary information for payments that were paid during the date range specified. When run from the Payment\Search, Family\Payments and or the Provider\Payments page, it returns information for payments selected by the operator in the payment grid. It is also launched from the Payment\Summary page for the working payment for the operator. The following are displayed in red: Overridden payments, split week from a previous payment, payment adjustments, and additional payments. It is grouped by Region then Provider or Operator, as selected, then sorted by Parent Name, Child Name, and Period Start Date. Output type is PDF.
Twice Monthly Payment DetailThis is a Nassau County specific report and only runs for Nassau County. This report shows payment detail information for the operator’s district for any payments authorized for the payment month specified as of the date the report is run, when run from the Reports\Payment page. Allowed Absences Used shows absences used for the cycle. Disallowed Absences were recorded, but exceeded the allowance, for the cycle. Remaining Days shows the remaining allowance after taking into account any absences for this period. This report prints in triplicate by design with a predefined order for vendor number. It has subtotals by Case then Provider. Output is PDF.
Provider
Active Providers Agreement ListingThis Report prints lists the District, Provider Information, a Foreign key to align with the provider source system, Agreement Start and End Dates, Intake Status with Intake Open and Closed Dates, and whether the Closed end date is withing 30 days.
Active Schedules By ProviderThis report prints a list of all active schedules as of a given date for the selected provider. This report can be run for one, some, or all providers within an operator’s office location.
Currently Active Providers ListingThis report lists all providers who are active in the selected districts as of the date the report is run. It shows the Provider Type, Provider ID and Provider Name. It is grouped by District, then Provider Type. It has total counts for provider type and district, and grand total counts. Output choices are PDF and Comma Delimited.
Provider GIS CoordinatesThis report lists providers and their addresses, including longitude and latitude. The report is based on the listing of providers selected in the search queue. It can also be run from the Reports / Provider page, where the location can be restricted by selecting minimum and maximum coordinates and/or ZIP code. The geographic coordinates are from the Provider Attributes page. The report shows the Provider Name, Contact, CCFS ID, Vendor #, Address, City, State, ZIP, Y Coordinate and X Coordinate. Output choices are PDF and Tab Delimited.
Provider Over Capacity by AttendanceThis report shows providers who had actual attendance that exceeded their capacity during the specified period. It shows the district, name of worker who authorized the schedule that put the provider over capacity, provider name, date of care that attendance was exceeded, name and age of child whose attendance put the provider over capacity, and the attendance hours. It is grouped by District, then Worker. Output type is PDF.
Provider Over Capacity by ScheduleThis report shows providers who had enrollment that exceeded their capacity during the specified period, based on the number of scheduled hours. It shows the district, name of worker who authorized the schedule that put the provider over capacity, provider name, date of care that attendance was exceeded, name and age of child whose attendance put the provider over capacity, and the attendance hours. It is grouped by District, then Worker. Output type is PDF.
Provider Report with Rate ScheduleThis report lists the rates for providers who provided services within the specified period. It shows their Normal, After Hours and Special Needs rates for each age group, as well as the % difference between each rate and the corresponding market rate. It also shows the number of children enrolled for each age group. Output choices are Tab Delimited and HTML. It can be run from the Provider / Search or Reports / Provider pages.
 Provider with Multiple CCFS IDsThis report is for state users. Providers can have multiple CCFSIDs in the same District (Region) and also across multiple Districts (Regions) OCFS needs a way to be able to identify this condition and have records returned for a Provider who could exist in more than one District (Region) with multiple IDs. Output choices are Comma Delimited and HTML.
 Provider Attendance ReportThis report lists what the districts need to review attendance records for providers. This report displays the attendance details for cases for the selected provider within the date range selected. It is designed to be run for only one case at a time. Report can be run in detail or summary.
State Federal
 ACF801 Child Care and Development Fund Case LevelThis mandatory monthly federal report is a delimited text file with the raw data on families receiving care during a specified month. It displays one line per family with all children on the same line. Each child is delimited by the letter "C," and each setting is delimited by the letter "S."If Random Sample is selected, KT4 will first determine the unduplicated number of qualifying cases for the month. That number will be divided by 200 to get the sampling interval (n). The system will generate a random number between 1 and the sampling interval. That random number will be the starting point for the sample. That case and every nth case will be selected. If Random Sample is not selected, all the qualifying records for the selected region(s) are returned. Output is Tab Delimited, Fixed Width or HTML.
 ACF 800 ReportThe ACF-800 report, data must include all families, children, and providers served by the CCDF, regardless of funding stream (Discretionary, Mandatory, Matching, State Match, Maintenance of Effort, and Transfers from Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Program). As of FY2020, this funding also includes COVID-19 supplemental CCDF monies appropriated by the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act, Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations (CRRSA) Act, and the American Rescue Plan (ARP) Act. For States that pool CCDF and non-CCDF Funds, the data also must include all children funded by these sources. The ACF-800 and ACF-801 reports should be based on the same population.
Therefore, all families, children, and providers included in the monthly ACF-801 data files should also be included in this report. All counts should reflect the period that begins October 1 and ends September 30. Each State and Territory must submit the ACF-800 by December 31, reporting on services provided during the preceding Federal Fiscal Year. Output is PDF, Tab Delimited, Fixed Width, Html.
Close

Note: To view details on a specific report, log in to KinderTrack and find the desired report in the table on the following link: Report Details.

To test your knowledge on the Reports > Reports page, click here.

96.content:
With all the rules and flexibility, reimbursement to Providers can be very complex. Since you will occasionally want to discover what conditions resulted in certain calculations, KinderTrack offers a simplified view of how they were performed in the Payment Trace section. 

The Trace is composed of several types of rows, each conveying information that affects the calculation.

↘️ Payment Trace Descriptions

Day PaidDisplays if they were in attendance. This will display 0 if absent or 1 if they are attending. 
Total Hours EnteredDisplays the total hours of attendance entered. 
Scheduled HoursDisplays the expected scheduled hours of attendance. 
ContractedDisplays if the provider is contracted or not. A contracted provider is one who has an agreement with the State to provide subsidized care.
Rate TypeDisplays different rates based on Provider’s different profiles. This includes hourly, 1/2 day, daily rate, weekly rate. 
Type of CareDisplays what type of care the provider offers. This includes Corporate Provider, Licensed Center, Licensed Child Care Home, Licensed Youth Camps, Military, Out of State, Registered Child Care Home, Relative Care Listed Home, Relative in Child's Home. 
Agre GroupDisplays the Age Group of the child. This includes Four Age Groups that currently have Rates: Infant = 0 to < 18 months Toddler = 18 months to < 3 years Preschool = 3 to < 6 years School Age = 6 to <= 13 years. 
Capped Used Rate is Provider Daily Full Time Regular HoursDisplays the rate that is used to pay the provider. They wont get paid after the amount of hours shown. 
Net Daily PaymentDisplays the net paid for a day from the span of a week. 
Close

Period

The Period row reflects all payment settings that remain unchanged throughout the entire payment period.

The first line reflects start and end dates of the period, the child’s date of birth, and the program (or funding source). The second line reflects all of the calculator options applied toward the calculation as configured in Administration > Region Settings. 

Schedule 

Since a single payment may cover multiple schedules, the Schedule row reflects the characteristics that are applied to the days of that schedule. The Schedule row appears before the start date. 

The single line of the Schedule row reflects the start and end dates of the schedule within the payment period, an indication that the Provider is either Licensed or Exempt, the Provider category, and whether the schedule is Varying or Fixed. It also reflects whether the Enforce Max Hours flag has been set (Varying Schedule) and displays the Max Weekly Hours. 

Rate Type

Rate Type 

Attendance Hours 

Rate Name 

LT 

0-6.9999 

Hourly 

PT 

7-24.9999

Part-Time 

FT 

25-60

Full-Time 

GT 

60+ 

Over 


Category 

D Rated/Non-Rated 

E Rated/Non-Rated 

F Rated/Non-Rated 

Weekly and Total

The Weekly and Total rows reflect a summary of the days contained within the week or period, respectively. A Weekly row appears after each week. The Total row appears at the end of the payment period.

The single line of a Weekly or Total row reflects the accumulated durations for scheduled time-pairs, attendance time-pairs, payable care, and the portion of payable care that is considered overtime (the number of hours that exceeded the Full Time Plus threshold). This row also reflects the accumulated Applied Amounts of days within each of these periods. 

Daily

The Daily row reflects actual computations that determine the amount of reimbursement that is applied on a daily basis. There is one row for each day of the period, including days in previous periods that may impact the amount applied. Each row is divided into two or more lines, described below.

  1. All three columns of the first line are populated with (a) the date being examined, (b) the daily status, the Attendance Code, the child’s age group, and durations of scheduled time-pairs, attendance time-pairs, and payable care, and (c) the calculated amount that is applied to the reimbursement. 
  2. The second line reflects one of two conditions:
    • If the daily status or attendance code caused a zero dollar reimbursement for this day, the second line displays a diagnostic message indicating in greater detail the reason for the lack of reimbursement.If the diagnostic message is displayed neither the Rate nor RMR computations are displayed, otherwise: 
    • The second line displays the computation used in determining the reimbursement amount based on the Provider rates. It includes: 
      1. Scale of the rate: Full-time (FT), part-time (PT) or overtime (OT). 
      2. Rate interval: Monthly, Weekly, Daily, Hourly/Daily or Hourly. 
      3. The after-hours (AH) indicator, if applicable. 
      4. The monetary charges associated with the rate. Hourly and PT Hourly/Daily charges are reflected as the hourly amount multiplied by the payable care duration (e.g. $3.00 x 4:00). 
      5. The number of payable days in the interval (for Monthly and Weekly intervals, only). 
      6. The computed amount of the rate, attributable to that day.
  3. The third line displays the computations used in determining the reimbursement amount based on the RMRs. 
    • Scale of the RMR: Full-time (FT) or part-time (PT). 
    • Rate interval: Monthly, Weekly or Hourly/Daily. 
    • The monetary charges associated with the rate. PT Hourly/Daily charges are reflected as the hourly amount multiplied by the payable care duration (e.g. $3.00 x 4:00). 
    • The after-hours multiplier, if applicable, specified as “ x 1.125 AH” or “ x 1.250 AH”. 
    • The overtime amount and its formula, if applicable, specified as “$xx.xx OT (hh:mm x $d.dd),” where, xx.xx is the computed overtime amount, hh:mm is the duration of overtime, and d.dd is the Hourly RMR charge. 
    • The number of payable days in the interval (for Monthly and Weekly intervals, only). 
    • The computed amount of the RMR, attributable to that day. 
  4. If the amount applied is neither based on the Provider rates or RMRs, the fourth line displays the basis for reimbursement (i.e. Requested Payment, Payment Override, or Payment Adjustment). The attributable amount per day is computed by dividing the amount by the number of payable days of care in the payment period. The least of lines 2, 3, or 4 is highlighted and is reflected in the Applied Amount column, indicating the amount reimbursed to the Provider.

18.name: Q19_GettingtoKnowKinderTrack
