270.content:
Use the Administration > District Settings page to set preferences that govern how the system functions within a specific region. Some of these values are set during deployment and cannot be changed, others can be modified by the System Administrator. 

Edit a Region Setting

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar. 
  2. Open the District Settings page

278.content:
Use the Administration > District Settings page to set preferences that govern how the system functions within a specific region. Some of these values are set during deployment and cannot be changed, others can be modified by the System Administrator. 

Edit a Region Setting

  1. Select the Administration activity from the Navigation Bar. 
  2. Open the District Settings page.
  3. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  4.  Make the necessary changes.
  5. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  6. Press Save.

↘️ District Settings Fields

FieldDescription
DistrictThe name of the selected District displays. This field cannot be edited. 
Effective DateEnter the effective date or use the calendar to apply the settings. 
Family Fee Collection ByPress the drop-down arrow to select whether the Family Fee Collection is done by the Provider or by the County. 
Additional Family Fee Collection By Press the drop-down arrow to select whether the AdditionalFamily Fee Collection is done by the Provider or by the County.
Fixed Payment CycleClick the check box to indicate whether the District operates on a Fixed Payment Cycle. 
Billing Cycle Start Date

Enter the Billing Cycle Start Date or use the Calendar button to select. 

Waive Family Fee End Date

Enter the Wave Family Fee end date, or use the Calendar button to select. 

Flags

Press Select >> to choose any Flags that apply to the Region.

Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) Use the Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed in the case of childcare provided during non traditional hours. 
State Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) Use the State Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed in the case of childcare provided during non traditional hours for the State. 
Total Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) Use the Total Non Traditional Hours Increase (%) field to indicate the total percentage increase that is allowed in the case of childcare provided during non traditional hours. 
Accredited Provider Increase (%) Use the Accredited Provider Increase (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed if a provider is flagged as accredited. 
Homeless Lic/Reg (%) If the family is homeless and the provider is Licensed or Registered, use the Homeless Lic/Reg (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed. 
Homeless LE (%) If the family is homeless and the provider is Legally Exempt, use the Homeless LE (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed. 
State Homeless Lic/Reg (%) If the family is homeless and the provider is Licensed or Registered, use the State Homeless Lic/Reg (%) field to indicate the percentage increase that is allowed for the State. 
Total Homeless Lic/Reg (%) Use the Total Homeless Lic/Reg (%) field to indicate the total percentage increase of a family that is homeless and the provider is Licensed or Registered. 
Daily Limit Default (Fixed Schedules) Press the Daily Limit Default (Fixed Schedules) drop-down arrow to select if the default limits when creating a fixed schedule (not varying) is the Number of Hours or Absolute. 
Vendor Number Enter the Vendor Number. 
Normal Hours Start Time Enter the Normal Hours Start Time indicating the beginning of the normal hours period used to determine the correct Provider Rates. 
Normal Hours End Time Enter the Normal Hours End Time indicating the end of the normal hours period used to determine the correct Provider Rates. 
Fiscal Year Month Start Press the drop-down arrow to populate the Fiscal Year Month Start field with the month when the fiscal year starts for the for the District. 
Hours Claimed Discrepancy (%) Enter the Hours Claimed Discrepancy (%) to set the percentage of discrepancy allowed in the District before a provider shows up in a discrepancy report. 
Recertification Due Date Use the Recertification Due Date field to indicate the number of days before the Family Recert Date (as it appears on the Family page) when the paperwork must be submitted to avoid cancellation. 
Recertification Notice Generation Days Use the Recertification Notice Generation Days field to indicate the number of days before the Recertification Due Date (above) when the system creates a recertification notice.
Transportation Fee If the district reimburses the providers for transportation costs, use the Transportation Fee field to enter the amount, per day, that will be added to the provider payment for that service. The provider must indicate they have provided transportation on the timesheet for this amount to be added. 
Pay Additional Absences for Contracted Click the check box to Pay Additional Absences for Contracted. 
Pay Additional Absences for Types of Care Press Select >> to choose any Types of Care to Pay Additional Absences for. 
Need Reasons Click the Need Reasons selector to indicate the specific need reasons that are used by the region. These need reasons will then appear in the Need Reason drop-down on the Family Needs page. 
Timesheet Disclaimer Use the Timesheet Disclaimer field to enter the default text to appear in the timesheets generated for the District. Click to spell check your entry. 
Certificate Disclaimer 

Use the Certificate Disclaimer field to enter the default text to appear on the certificates generated for the District. Click to spell check your entry. 

Enable Attendance Scanning Click the check box to Enable Attendance Scanning. 
Reject if Missing Signature Click the check box to Reject if Missing Signature.
Reject if Suspect Attendance Click the check box to Reject if Suspect Attendance.
Part Time Hourly Threshold Enter the hours indicating the Part Time Hourly Threshold. 
Family Appeal Window Enter the Family Appeal Window indicating how many days a family has to appeal the decision. 
Payment Disclaimer Use the Payment Disclaimer field to enter the default text to appear in the payment generated for the District. Click to spell check your entry. 
Close

↘️ Delete a District Setting

  1. Press Delete to permanently remove the settings of a District from the system
  2. The system prompts you to confirm deletion. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Region Settings History

To review a detail of all changes made to the District Settings: 

  1. Press History. 
  2. A table listing the History of the all changes made to the District Settings displays. If necessary, use the vertical and horizontal scroll bars to view additional records and columns. The details of the currently selected DistrictSettings display on the lower portion of the screen. 
  3. Click on the corresponding radio button to select the District Settings that you would like to modify. 
  4. Press Edit. The system activates all fields for revisions. Make the necessary changes.
  5. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  6. Press Save to return to the History page.
  7. Press Exit History. 
Close

↘️ Intake Settings

The Intake Settings section can be found at the bottom of the District Settings page. This section determines in how many days the application statuses will expire. Depending on the entered days, applications will show up on the Intake > Application page until they expire.

  1. Open the District Settingspage.
  2. Press Edit to enable the fields for editing.
  3. Make the necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.

Field

Description

Import - Require Case Worker

Click the check box to Require a Case Worker.

Intake - Waitlist Expiration

Enter the number of days an application status can be in the Waitlist status for. When an application status has been in this status for X number of days, this application is removed from the list.

Intake - Full Application Expiration

Enter the number of days an application status can be in the Full Application status. When an application status has been in this status for X number of days, this application is removed from the list.

Intake - Not Eligible Expiration

Enter the number of days an application status can be in the Not Eligible status. When an application status has been in this status for X number of days, this application is removed from the list.

Intake - Not Recertified Expiration

Enter the number of days an application status can be in the Not Recertified status. When an application status has been in this status for X number of days, this application is removed from the list.

Close

279.content:
The Intake > Recertification page allows Case Managers to view the applications for Recertification in KinderTrack, as well as the supporting documentation (images, PDFs, etc) prior to import. This will allow informed decisions on whether to reject or accept them. Automatic message will be sent when status is changed.

Use the Intake > Search page to search for Recertification Data in the KinderWait database.

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Recertification page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child or Family.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Click the Detail link of the Child, Parent, or Family Application you want to view.
  6. KinderTrack automatically redirects you to the Application page. The application information and documents are displayed. The information is divided in different sections: Household, Family, Parents, Children, Forms, and Messages.:
  7. Click on the Document links to review the documents uploaded.

Update Status

  1. Select the Intake activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Recertification page.
  3. Enter the appropriate search criteria in the available fields. You may search by Parent, Child, or Family.
  4. Press Search to display the results.
  5. Select the check box of the Child, Parent, or Family you want to update the status for.
  6. Click on the Update Status button.
  7. When clicking the Update Status button, the multi-selector will allow selection of statuses. Note: Only statuses that can be manually set are available. These include Recertified, Pending Recertification, Not Recertified, and Not Eligible. 
  8. Select on the Status you want to change. Press Change Status. 

Read a Message

  1. To review the full message, select the radio button of the desired message.
  2. The selected message will be highlighted in yellow and displayed in the Message Body section.

Send a Message

Intake users or Case Managers will be able to send communications to the Applicants application intake portal from KinderTrack.

  1. Press New Message to send a message to the application family.
  2.  Type message in the Message Body.
  3. If you wish to clear the subject, press Cancel. This will clear the message field and the screen will return to View state.
  4.   After finalizing the message, press Send.  
  5. The system will display a message stating that your message sent successfully.

280.content:
Use the Provider > Fiscal Info page to enter, maintain and view financial information for a provider. The page is also used to manually reprocess payments and stop payments, depending on Operator roles and permissions.

↘️ Provider Fiscal Info

Field Name

Description

Tax Name

Displays the name the provider uses for tax purposes.

 

Tax ID

Displays the identification number of the provider. The Tax ID can be used to locate other provider records sharing the same Tax ID. If existing, they will display on the lower portion of the page.

Tax Type

Displays the type of Tax the provider is assessed.

Tax Address 1 Tax

Address 2 City / State / Zip Code

 

 

Displays the address corresponding to that provider tax name.

Tax Date Verified

Displays the date when the Tax ID was last verified.

EFT Status

Displays the current status of the Electronic Fund Transfer.

Bank Account Number

Displays the provider’s bank account number. If this information changes, any payments being held are automatically reprocessed.

Bank Routing Number

Displays the routing number of the provider’s bank account. If this information changes, any payments being held are automatically reprocessed.

Bank Name

Displays the name of the provider’s bank. If this information changes, any payments being held are automatically reprocessed.

EFT Type

Displays the type of Electronic Fund Transfer or Warrant. If this information changes, any payments being held are automatically reprocessed.

Last Updated

Displays the date when the bank account number, bank routing number, bank name or the EFT type was last modified.

Close

↘️ Edit Fiscal Info

  1. Select the Provider activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Fiscal Info page.
  3. Press Edit and make the necessary changes.
  4. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  5. Press Save.
  6. The system informs you that it will reprocess the payments. Press OK to proceed.
Close

↘️ Reprocess Payments

Reprocessing payments will cause KinderTrack to manually reprocess any held payments. The reprocess button will disappear once pressed or if it has been triggered automatically.

  1. Press Reprocess Payments.
  2. The system schedules payments to be re-processed. Press OK to proceed.

Note: In normal circumstances, if the Provider updates its bank information, it triggers KinderTrack to automatically reprocess payments. In the even payments need to be processed manually, pressing the Reprocess Payments button will manually trigger the process. The Reprocess Paymentsbutton will disappear once it has been pressed or if it has been triggered automatically.

Close

↘️ Stop Payments

Stop Payments will stop all payments from being processed for the selected provider until the Reprocess Payments button is pressed. The Payment Status will show Stopped once the Stop Payments button is pressed.

  1. Press Stop Payments.
  2. The system informs you that it has stopped all payments. Press OK to proceed.

Note: In normal circumstances, if the Provider updates its bank information, it triggers KinderTrack to automatically reprocess payments. If the Stop Payments button is pressed, updates to the bank information will not trigger automatic reprocess of payments. Only pressing Reprocess Payments will allow the payment to be reprocessed.

Close

↘️ EFT Status Audit

The EFT Status Audit provides the history of all changes made to an EFT Status, whether caused by payments or by changes on banking information and/or when a user manually stops or starts a payment.

  1. Press EFT Status Audit.
  2. The system displays a table listing all changes made to the EFT Status for the selected Provider.
Close

To test your knowledge on the Provider > Fiscal Info page, click here.

284.content:
Payment Adjust

The Payment Adjustment is a separate payment tied to an existing one that will increase or decrease the authorized paid amount for any reason. For example, to make a correction if the Provider forgot to enter attendance. Note: Only payments on Paid status can be adjusted.

  1. Select the Payment activity from the Navigation Bar.
  2. Open the Payment page.
  3. The previously selected Payment displays. If you would like to make the adjustment to a different payment, open the Payment > Search to locate.
  4. Press Adjust.
  5. The system prompts you to confirm that you want to create a payment adjustment. Press OK to proceed.
  6. The Payment page now shows a totally different Payment ID. It activates the Edit button on the top ribbon.
  7. Press Edit to enable all fields for additions or modifications.
  8. Enter any notes relevant to the Adjustment.
  9. You can make adjustments to In and Out times. You can also press the drop-down arrow to make other selections:

Note: Absent and Professional Day do not require In and Out time pairs.

  • Click on C to clear the existing information for the selected date.
  • You can use the automatically populated time pairs if they are correct, or you can enter the hours of attendance manually for each day. You can also clear the attendance and populate the entire schedule using the fields available between the Show Attendance check box and the top of the grid. Enter the desired hours, then press Fill. Each time- pair reflects when care begins and ends.
  • Click Add to create an additional time pair for the selected date.
  1. Click Select >> next to Change Reason to choose the reason for making the changes or type a new one.
  2. Press Calculate.
  3. Under Show Payment Summary, review the adjusted Payment Amount. This section will also show the Previous Provider Amount for comparison.
  4.   To override the Previous Provider Amount with the adjusted Payment Amount, press Override.
  5. Press Save.

331.content:
IMPORTANT

You have selected that you have an additional issue. Please select the option that best fits your situation:

  • Additional Issue: Your additional issue is related to an activity page that you have NOT previously selected.
    • Example: if you have previously selected Family as the activity page that the issue is mainly about and you wish to submit an issue for the Reports activity page now.
  • Same Activity Page Issue: Your additional issue is about the same activity page you previously selected. 
    • Example: if you have previously selected Family as the activity page that the issue is mainly about, and you wish to submit another issue for the Family activity page.
